original: rang byung gi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba yin te gzhan la rag ma lus shing gzhan gyi rkyen gyis byung ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rang byung gi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba yin te gzhan la rag ma lus shing gzhan gyi rkyen gyis byung ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of self-arising is the perfection of wisdom. This shows that this perfection of wisdom is the mastery of all dharmas, not dependent on another, not arisen by the conditions of another.

original: chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i dbang gis chos thams cad bstan gyi chos gzhan rnams kyi dbang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa ma yin no zhes bya
analyzed: chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i dbang gis chos thams cad bstan gyi chos gzhan rnams kyi dbang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa ma yin no zhes bya
translated: Because of mastery over all dharmas. This shows that all dharmas are taught by the power of this perfection of wisdom, and that this perfection of wisdom is not taught by the power of other dharmas.

original: ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: sangs rgyas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chos thams cad thugs su chud pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chos thams cad thugs su chud pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the Buddha is the perfection of wisdom. This shows that this perfection of wisdom has the nature of comprehending all dharmas.

original: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because all phenomena are fully and completely awakened in all aspects.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs par shes par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs par shes par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the perfection of the buddhas because it is the cause for knowing all mundane and supramundane phenomena in all aspects and for bringing them to completion.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u sum cu pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u sum cu pa'o /
translated: This was the thirtieth chapter on the perfection of wisdom in the commentary on the perfection of wisdom in one hundred thousand lines.

original: // / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: // / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, thought this and so on.

original: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di shin tu zab pa brgya byin gyis thos nas /
analyzed: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di shin tu zab pa brgya byin gyis thos nas /
translated: Having heard this perfection of wisdom, which is very profound in the manner explained above, Śatakratu

original: de lta bu'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos pa dang / 'dzin cing 'chang ba la sogs pa dkon pa bstan pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos pa dang / 'dzin cing 'chang ba la sogs pa dkon pa bstan pa'i sgo nas /
translated: This teaching on the rarity of hearing, retaining, and so on of this profound perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di dkon zhing mos par dka' ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di dkon zhing mos par dka' ba bstan pa ste /
translated: teaches that this profound perfection of wisdom is rare and difficult to believe.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo gang gi rna lam du grag pa de dag ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bsnyen bkur byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo gang gi rna lam du grag pa de dag ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bsnyen bkur byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those sons and daughters of good family in whose presence this perfection of wisdom is being taught, they have served the Victors of the past.

original: bsod nams chung ngus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ming dang tshig tsam yang rna lam du thos par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bsod nams chung ngus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ming dang tshig tsam yang rna lam du thos par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Those of little merit will not even hear the mere name and words of this perfection of wisdom.

original: sngon 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das @69b rnams la bsnyen bkur byas pa rnams kyis ming dang tshig tsam thos par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sngon 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das @69b rnams la bsnyen bkur byas pa rnams kyis ming dang tshig tsam thos par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Those who hear the mere name and words have served the Blessed Buddhas of the past.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sems can gang gi rna lam du grag pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sems can gang gi rna lam du grag pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those sentient beings in whose presence this perfection of wisdom is being taught, they have planted wholesome roots under the Tathagatas.

original: da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byas shing dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byas shing dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams kyis /
translated: Those who have served the Tathagatas of the present and planted wholesome roots,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ming dang tshig tsam thos par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis thos par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ming dang tshig tsam thos par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis thos par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: they will hear the mere name and mere words of this profound perfection of wisdom, but others will not hear it. This is the meaning.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sems can gang gi rna lam du grag pa de dag ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sems can gang gi rna lam du grag pa de dag ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those sentient beings in whose presence this perfection of wisdom is being taught, they have been taken hold of by the spiritual friend.

original: theg pa chen po'i don phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyi rna lam du grag par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i don phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyi rna lam du grag par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan
translated: Those who are assisted by spiritual friends who teach the profound perfection of wisdom without error will hear this profound perfection of wisdom, but others will not even hear it mentioned.

original: pa'o // gang 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: pa'o // gang 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Those who uphold and possess it, up to

original: de bzhin nyid du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nan tan du byed pa lta ci smos te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nan tan du byed pa lta ci smos te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: those who practice the perfection of wisdom in accordance with reality, what need is there to speak?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i ming dang tshig tsam thos pa yang de ltar dkon na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i ming dang tshig tsam thos pa yang de ltar dkon na /
translated: Up to this point, it shows that it is rare to even hear the mere name and words of this perfection of wisdom.

original: don phyin ci ma log par rtogs shing nyams su len pa lta ci smos zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don phyin ci ma log par rtogs shing nyams su len pa lta ci smos zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: What need is there to speak of realizing and practicing its meaning without error?

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas /
translated: Sons or daughters of good family who, having heard this perfection of wisdom,

original: mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur ba dag gis /
analyzed: mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur ba dag gis /
translated: do not fear, are not terrified, and do not tremble,

original: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la yongs su dris so yongs su zhus so zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di legs par mnyan cing the tshom
analyzed: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la yongs su dris so yongs su zhus so zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di legs par mnyan cing the tshom
translated: “I have asked the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas of the past” means that in the past I listened well to this perfection of wisdom and had doubts removed.

original: med par byas pa rnams kyis thos nas 'jigs shing skrag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: med par byas pa rnams kyis thos nas 'jigs shing skrag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: “In the past, I asked questions of the tathāgatas, the worthy ones, the perfectly awakened buddhas” indicates that those who have listened well to this perfection of wisdom in the past and have made it free of doubt will not be afraid when they hear it.

original: smos shing dad par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis de ltar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //🔽rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: smos shing dad par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis de ltar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o // rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They will speak about it and have faith in it, but others will not.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /🔽tshe rabs snga ma la bskal pa du @70a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni / tshe rabs snga ma la bskal pa du @70a * //
translated: “The sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who hear this perfection of wisdom” up to “they have practiced the perfection of wisdom” indicates

original: mar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad cing goms par byed pa rnams /
analyzed: mar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad cing goms par byed pa rnams /
translated: that those who have practiced and become familiar with the six perfections for many eons in previous lives🔽will not be afraid when they hear this perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas /
translated: Having heard this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: 'jigs shing skrag par mi 'gyur la mos shing dad par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis de ltar mi nus so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs shing skrag par mi 'gyur la mos shing dad par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis de ltar mi nus so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: they will not be frightened or terrified, but will believe in it and have confidence in it. Others will not be able to do so.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the Blessed One:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas kyang mos par bgyi bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas kyang mos par bgyi bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Having heard this profound perfection of wisdom, they will not be able to believe in it.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyan pa dang nyams su len pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' phal pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyan pa dang nyams su len pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' phal pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Those who listen to and practice this perfection of wisdom are not ordinary bodhisattvas.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang 'dra ste /
translated: They are like irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: tshe rabs snga ma la pha rol tu phyin pa drug ma spyad pas /
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma la pha rol tu phyin pa drug ma spyad pas /
translated: Because in their previous lives they did not practice the six perfections,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo 'di la dpyod cing mos par mi nus so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo 'di la dpyod cing mos par mi nus so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that they are unable to investigate and believe in this profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas /
translated: Blessed One, those sons or daughters of good family who, having heard this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: spangs par sems pa dag gis ni sngon gyi mtha' yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di spangs par gyur te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: spangs par sems pa dag gis ni sngon gyi mtha' yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di spangs par gyur te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: think of abandoning it, have already abandoned this profound perfection of wisdom in the past, and so on up to🔽have not asked and not inquired about how the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha are to be cultivated.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad ni ji ltar bsgom par bgyi zhes yongs su ma zhus yongs su ma dris so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos na ma dad cing ma mos la skur🔽ba 'debs pa dag ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad ni ji ltar bsgom par bgyi zhes yongs su ma zhus yongs su ma dris so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos na ma dad cing ma mos la skur🔽ba 'debs pa dag ni /
translated: Those who, having heard this profound perfection of wisdom, have no faith and no belief, and deprecate it,

original: tshe rabs snga ma la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la ma dad ma mos shing skur ba btab pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas pa dang /
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la ma dad ma mos shing skur ba btab pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas pa dang /
translated: It is the result of not having faith in, not having confidence in, and denigrating this perfection of wisdom in former lives, and of not having served the buddhas, bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams ji ltar spyad cing bsgom pa ma mnyan ma dris pa'i lan to zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams ji ltar spyad cing bsgom pa ma mnyan ma dris pa'i lan to zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and of not having listened to and not having asked about the practice and meditation of the dharmas from the six perfections up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.”

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mos par mi 'gyur ba lta ngo mtshar kyang ci che zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes @70b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rab tu zab pas sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la spyad cing goms par
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mos par mi 'gyur ba lta ngo mtshar kyang ci che zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes @70b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rab tu zab pas sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la spyad cing goms par
translated: The passage up to “How amazing!” shows that because this perfection of wisdom is so profound, one must have previously trained in and become familiar with the conduct of the bodhisattvas.🔽

original: byas pa nyung zad cig dad cing mos par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: byas pa nyung zad cig dad cing mos par 'gyur gyi /
translated: “What is so amazing about that?” is the statement that since this perfection of wisdom is so profound, only a few will have faith and interest in it, having practiced and become familiar with the conduct of the bodhisattvas in the past.

original: sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la ma spyad cing goms par ma byas pa rnams /
analyzed: sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la ma spyad cing goms par ma byas pa rnams /
translated: Those who have not practiced and become familiar with the conduct of the bodhisattvas in the past🔽will not have faith and interest in this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos shing dad par mi 'gyur ba lta ngo mtshar kyang ci che zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos shing dad par mi 'gyur ba lta ngo mtshar kyang ci che zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: What is so amazing about that?”

original: 'dis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This also teaches that this perfection of wisdom is profound and difficult to have faith in.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu zab pa'i don brgya byin gyis rtogs nas shes rab kyi pha
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu zab pa'i don brgya byin gyis rtogs nas shes rab kyi pha
translated: having realized the meaning of the perfection of wisdom’s extreme profundity,

original: rol tu phyin pa la dad pa chen po skyes te phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa la dad pa chen po skyes te phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: having given rise to great faith in the perfection of wisdom,🔽he bows to the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal ba de ni /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal ba de ni /
translated: He who bows to the perfection of wisdom🔽bows to the wisdom of omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la phyag 'tshal ba'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ba'i phyir rgyu la phyag byas na 'bras bu la yang phyag byas par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la phyag 'tshal ba'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ba'i phyir rgyu la phyag byas na 'bras bu la yang phyag byas par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that since the wisdom of omniscience also arises from this perfection of wisdom, if one bows to the cause, one also bows to the result.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes las kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brjod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes las kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brjod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Then the Lord said to Śatakratu, Lord of the Gods, up to “The perfection of wisdom is also expressed from the knowledge of a knower of all aspects.”

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa'i don bcom ldan 'das kyis gsal bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa'i don bcom ldan 'das kyis gsal bar bstan pa ste /
translated: The meaning of what Śatakratu said was clarified by the Lord.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes 'byung la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes 'byung la /
translated: The knowledge of a knower of all aspects comes from the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'byung bas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'byung bas /
translated: And having attained the knowledge of a knower of all aspects, the teaching of the perfection of wisdom comes about.

original: 'di gnyis gcig gi rgyu gcig yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ba bden no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis gcig gi rgyu gcig yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ba bden no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since these two are the cause of each other, it is true that by paying homage to the perfection of wisdom, one pays homage to the knowledge of a knower of all aspects.

original: koo shi ka thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /🔽dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos shes @71a * //
analyzed: koo shi ka thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba nas / dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos shes @71a * //
translated: A son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who wants to stand in the knowledge of all bases should stand in the perfection of wisdom.🔽A son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who wants to stand in the knowledge of the knowledge of paths should stand in the perfection of wisdom.🔽A son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who wants to stand in the knowledge of all aspects should stand in the perfection of wisdom.🔽A son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who wants to stand in the knowledge of all bases should stand in the perfection of wisdom.🔽A son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who wants to stand in the knowledge of all bases should stand in the perfection of wisdom.🔽A son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who wants to stand in the knowledge of the knowledge of paths should stand in the perfection of wisdom.🔽A son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who wants to stand in the knowledge of all aspects should stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa thob par bya ba dang /🔽bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / sems can rnams nyan thos kyi 'bras bu bzhi dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub la dgod pa dang /
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa thob par bya ba dang /🔽bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / sems can rnams nyan thos kyi 'bras bu bzhi dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub la dgod pa dang /
translated: A son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who wants to stand in the knowledge of all bases should stand in the perfection of wisdom.🔽A son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who wants to stand in the knowledge of all

original: khams gsum gyi phul du 'gyur bar bya ba dang / bdud pham par bya ba dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu bar bya ba'i rgyu yin pas /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi phul du 'gyur bar bya ba dang / bdud pham par bya ba dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu bar bya ba'i rgyu yin pas /
translated: and to become the best in the three worlds, and to defeat Mara, and to gather the community of monks,

original: dngos po de dag sgrub par 'dod na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brtson par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po de dag sgrub par 'dod na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brtson par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and if one wishes to accomplish those things, one should strive in this perfection of wisdom.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: When this had been said, Sakra, Chief of Gods, said to the Lord:

original: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la brtson par bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la brtson par bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: How, when one courses in the perfection of wisdom, does one exert oneself in the 18 special attributes of a Buddha?

original: gong du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa dang ; lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi ye shes sgrub par 'dod pas /
analyzed: gong du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa dang ; lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi ye shes sgrub par 'dod pas /
translated: Above, the Blessed One said, One who wishes to abide in omniscience should abide in the perfection of wisdom, and One who wishes to accomplish the wisdom of the knowledge of the aspects of the path should exert oneself in the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnas par bya ba dang / brtson par bya ba de ji ltar gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar brtson par bya ba bcom ldan 'das la brgya byin gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnas par bya ba dang / brtson par bya ba de ji ltar gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar brtson par bya ba bcom ldan 'das la brgya byin gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: Śakra asked the Blessed One how one should abide and exert oneself in that abiding and exertion.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: koo shi ka de ltar khyod de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la don 'di yongs su dri bar sems pa legs so legs so //
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar khyod de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la don 'di yongs su dri bar sems pa legs so legs so //
translated: Kauśika, it is excellent, excellent that you think to ask the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One about this meaning.

original: koo shi ka khyod kyi spobs pa 'di yang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: koo shi ka khyod kyi spobs pa 'di yang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Kausika, this eloquence of yours has arisen through the Buddha's blessing.

original: brgya byin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar brtson par bya ba bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa don ma nor bar legs par zhus so zhes bstod pa ste /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar brtson par bya ba bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa don ma nor bar legs par zhus so zhes bstod pa ste /
translated: This is the praise of Sakra's question to the Lord as to how one should stand in and exert oneself in the perfection of wisdom, and of his correct question without error.

original: de ltar legs par zhus pa bstod pa @71b dang ; de ltar zhu ba'i spobs pa skyes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi mthu dang byin gyi rlabs yin par bstan pa yang /
analyzed: de ltar legs par zhus pa bstod pa @71b dang ; de ltar zhu ba'i spobs pa skyes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi mthu dang byin gyi rlabs yin par bstan pa yang /
translated: The demonstration that the arising of the eloquence of such a question is the power and blessing of the Lord is

original: 'khor rnams yid ches shing dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor rnams yid ches shing dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to generate confidence and faith in the assembly.

original: koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe gzugs la mi gnas te /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe gzugs la mi gnas te /
translated: Here, Kausika, when the Bodhisattva, the great being, courses in the perfection of wisdom, he does not stand in form,

original: gang gi tshe gzugs la mi gnas pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs la mi gnas pa de'i tshe /
translated: and when he does not stand in form,

original: gzugs la brtson par byed do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs la brtson par byed do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: From “he exerts himself in form” up to

original: gang gi tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi gnas pa de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la brtson par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ji ltar gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar brtson par bya ba zhus pa'i lan bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi gnas pa de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la brtson par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ji ltar gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar brtson par bya ba zhus pa'i lan bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ste /
translated: “when he does not stand in the knowledge of all modes, then he exerts himself in the knowledge of all modes,” the Lord has answered the question about how one should stand and how one should exert oneself.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas /
translated: Since form, etc., up to the knowledge of all modes, are not ultimately established as existent things,

original: de dag la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing dmigs pa'i tshul du mi gnas pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de dag la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing dmigs pa'i tshul du mi gnas pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin zhing /
translated: not apprehending them as signs, not standing in the manner of an objective support, is itself standing in the perfection of wisdom.🔽And that itself is the exertion in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gang la gnas par bya ba dang / gang la brtson par bya ba de lta bu'i gzugs mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gang la gnas par bya ba dang / gang la brtson par bya ba de lta bu'i gzugs mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Kauśika, it is because such a form that one could stand in and exert oneself in is not apprehended,” and so on, up to “such a knowledge of all aspects that one could stand in and exert oneself in is not apprehended.”

original: gang la gnas par bya ba dang / gang la brtson par bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la mi gnas pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /🔽brtson pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gang la gnas par bya ba dang / gang la brtson par bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la mi gnas pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing / brtson pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reason that not standing in form and so on is standing in the perfection of wisdom and exerting oneself in it.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med cing dmigs su med pas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med cing dmigs su med pas /
translated: Because all phenomena such as form and so on are ultimately unreal and not apprehended,

original: gang la yang gnas par bya ba dang dmigs par bya ba'i dngos po de lta bu yod par mi lta zhing mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa dang brtson pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang la yang gnas par bya ba dang dmigs par bya ba'i dngos po de lta bu yod par mi lta zhing mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa dang brtson pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he does not see and does not apprehend any such thing as a real entity that is to be attended to and to be objectified.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs la mi sbyor mi 'byed de /
analyzed: gzugs la mi sbyor mi 'byed de /
translated: they do not join with form and do not separate from it.

original: @72a * // gang gi tshe gzugs la mi sbyor mi 'byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: @72a * // gang gi tshe gzugs la mi sbyor mi 'byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When they do not join with form and do not separate from it,

original: gzugs la brtson par byed do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs la brtson par byed do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: then they exert effort with regard to form.

original: gang gi tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi sbyor mi 'byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi sbyor mi 'byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When they do not join with the knowledge of all aspects and do not separate from it,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la brtson par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad de na dam par dngos po med pas de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir brtson par yang mi byed /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la brtson par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad de na dam par dngos po med pas de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir brtson par yang mi byed /
translated: Up to “he strives in the knowledge of all modes” shows that he does not strive to establish all dharmas, form, etc., because they are not things in the ultimate sense.🔽He does not even reject them, because he does not establish them.

original: mi sgrub pa'i phyir spang bar yang mi byed pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi sgrub pa'i phyir spang bar yang mi byed pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: That is why he strives in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽gzugs sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / gzugs sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so //
translated: Because, when the Bodhisattva, the great being, courses in the perfection of wisdom,🔽he does not apprehend form in the past,

original: gzugs phyi ma'i mthar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs phyi ma'i mthar mi dmigs so //
translated: he does not apprehend form in the future,

original: gzugs dbus su mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dbus su mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir brtson par byar med🔽spang bar yang byar med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs dbus su mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dbus su mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir brtson par byar med spang bar yang byar med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage from “form is not apprehended in the middle” up to “the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended in the middle” teaches the reason why one should not strive to accomplish or abandon all phenomena such as form, because ultimately they are non-entities.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po zhig yod na dus gsum las sngon gyi mtha'am /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po zhig yod na dus gsum las sngon gyi mtha'am /
translated: If all phenomena such as form and so forth were entities, it would be logical that they would exist and be apprehended in the three times, either in the past,

original: phyi ma'i mtha'am /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'am /
translated: in the future,

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus na yod cing dmigs pa'i rigs na yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis brtags na dus gsum char du yang dngos po yod par mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus na yod cing dmigs pa'i rigs na yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis brtags na dus gsum char du yang dngos po yod par mi dmigs pas /
translated: or in the present. However, when they are examined with correct wisdom, they are not apprehended as existing in any of the three times.

original: de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir brtson par yang mi byed /
analyzed: de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir brtson par yang mi byed /
translated: Therefore, one should not strive to accomplish them.

original: mi sgrub pa'i phyir spang bar yang mi byed do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi sgrub pa'i phyir spang bar yang mi byed do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And because they are not accomplished, one should not abandon them either.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the Lord...

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid zab pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid zab pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: up to: Śāradvatīputra, the perfection of wisdom is deep because of the deep suchness of the knowledge of all modes.

original: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dus gsum du dmigs su med par ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni sems can thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin zhing rtogs pa dang yid ches par dka' ba'i phyir zab bo zhes gsol
analyzed: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dus gsum du dmigs su med par ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni sems can thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin zhing rtogs pa dang yid ches par dka' ba'i phyir zab bo zhes gsol
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom, which teaches that all dharmas, form, etc. are not apprehended in the three times, is deep because it is not the domain of all beings, and is hard to realize and hard to believe.

original: pa dang / bcom @72b ldan 'das kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin de bzhin nyid ni mngon sum du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /🔽de ltar ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang / bcom @72b ldan 'das kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin de bzhin nyid ni mngon sum du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /🔽de ltar ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The Lord has shown that the perfection of wisdom is deep because the suchness of all dharmas, form, etc. is not directly perceived.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gting dpag dka' ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gting dpag dka' ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is hard to fathom…”

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra, because omniscience is hard to fathom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gting dpag dka' ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gting dpag dka' ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is hard to fathom.”

original: zab pa'i don nyid rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir gting dpag dka' ba bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zab pa'i don nyid rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir gting dpag dka' ba bshad pa'o //
translated: This explains that it is hard to fathom because it is profound in meaning, and it is taught by another enumeration.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di tshad ma mchis so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di tshad ma mchis so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is immeasurable…”🔽“Śāradvatī­putra, because omniscience is immeasurable, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable.”

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshad med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gting dpag dka' ba'i don de nyid tshad med pas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshad med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gting dpag dka' ba'i don de nyid tshad med pas bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that the meaning of “hard to fathom” is immeasurable.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas /
translated: Since all phenomena such as form and so on are ultimately not things,

original: grangs dang tshad 'di tsam mo zhes brtag tu med pa'i phyir gting dpag dka'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: grangs dang tshad 'di tsam mo zhes brtag tu med pa'i phyir gting dpag dka'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is difficult to fathom their depth because they cannot be examined and said to be this many or that many in number or size.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He asks, “Blessed One, how do bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom?”

original: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med de zab cing gting dpag dka' ba dang / tshad med pa yin pas thams cad kyi spyod yul du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med de zab cing gting dpag dka' ba dang / tshad med pa yin pas thams cad kyi spyod yul du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: In the manner explained above, all phenomena are ultimately not things, and so they are profound and difficult to fathom and are immeasurable, and thus they are not the domain of everyone.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de bzhin du zab cing gting dpag dka' la tshad med pa yin pas thams cad kyi spyod yul du mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de bzhin du zab cing gting dpag dka' la tshad med pa yin pas thams cad kyi spyod yul du mi 'gyur na /
translated: Since the perfection of wisdom is also like that, being profound, difficult to fathom, and immeasurable, it is not the domain of everyone.

original: byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyad par bya zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa'i thabs sh'a ri'i bus zhus pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyad par bya zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa'i thabs sh'a ri'i bus zhus pa'o //
translated: Śāriputra asked, How should a bodhisattva practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Śāradvatīputra, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gal te gzugs zab ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do @73a * //
analyzed: gal te gzugs zab ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do @73a * //
translated: if they do not engage with the notion that 'form is profound,' they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: gal te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid zab ces bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: if they do not engage with the notion that 'the knowledge of all aspects is profound,' they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas zab par 'du shes shing rnam par rtog pa med na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod pa'i tshul gyis spyod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas zab par 'du shes shing rnam par rtog pa med na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod pa'i tshul gyis spyod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If one has the idea that all phenomena such as form are profound because ultimately they are empty of intrinsic nature, and if one is without discursive thought, one practices the perfection of wisdom in the manner of not practicing.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs kyi zab pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi zab pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i🔽bar du ni /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs kyi zab pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi zab pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, the profundity of form is not form, and so on up to the profundity of omniscience is not omniscience.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la zab pa'i 'du shes med cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la zab pa'i 'du shes med cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reason why one practices the perfection of wisdom without the idea of profundity and without discursive thought with regard to all phenomena such as form.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad zab ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad zab ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa la bya ste /
translated: The profound of all phenomena such as form and so forth is to be taken as non-entity.

original: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa ma yin pas rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa ma yin pas rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: That non-entity does not exist as the intrinsic reality of form and so forth, and thus is not an object of conceptualization. This is the teaching.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Śāradvatīputra, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gal te gzugs gting dpag dka' zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gal te gzugs gting dpag dka' zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: if they do not engage with the idea that form is difficult to fathom, then they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: gal te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gting dpag dka' zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gting dpag dka' zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
translated: If they do not engage with the idea that the knowledge of all aspects is difficult to fathom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: then they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas gting dpag dka' ba'i 'du shes kyang med cing rnam par mi rtog na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas gting dpag dka' ba'i 'du shes kyang med cing rnam par mi rtog na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since all phenomena such as form are empty by nature, there is also no notion of their being difficult to fathom, and if one is nonconceptual, one practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs kyi gting dpag dka' ba gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs kyi gting dpag dka' ba gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, that which is difficult to fathom in form is not form, and so on up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gting dpag dka' ba gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gting dpag dka' ba gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: that which is difficult to fathom in omniscience is not omniscience.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la gting dpag dka' ba'i 'du shes med cing rnam par mi rtog @73b pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la gting dpag dka' ba'i 'du shes med cing rnam par mi rtog @73b pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: The absence of the notion of all phenomena such as form being difficult to fathom, and being nonconceptual, is the teaching of the reason why one practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad gting dpag dka' zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad gting dpag dka' zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All phenomena such as form are said to be difficult to fathom.

original: dngos po med pa la bya ste dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa ma yin pas rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la bya ste dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa ma yin pas rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: This refers to the absence of entities. That which is the absence of entities does not exist as the intrinsic nature of form and so on, and so is not an object of conceptualization.

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is taught that non-conceptuality itself is the practice of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽gal te gzugs tshad med do zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / gal te gzugs tshad med do zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽if they do not practice thinking, “Form is immeasurable,” they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: gal te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshad med do zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshad med do zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: If they do not practice thinking, “The knowledge of all aspects is immeasurable,” they practice the perfection of wisdom.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas tshad med do zhes bya ba'i 'du shes kyang med cing rnam par mi rtog na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas tshad med do zhes bya ba'i 'du shes kyang med cing rnam par mi rtog na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If one has no perception of form and so on are immeasurable and is non-conceptual, one practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs kyi tshad med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs kyi tshad med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Śāradvatīputra, that which is the immeasurability of form is not form, and so on up to

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshad med pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: that which is the immeasurability of omniscience is not omniscience.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la tshad med pa'i 'du shes mi 'byung zhing rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs🔽bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la tshad med pa'i 'du shes mi 'byung zhing rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs🔽bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reason why the perception of the immeasurability of all phenomena such as form does not arise and one practices the perfection of wisdom without conceptualization.

original: gzugs la sos pa'i chos thams cad tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sos pa'i chos thams cad tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la bya ste /
translated: All phenomena that are based on form are called “immeasurable,” which means that they are non-existent.

original: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa ma yin pas rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa ma yin pas rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: That which is non-existent does not exist as the nature of form and so forth, and therefore is not an object of conceptual thought.

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning is that non-conceptuality itself is the practice of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāradvatīputra said:

analyzed: kye ma bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni de ltar zab bo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Oh Bhagavān, this perfection of wisdom is so profound…” up to “…

original: tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes @74a * //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes @74a * //
translated: will properly pay attention to it.”

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di theg pa chen po la gsar du zhugs pa theg pa chen po'i don goms par ma byas pa rnams la bshad na skyon du 'gyur ba dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bshad na yon tan du 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di theg pa chen po la gsar du zhugs pa theg pa chen po'i don goms par ma byas pa rnams la bshad na skyon du 'gyur ba dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bshad na yon tan du 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /
translated: It shows that if this profound perfection of wisdom is explained to those who have newly entered the Great Vehicle and have not become familiar with the meaning of the Great Vehicle, it will be a fault, and if it is explained to irreversible bodhisattvas, it will be a virtue.

original: des kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar zab pas thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar zab pas thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, it shows that this perfection of wisdom is so profound that it is not the domain of all.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then, Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra...

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang dka' ba de lta bu'i gnas yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: ...up to It is difficult to attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bshad na snod du ma gyur pa la chos zab mo bshad pa'i nyes pa'i dmigs zhib tu rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bshad na snod du ma gyur pa la chos zab mo bshad pa'i nyes pa'i dmigs zhib tu rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching that if this profound perfection of wisdom is explained to a bodhisattva who is new to the vehicle, then the faults of explaining the profound Dharma to one who is not a suitable vessel should be carefully analyzed and taught.

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa zhes bya ba nas /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du lung bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du byang chub sems dpa' theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa la don zab mo 'di mi bshad pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa zhes bya ba nas / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du lung bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du byang chub sems dpa' theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa la don zab mo 'di mi bshad pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang
translated: Śakra said...🔽up to you will receive a prophecy of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. This teaches that in order not to explain this profound meaning to a bodhisattva who is new to the vehicle, the perfection of wisdom should be explained to irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: chub sems dpa' rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad par bya'o zhes bstan pa theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: chub sems dpa' rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad par bya'o zhes bstan pa theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa yang ma yin /
translated: It shows that one who is new to the vehicle is not suitable to be taught the perfection of wisdom, and that one who is irreversible is suitable to be taught.

analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa yang ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo 'di bshad na mi 'jigs mi skrag cing snod du 'gyur ba de lta bu yod dam zhes dris pa dang / de lta bu yod de theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa yang ma yin la phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang ma yin pa kha cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo 'di thos nas mi 'jigs mi skrag cing myur du
translated: If this profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom is explained to bodhisattvas who are neither irreversible nor newly entered into the vehicle, will there be any who are not frightened or terrified and become a vessel for it?

analyzed: lung bstan pa'i skal ba can dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that there are some who, having heard this profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom, are not frightened or terrified and quickly become vessels for it, who are neither newly entered into the vehicle nor irreversible bodhisattvas, and who are destined for prophecy.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa ma yin la /
translated: ...they have attended upon many buddhas.

analyzed: phyir mi ldog @74b pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i snod du 'gyur ba yod pa'i don gong du bshad pa nyid 'khor rnams yid ches par bya ba'i phyir bcom
translated: The meaning explained above that there are bodhisattvas who are not irreversible and who are vessels for this profound perfection of wisdom is stated again for the sake of inspiring confidence in the retinue.

original: ldan 'das kyis gtan tshigs dang bcas par zhib tu bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ldan 'das kyis gtan tshigs dang bcas par zhib tu bshad pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the above explanation that there are bodhisattvas who are not irreversible bodhisattvas and who are vessels for this profound perfection of wisdom is stated in detail by the Bhagavān with reasons in order to make the retinue have faith.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāradvatīputra said,

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i dpe gsol bar bdag gis spobs so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i dpe gsol bar bdag gis spobs so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Bhagavān, I have the courage to give an example of that.”🔽“Those sons of a good family and those daughters of a good family should be known as irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par rig par bgyi ba dag go zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de
translated: The above passage explains that those who practice the perfection of wisdom

translated: at that time the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas' cultivation of the perfection of wisdom becomes complete.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i thabs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the method for completing the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas 'phel ba dang 'grib pa yod par mi lta zhing rnam par mi rtog par gyur na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas 'phel ba dang 'grib pa yod par mi lta zhing rnam par mi rtog par gyur na /
translated: When one does not view all phenomena from form up to omniscience as increasing or decreasing, because ultimately they are non-existent, and becomes non-conceptual,

original: de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: at that time the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom becomes complete.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: chos zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: they do not see anything called a dharma, and so on, up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de'i tshe /
translated: they do not see anything called the knowledge of all aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis kyang /
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva great beings’ cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is perfected.”

original: nam chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du dngos po yod par mi lta zhing rnam par mi rtog par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: nam chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du dngos po yod par mi lta zhing rnam par mi rtog par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: This passage teaches that when one does not view things as having the characteristics of dharmas and non-dharmas and so on, and when one becomes free of discursive thought,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: at that time the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is perfected.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs par rjes su mi mthong zhing rnam par mi rtog par bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /🔽chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs par rjes su mi mthong zhing rnam par mi rtog par bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste / chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The passage beginning Subhuti, it is because the own-being of dharmas is the mark of dharmas teaches the reason why one should not see and should not conceptualize dharmas and nondharmas, etc.🔽The own-being of dharmas is the mark of emptiness of the external marks of dharmas.

original: chos rnams kyi phyi'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽phyir mi ldog pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi phyi'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // phyir mi ldog pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning is that it is not the object of conceptualization.🔽The passage beginning irreversible teaches the reason why one should not see and should not conceptualize dharmas and nondharmas, etc.

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yongs su dag pa de ni mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas nam yang 'gyur zhing ldog pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yongs su dag pa de ni mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas nam yang 'gyur zhing ldog pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The purity of the nature of emptiness, which is the mark of dharmas, is the mark of the unchanging, perfect accomplishment. The meaning is that it is never changed and never reversed.

original: gsog dang gsob dang snying po med pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa'i rnam grangs te /
analyzed: gsog dang gsob dang snying po med pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa'i rnam grangs te /
translated: The terms “hollow,” “empty,” and “without reality” are synonyms for emptiness.

original: de ltar stong zhing dngos po med pas rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar stong zhing dngos po med pas rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement “because of being empty and unreal, it is not an object of conceptualization” is that it is not an object of conceptualization because it is empty and unreal.

original: @77a * // dbang du gyur pa dang zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad dngos po med de rang bzhin gyis stong pa de ni /
analyzed: @77a * // dbang du gyur pa dang zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad dngos po med de rang bzhin gyis stong pa de ni /
translated: The statement “because it is not under the control of another” means that since all phenomena are unreal and empty of intrinsic nature,

original: rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'gyur zhing rang bzhin thob pa yin pa'i phyir mtshan mar bzung zhing rnam par brtag tu med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'gyur zhing rang bzhin thob pa yin pa'i phyir mtshan mar bzung zhing rnam par brtag tu med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: they are not under the control of another cause or condition, and they are not to be apprehended as signs or conceptually differentiated, because they are obtained by their intrinsic reality.🔽The statement “because they are without action and without life” means that since all phenomena are unreal and empty of intrinsic nature,

original: byed pa med pa dang srog med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dngos po med cing rang bzhin gyis stong bas /
analyzed: byed pa med pa dang srog med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dngos po med cing rang bzhin gyis stong bas /
translated: they are without action and without life.

original: mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i byed pa po dang srog la sogs pa lta bu'i dngos por yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i byed pa po dang srog la sogs pa lta bu'i dngos por yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is not an object of conceptualization because it does not exist as a thing, like the creator, the life-force, etc., imagined by the tīrthikas.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, you have taught the inconceivable.”

original: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas gang la yang dngos por mi lta zhing rnam par mi rtog na /
analyzed: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas gang la yang dngos por mi lta zhing rnam par mi rtog na /
translated: Thus, if one does not view any thing as a thing and does not conceptualize it, because ultimately all phenomena are non-things in the manner explained above,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa de zab ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa de zab ste /

original: sems kyi spyod yul ma yin pas bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ma yin pas bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That teaching is profound, because it is not an object of the mind, it is inconceivable.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan to zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas /

analyzed: sems kyis bsam zhing rnam par brtag pa'i yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa ste /

analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /

translated: Those who are taken hold of by a spiritual friend have the continuation of former virtue and are vessels, so they will have faith in and confidence in this profound perfection of wisdom and will practice it.

original: gsol pa ; bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na /
analyzed: gsol pa ; bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, to what extent

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
