translated: He asked to what extent they practice the six perfections, plant roots of virtue, serve many buddhas, and are taken hold of by spiritual friends.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽gzugs su mi rtog rnam @78a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / gzugs su mi rtog rnam @78a * //
translated: Subhūti, here when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: par mi rtog go zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: par mi rtog go zhes bya ba nas /
translated: they do not form concepts or construct ideas about form,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: up to they do not form concepts or construct ideas about the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sngon pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'i tshad bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sngon pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'i tshad bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage from “they do not form concepts or construct ideas about form” up to “they do not form concepts or construct ideas about the nature of the knowledge of all aspects” teaches the measure of having previously practiced the six perfections, having generated the roots of virtue, having served many buddhas, and having been taken hold of by spiritual friends.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog par gyur pa nyid sngon pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod spyod pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'i rtags dang mtshan ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog par gyur pa nyid sngon pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod spyod pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'i rtags dang mtshan ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is a sign and a mark of one who has long practiced the six perfections, who has planted wholesome roots, who has attended many buddhas, and who has been taken hold of by spiritual friends, that he or she has become free of conceptualization with regard to all phenomena, such as form.

original: gzugs su mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs su mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ One does not form mental constructs or concepts about form” means

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul du gyur pa'i gzugs spyir rnam par mi rtog pa la bya'o //🔽gzugs kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba ni ;🔽gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gzugs su spyod pa la rnam par mi rtog pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul du gyur pa'i gzugs spyir rnam par mi rtog pa la bya'o // gzugs kyi mtshan mar mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba ni ; gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gzugs su spyod pa la rnam par mi rtog pa la bya'o //
translated: that one does not form mental constructs or concepts about form in general, as it is the object of eye consciousness.🔽“ One does not form mental constructs or concepts about the sign of form” means🔽that one does not form mental constructs or concepts about the characteristic of form, which is the experience of form.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ One does not form mental constructs or concepts about the nature of form” means🔽that one does not form mental constructs or concepts about the intrinsic nature of form.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid du yang rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid du yang rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he does not even form the concept of the emptiness that is the intrinsic reality of form.

original: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is explained with regard to form, so it is with feeling, etc., up to all phenomena, including the knowledge of all aspects, in every way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti, it is because form is inconceivable, etc.,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects is inconceivable.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the reason for nonconceptuality.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med de rang bzhin gyis stong pas rnam par brtag cing bsam pa'i spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med de rang bzhin gyis stong pas rnam par brtag cing bsam pa'i spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: All phenomena, such as form, etc., are ultimately unreal because they are empty of intrinsic reality. Therefore they are not the domain of conceptual thought and imagination.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyi ma rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyi ma rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he does not even form the concept of the inconceivability of form, etc.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba yin no @78b zhes bya ba ni gong du ji tsam gyis na pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa la sogs pa lags zhes zhus pa'i lan mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba yin no @78b zhes bya ba ni gong du ji tsam gyis na pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa la sogs pa lags zhes zhus pa'i lan mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the concluding teaching of the question asked above, How does one practice the six perfections and so forth?

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin la bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pas sus
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin la bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pas sus
translated: Subhūti said:

original: kyang rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir zab bo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kyang rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir zab bo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The profound perfection of wisdom is taught to be profound because this perfection of wisdom, as explained above, is not the domain of conceptual activity and is inconceivable, and therefore cannot be realized by anyone.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor gzugs zab pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab po zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs zab pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab po zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Subhūti, because form is profound, the perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid zab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid zab pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the knowledge of all aspects is profound,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is profound.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med de rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med de rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
translated: This passage from “Because form is profound” up to “Because the knowledge of all aspects is profound” teaches that all phenomena such as form are ultimately not things, because they are empty of inherent nature.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bsam pa'i spyod yul ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bsam pa'i spyod yul ma yin la /
translated: They are not the domain of conceptual thought or imagination.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir zab po zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir zab po zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And because the perfection of wisdom is not different from them, it is profound.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rin po che'i phung po ste /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rin po che'i phung po ste /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord, the perfection of wisdom is a heap of precious jewels.

original: chos rin po che'i phung po rnams sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas don dam par dngos po med de /🔽bsam gyis mi khyab cing zab kyang kun rdzob tu dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i chos rin po che rnams bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos rin po che'i phung po rnams sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas don dam par dngos po med de / bsam gyis mi khyab cing zab kyang kun rdzob tu dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i chos rin po che rnams bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom, which is thus non-existent in the ultimate, as explained above.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang 'dra bar sems can thams cad kyi re ba yongs su bskong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //🔽'di lta ste /🔽dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang 'dra bar sems can thams cad kyi re ba yongs su bskong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o // 'di lta ste / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: But it is like a wish-fulfilling gem, in that it fulfills the hopes of all sentient beings, because it is the means of accomplishing the precious Dharmas of the ten virtues and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos rin po che zhes bya ba gang dang gang yin pa'i dmigs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos rin po che zhes bya ba gang dang gang yin pa'i dmigs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage from “the ten virtuous paths of action are accomplished” up to “the knowledge of all aspects is accomplished” indicates the object of the precious Dharma.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi rnam par byang ba'i chos dkon zhing rnyed par dka' ba rnams sgrub cing rnyed par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi rnam par byang ba'i chos dkon zhing rnyed par dka' ba rnams sgrub cing rnyed par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: The perfection of wisdom is a jewel because it is the cause for accomplishing and attaining the purified dharmas, which are rare and difficult to obtain, from the path of the ten virtuous actions up to omniscience.

original: 'di rin po che dang 'dra bar dkon zhing rnyed par dka' ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di rin po che dang 'dra bar dkon zhing rnyed par dka' ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the perfection of wisdom is rare and difficult to obtain like a jewel.

original: bcom ldan 'das @79a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @79a * //
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is the turning of the wheel of Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te 'byung bas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te 'byung bas na /
translated: The turning of the wheel of Dharma by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas also occurs in dependence on the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the perfection of wisdom is the turning of the wheel of Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzugs dag pa dang / tshor ba dag pa dang zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dag pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dag pa'i phung po'i zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzugs dag pa dang / tshor ba dag pa dang zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dag pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dag pa'i phung po'i zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The Blessed One, because of the purity of form, the purity of feeling, and so on up to, because of the purity of the knowledge of all modes, the perfection of wisdom is the pure aggregate.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med cing yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dag pa'i phung po yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med cing yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dag pa'i phung po yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows that this perfection of wisdom is the pure aggregate because all dharmas, form, etc., are ultimately without any substance and have the nature of purity.

original: dag pa'i phung po zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos mang po rnams dag par 'dus pa'i phyir phung po zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i phung po zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos mang po rnams dag par 'dus pa'i phyir phung po zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The pure aggregate is taught as an aggregate because many dharmas, form, etc., are gathered in purity.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo de lta bu bstan pa'i tshe bar chad du mi 'gyur ba ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo de lta bu bstan pa'i tshe bar chad du mi 'gyur ba ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Blessed One, it is wonderful how the perfection of wisdom, when it is being taught, does not get cut off.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When practicing this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: bdud la sogs pas bar chad bya mi nus pa 'khor rnams la zhib tu bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: bdud la sogs pas bar chad bya mi nus pa 'khor rnams la zhib tu bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis smras pa'o //
translated: Subhūti says this in order to open up the opportunity for the retinue to explain in detail how Māra and so forth are unable to create obstacles.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bar chad mang du 'byung ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bar chad mang du 'byung ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti, many obstacles arise for this profound perfection of wisdom, from 'many obstacles arise for this profound perfection of wisdom' up to

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: 'Why is that?🔽Subhūti, many obstacles arise for that great precious jewel.'

original: rab 'byor de ni nor bu rin po che chen po la bar chad mang du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten na yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che btsal zhing sgrub pa la /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni nor bu rin po che chen po la bar chad mang du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'jig rten na yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che btsal zhing sgrub pa la /
translated: This shows that in the world, when searching for and accomplishing the wish-fulfilling great precious jewel,

original: bgegs dang bar chad mang po 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: bgegs dang bar chad mang po 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: many hindrances and obstacles arise.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rin po che spyad pa la yang bdud la sogs pa'i bar chad 'byung yang srid kyis bri ba dang / klag pa dang / bstan pa dang tshul bzhin du yid la bya ba dang / bsgom pa zla grangs dang lo grangs ji tsam gyis zin par bya bar yid dam bcas shing khas 'ches pa de bzhin du bar chad du mi 'gyur bar bri ba dang klag pa la sogs pa bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rin po che spyad pa la yang bdud la sogs pa'i bar chad 'byung yang srid kyis bri ba dang / klag pa dang / bstan pa dang tshul bzhin du yid la bya ba dang / bsgom pa zla grangs dang lo grangs ji tsam gyis zin par bya bar yid dam bcas shing khas 'ches pa de bzhin du bar chad du mi 'gyur bar bri ba dang klag pa la sogs pa bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is also possible that obstacles such as Mara will arise in the practice of the precious Dharma of the perfection of wisdom, but one should make a vow and promise to write, read, teach, properly pay attention to, and meditate on it for a certain number of months or years, and then one should write, read, and so forth without obstacles.

original: gsol pa / @79b bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ci nas kyang mi 'dri ba dang / mi klag pa dang / mi bstan pa dang / kha ton mi bgyid pa dang / yid la mi bgyid pa dang /
analyzed: gsol pa / @79b bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ci nas kyang mi 'dri ba dang / mi klag pa dang / mi bstan pa dang / kha ton mi bgyid pa dang / yid la mi bgyid pa dang /
translated: He said, Blessed One, this profound perfection of wisdom will not be written, read, taught, recited from memory, paid attention to, or meditated upon.

original: mi bsgom pa'i slad du bdud sdig to can dag bar chad mi bgyid pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba ni bdud kyis bar chad bya mi nus par bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: mi bsgom pa'i slad du bdud sdig to can dag bar chad mi bgyid pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba ni bdud kyis bar chad bya mi nus par bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis smras pa'o //
translated: “It is wonderful that the evil Māras do not create obstacles for the sake of not meditating!”🔽This is Subhūti’s statement that opens the section on the explanation that Māra is unable to create obstacles.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas bar chad bya mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas bar chad bya mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Up to here, the evil Māras are unable to create obstacles.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod cing nan tan byed pa la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod cing nan tan byed pa la /
translated: This shows the power and quality of being able to create obstacles for those who practice and cultivate this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: bdud sdig can bar chad mi byed pa yang ma yin mod kyi bar chad byed par byas kyang bar chad bya mi nus pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdud sdig can bar chad mi byed pa yang ma yin mod kyi bar chad byed par byas kyang bar chad bya mi nus pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
translated: but also that the evil Māras are not able to create obstacles.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the Blessed One, “Blessed One, it is wonderful that the evil Māras are unable to create obstacles.”🔽This shows the power and quality of being able to create obstacles for those who practice and cultivate this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: bdud sdig to can gyis bar chad bya mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: bdud sdig to can gyis bar chad bya mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: but also that the evil Māras are not able to create obstacles.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byin gyis rlob cing mthu gtong bas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byin gyis rlob cing mthu gtong bas /
translated: The buddhas, the bhagavats, bless and empower the practice of this perfection of wisdom.

original: bdud kyis bar chad bya mi nus pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyis bar chad bya mi nus pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
translated: The quality of being unable to be harmed by Mara is taught.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag gi mthus kyang zhes bya ba nas tshul bzhin du yid la byed do //
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag gi mthus kyang zhes bya ba nas tshul bzhin du yid la byed do //
translated: “ Shariputra, by the power of all the buddhas, the bhagavats, however many there are, who dwell in the world systems of the ten directions, who sustain, who protect, and who teach the Dharma, up to ‘one should understand that they are meditating on it in the correct manner.’

original: bsgom mo zhes bya bar khong du chad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'a kya thub pa nyag gcig bdud kyis bar chad phya mi nus
analyzed: bsgom mo zhes bya bar khong du chad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'a kya thub pa nyag gcig bdud kyis bar chad phya mi nus
translated: This shows that not only does the Buddha, the Bhagavat Shakyamuni, bless and empower the bodhisattva practicing this perfection of wisdom to be unable to be harmed by Mara,

original: par byin gyis rlob cing mthu gtong bar mdzad par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: par byin gyis rlob cing mthu gtong bar mdzad par ma zad kyi /
translated: but also

original: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang bdud kyis bar chad bya mi nus par byin gyis rlob cing mthu gtong ba'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang bdud kyis bar chad bya mi nus par byin gyis rlob cing mthu gtong ba'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
translated: The qualities of the buddhas blessing and empowering all the tathagatas of the ten directions so that they cannot be obstructed by Mara are taught.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang su yang rung ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang su yang rung ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The request Bhagavan, any son of good lineage or daughter of good lineage who...

original: de thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi gzungs yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi gzungs yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: ...should know that all of them are the buddhas' dharanis.

original: 'khor gyi nang na sems can kha cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub @80a * //
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang na sems can kha cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub @80a * //
translated: ...in the retinue who practice the perfection of wisdom are bodhisattvas.

original: sems dpa' rnams la ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams byin gyis rlob cing de ltar mthu gtong na /
analyzed: sems dpa' rnams la ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams byin gyis rlob cing de ltar mthu gtong na /
translated: The buddhas bless them and empower them in that way.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sems can phal pa'i nang nas gang su yang rung ba dag las /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sems can phal pa'i nang nas gang su yang rung ba dag las /
translated: In the future, among ordinary beings, whoever...

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad na /
translated: ...practices this perfection of wisdom...🔽...

original: de dag la yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byin gyis rlob cing mthu gtong ngam /
analyzed: de dag la yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byin gyis rlob cing mthu gtong ngam /
translated: And for them, the Blessed Buddhas bestow their blessings and bestow their power, or do they not?

original: mi gtong snyam du the tshom za ba bsal ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo su yang rung ste /
analyzed: mi gtong snyam du the tshom za ba bsal ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo su yang rung ste /

translated: What is that Dharma?🔽It is this perfection of wisdom.

original: phyi ma'i dus @82a * //
analyzed: phyi ma'i dus @82a * //
translated: In this way, it is taught that in the future

translated: in the south and the north there will be many who practice this profound perfection of wisdom by way of copying, holding, reading, and so forth, and it will not disappear.

analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra, I have in mind those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who hold, maintain, read aloud, master, and are attentive to this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom in the right manner,

analyzed: steng gi phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs so //

analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis brjod do //
translated: Those tathāgatas, arhats, and perfectly awakened buddhas proclaim, praise, and extol those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage.

analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod cing nan tan byed pa dang / spyod cing nan tan byed ma nus na yang bris nas glegs bam du bcangs te mchod cing bkur sti byed na yang /
translated: those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who practice this perfection of wisdom and make it a living experience, and even those who are unable to practice and make it a living experience but who write it out and make it into a book and worship and revere it,

analyzed: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dgongs shing gzigs par 'gyur ba dang / ngan song du mi ltung ba dang / lha dang mi'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstod cing bsngags par 'gyur ba dang /

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di slad ma'i dus slad ma'i tshe na byang phyogs su rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /

translated: Those who practice this profound perfection of wisdom have previously practiced the Great Vehicle again and again,

translated: Up to You should know that those who practice this profound perfection of wisdom in the future time of the last five hundred years have been accepted by spiritual friends and have generated roots of virtue.

analyzed: phyi ma'i dus lnga brgya tha ma la bab pa'i tshe /

analyzed: sngon theg pa chen po la spyod spyod pa'i las kyi 'phro yod pa dang / sngon sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas shing dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed bskyed pa rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la dad cing mos nas /
translated: Those who have the continuity of former practice of the Great Vehicle, who have served many Buddhas in the past, who have been taken hold of by spiritual friends, and who have repeatedly generated the roots of virtue, will have faith in and interest in this perfection of wisdom,

translated: and will listen to it, ask questions about it, take it up, read it aloud, and properly pay attention to it, and will practice in accordance with it. It is rare that those without the continuity of former karma will practice in this way.

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das slad ma'i tshe slad ma'i dus na /
translated: Subhūti said, “Bhagavān, in the future time,

translated: In the northern direction, how many sons of good family and daughters of good family belonging to the Bodhisattva Vehicle will there be who listen to this profound perfection of wisdom, and having listened, will believe in it, and having believed, will copy it,

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe /

analyzed: phyi ma'i dus lnga brgya tha ma'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la zhugs shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dri zhing klog pa la sogs pa tsam gyi sgo nas spyod cing mos pa ni mang mod kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin

analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mang po'i rjes su 'brangs pa dang / rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mang po la yongs su zhus yongs su dris pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo thos nas sems zhum par mi 'gyur ba dang 'jigs shing skrag par mi 'gyur ba nyung ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Because those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage have followed many tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas, and because those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage have asked many tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas questions.”

analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: This passage indicates the reasons why, when they hear the profound topics of the transcendent perfection of wisdom, their minds will not be cowed and they will not be frightened or terrified.

translated: Those who do not become disheartened, do not become frightened or terrified, who have served and attended upon many past Tathagatas, and have asked many Tathagatas about the profound meaning of the Dharma, and have become free of doubt,

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo 'di thos nas sems zhum par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'jigs shing skrag par mi 'gyur te /

original: de'i phyir de lta bu dag nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu dag nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is said that such people are few.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: The passage from “they will not be afraid or terrified” up to “they will complete the eighteen distinct qualities of a buddha” teaches the reason for not being afraid or terrified when hearing the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom and the benefits of not being afraid or terrified when hearing the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo de lta bu bstan pa'i tshe /🔽sems zhum par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'jigs shing skrag par mi 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni phyis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la thug gi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad yongs su

translated: When the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom is taught in this way,

analyzed: rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: those sons or daughters of good lineage who do not become disheartened and who are not frightened or terrified will later complete all the phenomena of complete purification, from the six perfections up to the eighteen distinct qualities of a buddha.

analyzed: de lta bu'i phan yon chen po can ni dkon zhing nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that such great benefits are rare and few.🔽Śāradvatī­putra, those sons of good family and daughters of good family will be supported by their roots of virtue.

translated: And so on. This teaches that those who have faith in this profound perfection of wisdom

analyzed: tshe 'di la phan yon ci 'byung ba dang / tshe rabs snga ma la yon tan ci bsags pa dang / tshe rabs phyi ma la phan yon ci 'byung ba rnams bstan pa ste /
translated: will have benefits in this life, what qualities they have accumulated in previous lives, and what benefits they will have in future lives.

original: dge ba'i rtsa bas nye bar bstan par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs snga ma la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i rgyus /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa bas nye bar bstan par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs snga ma la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i rgyus /
translated: “They will be supported by their roots of virtue” means that by the cause of having generated roots of virtue in previous lives,

original: tshe 'di la bdag gi don phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la bdag gi don phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: in this life they will have the perfection of their own benefit. This is taught.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du skye bo mang po'i don byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du skye bo mang po'i don byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni /
translated: They will work for the welfare of many people for the sake of highest genuine full Awakening.

original: tshe 'di dang phyi ma gnyis ka la gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed nus pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di dang phyi ma gnyis ka la gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed nus pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the quality of being able to bring about the welfare of others in both this life and the next.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de ni 'di ltar sha ra dva ti'i bu rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag la ni ngas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i gtam brjod do //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sha ra dva ti'i bu rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag la ni ngas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i gtam brjod do //
translated: Śāriputra, I have given teachings to those sons and daughters of good family that are connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'das pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis kyang rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis kyang rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid
translated: The Blessed Buddhas, the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Completely Awakened Ones, however many there are in the past, present, and future, have given teachings to those sons and daughters of good family that are connected with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: dang ldan pa'i gtam brjod de zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dang ldan pa'i gtam brjod de zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and will give teachings to them that are connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: tshe rabs snga ma la sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o //🔽de dag tshe 'das kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma la sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o // de dag tshe 'das kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: This shows the good quality of having served many buddhas in previous lives.

original: bla na @84a * //
analyzed: bla na @84a * //
translated: Even if they die, they will still be practicing🔽for the sake of highest genuine full Awakening.

original: med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du spyod pa nyid du 'gyur te zhes bya bas ni tshe rabs phyi ma la bdag gi don phun sum tshogs par byed nus par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du spyod pa nyid du 'gyur te zhes bya bas ni tshe rabs phyi ma la bdag gi don phun sum tshogs par byed nus par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the benefit of being able to perfect one’s own welfare in future lives.

original: de dag gzhan la yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag gzhan la yang 'di lta ste /
translated: They will also tell others🔽about this practice for the sake of highest genuine full Awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du rnam pa de lta bu nyid brjod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni tshe rabs phyi ma la gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed nus pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du rnam pa de lta bu nyid brjod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni tshe rabs phyi ma la gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed nus pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the benefit of being able to perfect the welfare of others in future lives.

original: rnam pa de lta bu nyid brjod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu nyid brjod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase they will express themselves in that way means that they will attain unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur te zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur te zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The phrase those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family, Śāradvatīputra, will become equipoised

original: tshe 'di dang phyi ma gnyis ka la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul gyi dbang du mi 'gyur bar bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug nus pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di dang phyi ma gnyis ka la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul gyi dbang du mi 'gyur bar bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug nus pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: teaches the benefit of being able to enter into the meditative absorptions and one-pointed concentration without coming under the influence of objects such as desire in both this life and the next.

original: de dag ni bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las bzlog par mi nus na sdig to la mos pa dang / sdig to'i spyod pa can shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spong ba gzhan gyis lta ci smos zhes bya ba ni bdud la sogs pas dge ba'i bar chad bya mi nus pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las bzlog par mi nus na sdig to la mos pa dang / sdig to'i spyod pa can shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spong ba gzhan gyis lta ci smos zhes bya ba ni bdud la sogs pas dge ba'i bar chad bya mi nus pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching on the benefit of not being able to create an obstacle to virtue by Māra, and so on.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas dga' zhing nyams bde ba rgya chen po skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas dga' zhing nyams bde ba rgya chen po skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra, those sons of enlightened heritage and those daughters of enlightened heritage in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, having heard this deep perfection of wisdom, will give rise to joy, delight, and elation.”

original: ni / chos zab mo rtogs nas dad pa chen po skye bar 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ni / chos zab mo rtogs nas dad pa chen po skye bar 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching on the benefit of giving rise to great faith through realizing the profound Dharma.

original: 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du skye bo mang po yang dge ba'i chos la dgod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du skye bo mang po yang dge ba'i chos la dgod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni /
translated: In this way, for the sake of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, many beings will be established in virtuous qualities.

original: sems can gzhan yang dam pa'i chos la dad pa bskyed nus pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan yang dam pa'i chos la dad pa bskyed nus pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the benefit of being able to generate faith in the true Dharma in other sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis ni nga'i mdun du 'di skad du zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis ni nga'i mdun du 'di skad du zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Those sons of good family and daughters of good family have spoken these words in my presence, up to

original: phyir mi ldog par lung bstan par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i tshig smras so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par lung bstan par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i tshig smras so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: they will be predicted to be irreversible.

original: tshe rabs snga ma la de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar gzhan gyi don phun @84b sum tshogs par bya bar yid dam bcas pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma la de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar gzhan gyi don phun @84b sum tshogs par bya bar yid dam bcas pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the quality of having made a vow in the presence of the Tathagata in previous lives to accomplish the welfare of others.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi tshig ni sems la sems kyis rnam par bltas te /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi tshig ni sems la sems kyis rnam par bltas te /
translated: Subhuti, the words of those sons of good family and daughters of good family are seen by the mind with the mind,

original: ngas rjes su dgyes par mdzad do zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bya bar yid dam bcas shing khas 'ches pa ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed nus pa de bzhin gshegs pas thugs ches pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ngas rjes su dgyes par mdzad do zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bya bar yid dam bcas shing khas 'ches pa ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed nus pa de bzhin gshegs pas thugs ches pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase I will delight them indicates the quality of the Tathagata's confidence in his ability to do what he has promised to do, in his vow to bring about the perfect welfare of others, and in his ability to do what he has said he will do.🔽The phrase Sharadviati, in the presence of the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones of the past... indicates the quality of the Tathagata's confidence in his ability to bring about the perfect welfare of others in the future.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyan sngar yang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyan sngar yang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The phrase ...those sons and daughters of good family... indicates the quality of the Tathagata's confidence in his ability to bring about the perfect welfare of others in the present.

original: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi tshig ni sems la thugs kyis rnam par gzigs te rjes su dgyes par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi tshig ni sems la thugs kyis rnam par gzigs te rjes su dgyes par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The phrase ...their words are seen by the Tathagata with his mind and he delights in them indicates the quality of the Tathagata's confidence in his ability to bring about the perfect welfare of others in the future.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg la mos pa rlabs po cher 'gyur te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg la mos pa rlabs po cher 'gyur te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They have vast interest in form, sound,🔽smell, taste, and touch.🔽

original: yang dag par dka' bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: yang dag par dka' bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Having great interest in form, sound, smell, taste, and touch up to they will be perfectly difficult to overcome.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la mos pa rlabs po ches ma chags par spyod cing sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsdu ba rnam pa bzhis sems can rnams yongs su bsdus nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la mos pa rlabs po ches ma chags par spyod cing sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsdu ba rnam pa bzhis sems can rnams yongs su bsdus nas /
translated: By means of great interest in the five sense objects, they practice without attachment and, by means of the four ways of gathering, gather sentient beings.

original: bdag dang sems can gnyis ka rnam par smin pa rlabs chen po dang ldan par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can gnyis ka rnam par smin pa rlabs chen po dang ldan par bya ste /
translated: Both themselves and sentient beings will have great ripening.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid ston pa las mngon sum du chos mnyan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid ston pa las mngon sum du chos mnyan te /
translated: In other buddha-fields, from the Bhagavan Buddhas teaching this very profound perfection of wisdom, they will directly listen to the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing der yang sems can gyi don phun @85a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing der yang sems can gyi don phun @85a * //
translated: And in that buddha-field, they will be able to accomplish the perfect benefit of sentient beings.

original: sum tshogs pa byed nus par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sum tshogs pa byed nus par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the benefits.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams las chos gang thugs sum chud pa de lta bu gang yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams las chos gang thugs sum chud pa de lta bu gang yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, there is no phenomenon whatsoever that the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha has not understood among the phenomena of the past, future, and present.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
translated: In the world systems of the ten directions,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang yongs su mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang yongs su mkhyen to //
translated: however many thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas there are who are present, alive, and enduring, and who are teaching the Dharma, those thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas know the bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang nyan thos rnams kyang yongs su mkhyen to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang nyan thos rnams kyang yongs su mkhyen to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: and they know the buddha fields and the hearers.”

original: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa rnams tshe rabs snga ma la dge ba ci spyad pa'i yon tan dang / tshe 'di dang tshe rabs phyi ma la phan yon ci dang cir 'gyur ba rnams /
analyzed: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa rnams tshe rabs snga ma la dge ba ci spyad pa'i yon tan dang / tshe 'di dang tshe rabs phyi ma la phan yon ci dang cir 'gyur ba rnams /
translated: Thus, Shariputra, having heard the Lord's exposition of the qualities of those who practice this profound perfection of wisdom as explained above, and of all the benefits they will have in this and in other lives,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lung bstan pa sh'a ri'i bus thos nas 'khor rnams kyang yid ches shing dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lung bstan pa sh'a ri'i bus thos nas 'khor rnams kyang yid ches shing dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to generate confidence and faith in the assembly,

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dus gsum gyi dngos po thams cad cir gyur pa dang / cir 'gyur ba ma lus par thugs su chud pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bstod pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dus gsum gyi dngos po thams cad cir gyur pa dang / cir 'gyur ba ma lus par thugs su chud pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bstod pa bstan pa'o //
translated: he extols the Lord's realization of the way all things of the three times are, and of the way they will be, saying, How wonderful!

original: bcom ldan 'das gang yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag gi slad du brtson par bgyid cing pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag tshol ba dang / yongs su tshol ba'i tshe rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag tshol ba dang yongs su tshol ba las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag gi slad du brtson par bgyid cing pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag tshol ba dang / yongs su tshol ba'i tshe rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag tshol ba dang yongs su tshol ba las /
translated: for the sake of these six perfections, they strive,

original: la las ni btsal ba las pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: la las ni btsal ba las pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag thob par 'gyur /
translated: some will attain these six perfections through seeking,

original: la las ni thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: la las ni thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and some will not attain them.

original: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas /
analyzed: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas /
translated: Thus, in the sequence explained above,

original: sngon dge ba spyod spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyan pa dang 'dri ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas spyod nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon dge ba spyod spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyan pa dang 'dri ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas spyod nus par 'gyur te /
translated: those who have previously engaged in virtue and served many buddhas will be able to practice this perfection of wisdom through listening to it, inquiring about it, and so forth.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @85b pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa dkon pa bstan pa sh'a ra dva ti'i bus thos nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @85b pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa dkon pa bstan pa sh'a ra dva ti'i bus thos nas /
translated: The Lord: It is difficult to find a Bodhisattva who courses in this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar dkon na thams cad kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di btsal kyang rnyed par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar dkon na thams cad kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di btsal kyang rnyed par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: When he has heard that, he will think: If it is so difficult to find, then all those who have not planted wholesome roots will not even seek this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa nyi tshe zhig gis rnyed par 'gyur ba lta zhig ces zhus pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa nyi tshe zhig gis rnyed par 'gyur ba lta zhig ces zhus pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: But those who have planted wholesome roots will seek it and find it.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Sariputra, so it is.

original: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo brtson 'grus mi gtong pa de dag kun gyis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo brtson 'grus mi gtong pa de dag kun gyis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those sons and daughters of good family who do not relax their vigour will all succeed in these six perfections.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni 'di ltar rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag gi don du brtson par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni 'di ltar rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag gi don du brtson par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo
translated: Śāradvatīputra, it is because those sons and daughters of good family strive for the sake of these six perfections.

original: 'di thos par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di thos par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: This teaches that in order to hear this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: brtson 'grus chen po brtsams shing yid bsrings te btsal na tshe 'di la grub par ma gyur na yang tshe rabs phyi ma tshun chad kyis brtson 'grus ma gtang na grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po brtsams shing yid bsrings te btsal na tshe 'di la grub par ma gyur na yang tshe rabs phyi ma tshun chad kyis brtson 'grus ma gtang na grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: if they exert great effort, extend their minds, and search for it, even if they do not accomplish it in this life, if they do not abandon effort in future lives, they will accomplish it.

original: gsol pa ci lags /
analyzed: gsol pa ci lags /
translated: He said, What is it?

original: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis mdo sde zab mo zab mo pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa 'di dag kun kyang grub par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis mdo sde zab mo zab mo pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa 'di dag kun kyang grub par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Blessed One, will those sons and daughters of good family accomplish all these profound sūtras endowed with the six perfections?

analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag las brtson 'grus nyams par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /

original: brtson 'grus chen po ma gtsang na sngon dge ba'i rtsa bam bskyed cing las kyi 'phro med du zin kyang mdo sde zab mo pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa rnams grub par mi 'gyur mi srid de /
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po ma gtsang na sngon dge ba'i rtsa bam bskyed cing las kyi 'phro med du zin kyang mdo sde zab mo pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa rnams grub par mi 'gyur mi srid de /
