translated: When listening to this profound perfection of wisdom, if one does not have the experience of understanding the profound meaning and gives up listening and goes elsewhere,

original: de ltar byed pa nyid bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'am de ltar byed na bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor gzhan yang glal zhing lung 'bogs na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar byed pa nyid bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'am de ltar byed na bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang glal zhing lung 'bogs na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: because that is itself the blessing of a demon or because the demon finds an opportunity if one does that, it should be recognized as the work of a demon.🔽Moreover, Subhūti, if one yawns while teaching,

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang yi ge gzhan dang gzhan dag la chags shing 'dzin tam 'chang ngam /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang yi ge gzhan dang gzhan dag la chags shing 'dzin tam 'chang ngam /
translated: Subhūti, moreover, if one is attached to other letters, or grasps them, or holds them,

original: klog gam / kun chub par byed dam /
analyzed: klog gam / kun chub par byed dam /
translated: read, or master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid @87b la byed na /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid @87b la byed na /
translated: or properly pay attention to it,

original: rab 'byor de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Subhūti, that also should be known by the bodhisattva mahāsattvas as the work of Māra.”

original: lung 'bogs pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i tshe glal ba dang / dgod pa dang steg pa dang / yi ge gzhan la chags par gyur na yang bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pas de ltar byed pa'am /
analyzed: lung 'bogs pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i tshe glal ba dang / dgod pa dang steg pa dang / yi ge gzhan la chags par gyur na yang bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pas de ltar byed pa'am /
translated: This passage teaches that when one is expounding, reciting, holding, reading, teaching, or properly paying attention to the scriptures, if one yawns, laughs, is arrogant, or becomes attached to other texts, one should understand that this is the work of Māra because it is done by the blessing of Māra.

original: de ltar byed na bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar byed na bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: Or if one does it, one should understand that it is the work of Māra because Māra will find an opportunity.

original: glal ba dang / dgod pa dang / steg pa dang / yi ge gzhan la chags pa'i don ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: glal ba dang / dgod pa dang / steg pa dang / yi ge gzhan la chags pa'i don ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of yawning, laughing, being arrogant, and being attached to other texts is as explained above.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Subhuti said to the Lord:🔽We have not been predicted to the supreme enlightenment by the Lord in this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las bdag cag lung ma bstan to zhes ma dad pa'i yid kyis stan las langs shing 'dong ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las bdag cag lung ma bstan to zhes ma dad pa'i yid kyis stan las langs shing 'dong ste /
translated: With this thought of lack of faith they will rise from their seats and go away.

original: rab 'byor de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Subhuti, this also should be known by the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva as the work of Māra.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo rtogs pa'i ro ma myong nas stan las langs te 'dong ba ci'i phyir de ltar byed pa'i gtan tshigs rab 'byor gyis zhus pa dang / tshe rabs snga ma la pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ma spyad cing goms par ma byas pa'i rgyus tshe 'di la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i don zab mo rtogs pa'i nyams med pas ma dad ma mos nas gud du 'dong ba
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo rtogs pa'i ro ma myong nas stan las langs te 'dong ba ci'i phyir de ltar byed pa'i gtan tshigs rab 'byor gyis zhus pa dang / tshe rabs snga ma la pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ma spyad cing goms par ma byas pa'i rgyus tshe 'di la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i don zab mo rtogs pa'i nyams med pas ma dad ma mos nas gud du 'dong ba
translated: Because in their previous lives they did not practice and familiarize themselves with the six perfections, in this life they have no experience of realizing the profound meaning of this perfection of wisdom. So they leave, without faith or interest.

original: bstan pa ste /🔽de ltar byed pa yang bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'am /
analyzed: bstan pa ste / de ltar byed pa yang bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'am /
translated: This is the teaching.🔽And this is also taught:🔽If they act like this, it should be known as the work of Māra, because it is a blessing of Māra,

original: de ltar byed na bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byed na bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: or because Māra finds an opportunity if they act like this.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las lung ma bstan pa de dag stan pa de dag stan las langs shing mchi bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las lung ma bstan pa de dag stan pa de dag stan las langs shing mchi bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He said, Why, Blessed One, are those who have not been predicted in the perfection of wisdom to rise up from their seats and leave?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa gang dang gang la gnas pa yan chad kyis lung bstan pa 'thob pa dang / sa gang man chad kyis lung bstan pa mi 'thob pa bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa gang dang gang la gnas pa yan chad kyis lung bstan pa 'thob pa dang / sa gang man chad kyis lung bstan pa mi 'thob pa bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: This is Subhūti's question to open the section explaining which bodhisattvas, from which level on, obtain prediction, and from which level on they do not obtain prediction.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor byang @88a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor byang @88a * //
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Subhūti, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have not entered without fault are not predicted to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyon me dpar ma chud pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung mi ston to zhes bya bas ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po thob pa yan chad ni bla na med pa yang
analyzed: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyon me dpar ma chud pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung mi ston to zhes bya bas ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po thob pa yan chad ni bla na med pa yang
translated: This shows that from the attainment of the first bodhisattva level on, they obtain prediction to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur gyi /
translated: and will receive a prophecy of their complete enlightenment.

original: de man chad kyis lung bstan pa mi 'thob bo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de man chad kyis lung bstan pa mi 'thob bo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: But if they do not receive a prophecy, they will not receive one after that.

original: de la bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las mi 'byung ngo //
translated: In this, I do not emerge from this perfection of wisdom.

original: bdag gi ming yang yongs su ma brjod do zhes dad par ma gyur na /
analyzed: bdag gi ming yang yongs su ma brjod do zhes dad par ma gyur na /
translated: And my name is not even mentioned.

original: rab 'byor de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should know that this too is the work of Māra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kha cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod spyod pa dag bdag gis ming nas smos te lung bstan du re ba las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kha cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod spyod pa dag bdag gis ming nas smos te lung bstan du re ba las /
translated: Some bodhisattvas practicing this deep perfection of wisdom hope for a prophecy by having their name mentioned.

original: lung bstan par ma gyur nas /
analyzed: lung bstan par ma gyur nas /
translated: But if they do not receive a prophecy,

original: dad pa bri ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa gtong bar gyur na /
analyzed: dad pa bri ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa gtong bar gyur na /
translated: their faith in this deep perfection of wisdom will diminish and they will give up practicing it.

original: de ltar byed pa yang bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar byed pa yang bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'am /
translated: And if they do that, it is because they are inspired by Māra,

original: de ltar byad na bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byad na bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If it is practiced in that way, one should know it to be the work of Māra, because Māra finds an opportunity in that way.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag gi ming yongs su ma brjod pa lags zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag gi ming yongs su ma brjod pa lags zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He said, Bhagavan, why are the names of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas not mentioned in this profound perfection of wisdom?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod spyod pa rnams ji ltar tsam gyis ming brjod cing lung bstan par 'gyur ba zhus pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod spyod pa rnams ji ltar tsam gyis ming brjod cing lung bstan par 'gyur ba zhus pa'o //
translated: This is asking, How is it that those who practice this profound perfection of wisdom are not mentioned by name and do not receive a prophecy?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,🔽Subhūti, the names of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have not received a prophecy are not mentioned.

original: rab 'gyur byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lung ma bstan pa rnams kyi ming ni yong sus mi brjod do zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad do cog gi ming brjod cing lung bstan pa thob par mi 'gyur
analyzed: rab 'gyur byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lung ma bstan pa rnams kyi ming ni yong sus mi brjod do zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad do cog gi ming brjod cing lung bstan pa thob par mi 'gyur
translated: This means that those who practice this perfection of wisdom will not receive a prophecy and have their names mentioned.

original: gyi / sa dang po thob pa yan chad kyi ming brjod cing lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //🔽de la bdag gi ming yang 'di las mi 'byung ba dag gang du skyes pa'i gong ngam grong khyer ram /🔽grong rdal gyi ming 'di yang mi 'byung ngo zhes de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi mnyan to snyam byed cing 'khor de nas 'gro bar sems na sems bskyed pa des ji lta ji @88b ltar 'gro bar sems shing gom pa ji snyed cig bor
analyzed: gyi / sa dang po thob pa yan chad kyi ming brjod cing lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o // de la bdag gi ming yang 'di las mi 'byung ba dag gang du skyes pa'i gong ngam grong khyer ram / grong rdal gyi ming 'di yang mi 'byung ngo zhes de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi mnyan to snyam byed cing 'khor de nas 'gro bar sems na sems bskyed pa des ji lta ji @88b ltar 'gro bar sems shing gom pa ji snyed cig bor
translated: and the name of the stage that he has attained, and he will receive a prophecy.

original: ba de snyed kyi bskal pa yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba de snyed kyi bskal pa yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, if he thinks, “My name is not mentioned here, nor is the name of the town or city where I was born,” and he thinks, “I will not listen to the perfection of wisdom,” and he leaves the assembly, then by that thought he will be reborn as many eons as he has had thoughts of leaving, and as many steps he has taken.🔽He should be patient with them, and he should make an effort.

original: de dag la bzod pa brtson par bya dgos so zhes bya ba ni lung ma bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kha cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod spyod pa las /
analyzed: de dag la bzod pa brtson par bya dgos so zhes bya ba ni lung ma bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kha cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod spyod pa las /
translated: This is about some bodhisattvas who have not received a prophecy, and who, while practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: bdag gi ming la sogs pa ma smos te lung ma bstan to snyam nas dad pa bri ste /
analyzed: bdag gi ming la sogs pa ma smos te lung ma bstan to snyam nas dad pa bri ste /
translated: Thinking, The Buddha has not given me a prophecy, their faith will diminish.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mnyan pa btang nas gud du 'gro bar sems shing song nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mnyan pa btang nas gud du 'gro bar sems shing song nas /
translated: They will think, I will not listen to this profound perfection of wisdom, and will leave.

original: gom pa ji snyed bor ba de snyed kyi bskal par 'khor ba na 'khyams shing grol thar bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gom pa ji snyed bor ba de snyed kyi bskal par 'khor ba na 'khyams shing grol thar bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: For as many eons as the number of steps they take, they will wander in cyclic existence and will not be liberated.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la gzod brtson par bya dgos so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la gzod brtson par bya dgos so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They will have to make an effort again in this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bor zhing mdo sde gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su mi sgrub pa de dag kun chub par bya bar sems te /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bor zhing mdo sde gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su mi sgrub pa de dag kun chub par bya bar sems te /
translated: They will think, I will master those sūtras that do not fully accomplish the wisdom of omniscience, and will reject the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shing gi rtsa ba spangs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shing gi rtsa ba spangs te /
translated: Then, those sons and daughters of good lineage in the Bodhisattva Vehicle will abandon the root of the tree of omniscience,

original: de nyid kyi yal ga dang 'dab ma dang lo ma la 'jug par sems par 'gyur ba dag ste zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi yal ga dang 'dab ma dang lo ma la 'jug par sems par 'gyur ba dag ste zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Those who think of going elsewhere, who do not listen to this profound perfection of wisdom, who do not take it up, bear it in mind, recite and study it, who do not exert themselves in accordance with the Dharma, who do not think of the branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits of that tree,

original: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi mnyan par gud du 'gro bar sems dpa'i skyon dang dpe bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi mnyan par gud du 'gro bar sems dpa'i skyon dang dpe bstan pa ste /
translated: those who think of going elsewhere in the way explained above, the faults and examples of those who do not listen to this profound perfection of wisdom are taught.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrub pa yin te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the accomplishment of the exalted wisdom of omniscience.

original: shing gi rtsa ba dang 'dra ba theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde 'di shing gi yal ga dang 'dab ma dang lo ma dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: shing gi rtsa ba dang 'dra ba theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde 'di shing gi yal ga dang 'dab ma dang lo ma dang 'dra ste /
translated: The sutras of the Lesser Vehicle are like the roots of a tree, and this perfection of wisdom is like the branches, leaves, and fruits of that tree.

original: don chen po bor nas don chung ngu la zhugs pa yin pas de ltar byed pa yang bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'am /
analyzed: don chen po bor nas don chung ngu la zhugs pa yin pas de ltar byed pa yang bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'am /
translated: Having abandoned the great meaning, they engage in the lesser meaning. Thus, those who act like this are either blessed by Mara,

original: de ltar byed na bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byed na bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: or if they act like this, Mara finds an opportunity. Therefore, it should be known as the work of Mara.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su mi sgrub pa'i mdo sde kun chub par bgyi bar sems par 'gyur ba de dag gang lags zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su mi sgrub pa'i mdo sde kun chub par bgyi bar sems par 'gyur ba de dag gang lags zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He said, Bhagavan, what are those who think to master the sūtras that do not accomplish the wisdom of omniscience?

original: rab 'byor de dag ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i mdo sde gang las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bor zhing kun chub par bya bar sems pa ste /🔽rnam pa thams cad @89a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor de dag ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i mdo sde gang las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bor zhing kun chub par bya bar sems pa ste / rnam pa thams cad @89a * //
translated: Subhūti, those are the sūtras that are associated with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and they think to master the perfection of wisdom that is rejected from them.

original: mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su mi sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su mi sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: They do not accomplish the wisdom of omniscience.

original: theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde shing gi yal ga dang 'dra ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i ye shes mi sgrub pa gang yin pa'i dmigs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde shing gi yal ga dang 'dra ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i ye shes mi sgrub pa gang yin pa'i dmigs bstan pa'o //
translated: This passage teaches the reference that is the sūtras of the Lesser Vehicle, which are like the branches of a tree, and do not accomplish the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba nas ;
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba nas ;
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la slob pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la slob pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: By the passage, he trains in the mundane and supramundane dharmas,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad na 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad zhar la spyad par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad na 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad zhar la spyad par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: it is taught that if one practices the perfection of wisdom, one will practice all mundane and supramundane dharmas as a by-product.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na khyi la la zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na khyi la la zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: By the passage beginning Subhuti, it is thus: for example, a certain dog,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bor te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bor te /
translated: it is taught that one who abandons this profound perfection of wisdom

original: theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde la spyod pa don bzang po bor te ngan pa tshol ba khyis zan bzang bo bor te ngan pa tshol ba las dpe blangs te bstan pa ste /🔽de ltar byed pa yang bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'am /
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde la spyod pa don bzang po bor te ngan pa tshol ba khyis zan bzang bo bor te ngan pa tshol ba las dpe blangs te bstan pa ste / de ltar byed pa yang bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'am /
translated: and practices the sutras of the Lesser Vehicle, abandoning the good meaning and seeking the bad, is an example of a dog who abandons good food and seeks the bad.🔽 And it is taught that one who acts like that, being blessed by Mara,

original: de ltar byed pa bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: or one who acts like that, being found by Mara, should know it as Mara's deed.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yul dang dus la la na theg pa chen po la spyod pa ni nyung zhing mi btsun par byed theg pa chung ngu la spyod pa ni mang zhing btsun par byed pa yod
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yul dang dus la la na theg pa chen po la spyod pa ni nyung zhing mi btsun par byed theg pa chung ngu la spyod pa ni mang zhing btsun par byed pa yod
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, in the future time, etc. means that in some places and times, those who practice the Great Vehicle are few and are treated with contempt, while those who practice the Lesser Vehicle are many and are treated with respect.

original: de de lta bur gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de de lta bur gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: When that is the case,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bor te khe dang bkur sti'i phyir theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde la spyod na /🔽de ltar byed pa yang bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bor te khe dang bkur sti'i phyir theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde la spyod na / de ltar byed pa yang bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'am /
translated: they will abandon this profound perfection of wisdom and practice the sūtras of the Lesser Vehicle for the sake of profit and honor.🔽Even if they do that, it should be recognized as the work of Māra because it is blessed by Māra,

original: de ltar byed na bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byed na bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: or because if they act like that, Māra will find an opportunity.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na mi la la zhig glang po che 'dod la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bor te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na mi la la zhig glang po che 'dod la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bor te /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this: for example, a person who desires an elephant, etc. means that they will abandon this profound perfection of wisdom and practice the sūtras of the Lesser Vehicle.

original: theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde la spyod pa dman pa'i dpe mi blun po las blangs pa bstan pa ste /🔽de ltar byed pa yang bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'am /
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde la spyod pa dman pa'i dpe mi blun po las blangs pa bstan pa ste / de ltar byed pa yang bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'am /
translated: This shows the example of the inferior practice of the Sutras of the Lesser Vehicle, which is taken from a foolish person.🔽And such activity is also a work of Mara, because it is a blessing of Mara,

original: de ltar byed na bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byed na bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: or because Mara finds an opportunity when one acts in that way.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na mi zhig rgya mtsho chen po lta bar 'dod la zhes bya @89b ba la sogs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo bor te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na mi zhig rgya mtsho chen po lta bar 'dod la zhes bya @89b ba la sogs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo bor te /
translated: Subhuti, it is like a man who wants to see the great ocean, and so on, shows the example of abandoning the profound perfection of wisdom,

original: theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde tshol ba'i dpe rgya mtsho dang / ba lang gi rjes kyi chu las blangs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde tshol ba'i dpe rgya mtsho dang / ba lang gi rjes kyi chu las blangs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: and seeking the Sutras of the Lesser Vehicle, which is taken from the water of the ocean and the water in an ox's hoofprint.

original: de ltar byed pa yang snga ma bzhin du bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa yang snga ma bzhin du bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And such activity is also a work of Mara, because it is as before.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na phyva mkhan nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na phyva mkhan nam /
translated: Subhuti, it is like a man who wants to see the great ocean, and so on, shows the example of abandoning the profound perfection of wisdom,🔽and seeking the Sutras of the Lesser Vehicle, which is taken from the water of the ocean and the water in an ox's hoofprint.🔽And such activity is also a work of Mara, because it is as before.

original: phyva mkhan gyi slob ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bor te /
analyzed: phyva mkhan gyi slob ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bor te /
translated: The passage beginning Kausika, it is as if a pupil of an artist shows that those who abandon this profound perfection of wisdom and seek the knowledge of all aspects in the Lesser Vehicle are like a pupil of an artist who wishes to build a palace for Indra, the lord of the gods, in the palace called Victory, but who, having abandoned the measurements of the palaces of the sun and moon,

original: theg pa chung ngu las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshol bar sems pa phyva mkhan lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi khang pa rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba'i tshang du khang pa bdub par 'dod la nyi ma dang zla ba'i gzhal med khang las tshad
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshol bar sems pa phyva mkhan lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi khang pa rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba'i tshang du khang pa bdub par 'dod la nyi ma dang zla ba'i gzhal med khang las tshad
translated: wishes to build a palace by his own idea alone.

original: blangs te / khang pa dbubs pa las dpe blangs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: blangs te / khang pa dbubs pa las dpe blangs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the example of one who thinks, I will build a palace.

original: de ltar byed pa yang bdud kyi las su rig par bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa yang bdud kyi las su rig par bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: And this should be recognized as the work of Mara, as before.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu la la zhig 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po mthong bar 'dod la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bor nas theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde las /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu la la zhig 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po mthong bar 'dod la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bor nas theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde las /
translated: The passage beginning Subhuti, it is as if a man who wishes to see the universal monarch shows that those who abandon this profound perfection of wisdom and seek the knowledge of all aspects in the Lesser Vehicle are like one who wishes to see the universal monarch but looks at a king of a small country, or like one who wishes to see the ocean but looks at a puddle, or like one who wishes to see the king of mountains but looks at an anthill.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid btsal bar sems pa 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang / khams kyi rgyal phran las dpe blangs nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid btsal bar sems pa 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang / khams kyi rgyal phran las dpe blangs nas bstan pa ste /
translated: The attitude of seeking omniscience is taught by way of an analogy with a universal emperor and the minor kings of the various provinces.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang / khams kyi rgyal phran gnyis rgyal po'i cha byad tsam du 'drar zin kyang /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang / khams kyi rgyal phran gnyis rgyal po'i cha byad tsam du 'drar zin kyang /
translated: Although the universal emperor and the minor kings of the various provinces are alike in merely having the appearance of kings,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po la ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / rin po che sna bdun la sogs pa mnga' ba'i yon tan dang ldan gyi /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po la ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / rin po che sna bdun la sogs pa mnga' ba'i yon tan dang ldan gyi /
translated: the universal emperor has the good qualities of the thirty-two marks of a great being, the seven precious articles of a king, and so forth,🔽whereas the minor kings of the various provinces do not have such good qualities and are not alike.

original: khams kyi rgyal phran la yon tan de lta bu dang mi ldan te mi 'dra ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di dang theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde gnyis kyang /
analyzed: khams kyi rgyal phran la yon tan de lta bu dang mi ldan te mi 'dra ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di dang theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde gnyis kyang /
translated: In the same way, although the profound perfection of wisdom and the sutras of the Hinayana are alike in being the word of the Buddha,

original: mdo sde tsam du 'dra yang yon tan tha dad de mi 'dra bal theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid btsal par sems pa bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde tsam du 'dra yang yon tan tha dad de mi 'dra bal theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid btsal par sems pa bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that one should know that the thought of seeking omniscience in the sutras of the Lesser Vehicle is the work of Mara.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu shin tu bkres pa la la zhig gis ro brgya dang ldan pa'i kha zas rnyed kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu shin tu bkres pa la la zhig gis ro brgya dang ldan pa'i kha zas rnyed kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this: for example, if a person who is extremely hungry finds food that has a hundred flavors, and so forth.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bor nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bor nas /
translated: It is taught by way of an example of someone who has abandoned this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde las rnam pa thams cad @90a * //
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde las rnam pa thams cad @90a * //
translated: and who thinks that omniscience is attained from the sutras of the Lesser Vehicle.

original: mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa mi la la zhig kha zas zhim po ro brgya dang ldan pa bor te /
analyzed: mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa mi la la zhig kha zas zhim po ro brgya dang ldan pa bor te /
translated: It is like someone who has abandoned delicious food with a hundred flavors,

original: 'bras drug cu pa zhes bya ba'i kha zas bza' bar sems pa las dpe blangs te bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras drug cu pa zhes bya ba'i kha zas bza' bar sems pa las dpe blangs te bstan pa ste /
translated: and who thinks to eat food called sixty grains.

original: drug cu pa'i kha zas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: drug cu pa'i kha zas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The food called sixty grains is

original: 'bras dmar po ngan pa zhig zhag drug cus smin par 'gyur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras dmar po ngan pa zhig zhag drug cus smin par 'gyur ba la bya'o //
translated: It is a bad, red rice that ripens in sixty days.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu la la zhig gis nor bu rin po che rin thang med pa rnyed nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu la la zhig gis nor bu rin po che rin thang med pa rnyed nas /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this: Suppose some man finds a priceless gem.🔽Thinking to put it in a clay pot,

original: nor bu mching bu dang bskrun par bsams na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: nor bu mching bu dang bskrun par bsams na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: he puts it in a goatskin bag.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bor nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bor nas /
translated: In this way, having abandoned this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid btsal bar sems pa nor bu rin po che dang mching bu las dpe blangs nas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu'i mdo sde las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid btsal bar sems pa nor bu rin po che dang mching bu las dpe blangs nas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: thinking to seek the knowledge of all aspects in the sūtras of the Lesser Vehicle, taking the example of a priceless gem and a goatskin bag, one should know it to be the work of Māra.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dri ba'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dri ba'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, furthermore, when those sons and daughters of good family are writing out this perfection of wisdom,

original: spobs pa mang po gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba'i dkrugs mar 'gyur ba de lta bu skye bar 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: spobs pa mang po gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba'i dkrugs mar 'gyur ba de lta bu skye bar 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The many kinds of eloquence that will arise in order to stir up this profound perfection of wisdom when it is being written out up to

original: rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, if, when sons of a good family and daughters of a good family in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas are writing out this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: chos de dag gis dkrugs par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: chos de dag gis dkrugs par mi 'gyur na /
translated: they are not stirred up by those dharmas,

original: rab 'byor de yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Subhūti, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas should know that this is the work of Māra.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dri ba'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dri ba'i tshe /
translated: When this perfection of wisdom is being written out,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs la mtshan mar 'dzin cing rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs 'byung na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs la mtshan mar 'dzin cing rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs 'byung na /
translated: if various signs are apprehended in various dharmas such as form, and various thoughts arise,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa byung na de yang bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa byung na de yang bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: If discursive thought arises in the non-discursive perfection of wisdom, that also should be recognized as the work of Mara.

original: spobs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i blo skye ba la bya'o //
analyzed: spobs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i blo skye ba la bya'o //
translated: Discursive thought means the arising of the mind that grasps at discursive thought and at signs.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Subhuti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bri bar nus sam zhes bya bas ni gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dri ba'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bri bar nus sam zhes bya bas ni gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dri ba'i tshe /
translated: Is it possible to write out the perfection of wisdom?

original: spobs pa mang po @90b byung na bdud kyi las su 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa la 'khor rnams kyi nang nas /
analyzed: spobs pa mang po @90b byung na bdud kyi las su 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa la 'khor rnams kyi nang nas /
translated: In the above, when it was said that discursive thought is the work of Mara,

original: kha cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brir yod pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: kha cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brir yod pa dang sbyar na /
translated: some in the assembly thought that the perfection of wisdom could be written out.

original: dngos po yod pa zhig yin nam snyam du rtog pa skyes pa bsal ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa zhig yin nam snyam du rtog pa skyes pa bsal ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: The question was asked in order to dispel the thought that it might be a real thing.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽Subhuti, it is not so.

original: rab 'byor de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te mi dmigs so //
translated: The reality of the knowledge of all modes does not exist, it is not apprehended.

original: ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: That nonapprehension of a reality is a nonthing.

original: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: That nonthing is the perfection of wisdom.

original: dngos po med pas dngos po med pa bri bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pas dngos po med pa bri bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: A nonthing cannot be diminished by a nonthing.

original: don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pas brir mi rung ba bstan pa'i zhar la /
analyzed: don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pas brir mi rung ba bstan pa'i zhar la /
translated: This shows that the perfection of wisdom is not to be diminished, because ultimately it is a nonthing.🔽This is a digression.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i mi dmigs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i mi dmigs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The nonapprehension of all dharmas is shown as the nonexistence of all dharmas.

original: rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di dngos po med ces bya bar 'du shes na /🔽de yang bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni dngos po zhig yod na de'i las /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di dngos po med ces bya bar 'du shes na / de yang bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni dngos po zhig yod na de'i las /
translated: Subhūti, if sons or daughters of good family in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas form the idea that this profound perfection of wisdom is a non-entity,🔽that also should be known as the work of Māra.

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba yang 'grub na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba yang 'grub na /
translated: This shows that if an entity existed, then a non-entity could be established.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas /
translated: But since this perfection of wisdom is not established as an entity ultimately,

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i 'du shes kyang bskyed du med pa las /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i 'du shes kyang bskyed du med pa las /
translated: the idea of a non-entity cannot be formed.

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes skyes na med pa'i mtha' la chags pas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes skyes na med pa'i mtha' la chags pas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If the idea of a non-entity is formed, since one would be attached to the extreme of non-existence, it should be known as the work of Māra.🔽The request:

original: gsol pa / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di yi ger bris nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di yi ger bris nas /
translated: Some sons or daughters of good family in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, having written out this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bdag gis bris so zhes mchi na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bdag gis bris so zhes mchi na /
translated: “I have written this profound perfection of wisdom.”

original: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la yi ger mngon par chags dpa lags te zhes bya ba nas ;
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la yi ger mngon par chags dpa lags te zhes bya ba nas ;
translated: That is attachment to the letters of this profound perfection of wisdom, and so on, up to

original: yi ge ma mchis pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mngon par chags par bgyid na /
analyzed: yi ge ma mchis pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mngon par chags par bgyid na /
translated: attachment to the non-letter knowledge of all aspects.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: That also should be known by bodhisattva great beings as the work of Māra.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yi ger 'dri ba'i tshe yang dngos @91a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yi ger 'dri ba'i tshe yang dngos @91a * //
translated: This passage shows that when this perfection of wisdom is being written down,

original: 'khor gyi nang nas kha cig sems zhum par 'gyur ba dag kyang srid de de dag spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la 'bad na /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang nas kha cig sems zhum par 'gyur ba dag kyang srid de de dag spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la 'bad na /
translated: It is also possible that some in the retinue may become discouraged, so in order to encourage them, if they strive to complete the perfection of wisdom and so forth,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthu gtong zhing byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthu gtong zhing byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: the powerful Buddhas, the Transcendent Conquerors, will bestow their blessings.

original: bdud kyis bar chad bya mi nus par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyis bar chad bya mi nus par bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that Mara will not be able to create obstacles.

original: des rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri'o klog go zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: des rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri'o klog go zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: By that, those sons of good lineage and daughters of good lineage will write out this profound perfection of wisdom, and so forth up to they will complete the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa la sogs pa la 'bad na /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa la sogs pa la 'bad na /
translated: By striving in writing out, reading, and so forth this perfection of wisdom,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthu gtong zhing byin gyis rlob pa des /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthu gtong zhing byin gyis rlob pa des /
translated: the powerful Buddhas, the Transcendent Conquerors, will bestow their blessings.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed nus pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed nus pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: The benefits of the perfection of wisdom are shown, from the perfection of giving up to the perfection of wisdom, and from the four applications of mindfulness up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag @94b kyang /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag @94b kyang /
translated: The buddhas, the bhagavats, in the eastern direction, as many as there are,

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bogs pa dang / kha ton bya ba dang / bstan pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bya ba'i phyir dgongs pa mdzad do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / lung 'bogs pa dang / kha ton bya ba dang / bstan pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bya ba'i phyir dgongs pa mdzad do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: those buddhas, the bhagavats, also think of those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who write out this perfection of wisdom, who study it, who take it up, who master it, who teach it, who recite it from memory, who explain it, and who properly pay attention to it, saying,

original: steng gi phyogs kyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: steng gi phyogs kyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang /
translated: those bodhisattva great beings in the upper direction who are irreversible

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / lung 'bogs pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de dag gi don du brtson par byed cing yongs su 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang / lung 'bogs pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de dag gi don du brtson par byed cing yongs su 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The passage from Subhuti, if a son or daughter of good family writes, etc., this perfection of wisdom up to for the sake of those who write, etc., this perfection of wisdom, they will exert themselves and take it up indicates

original: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa la sogs pa la 'bad cing brtson pa de dag la phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' phyir mo ldog pa rnams kyang dgongs shing mthu gtong ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri ba dang / klog pa la sogs pa la 'bad cing brtson pa de dag la phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' phyir mo ldog pa rnams kyang dgongs shing mthu gtong ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: the benefit of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas of the ten directions thinking of and bestowing power on those sons and daughters of good family who strive and exert themselves in writing, reading, etc., this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na bud med pa la la zhig la bu lnga'am bcu'am nyi shu'am sum cu'am bzhi bcu'am lnga bcu'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na bud med pa la la zhig la bu lnga'am bcu'am nyi shu'am sum cu'am bzhi bcu'am lnga bcu'am /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this: Suppose a woman has five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, or fifty sons.

original: brgya'am stong zhig yod na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: brgya'am stong zhig yod na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: up to

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par gzigs shing dgongs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par gzigs shing dgongs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni
translated: Therefore, the Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones always and uninterruptedly watch over and consider this profound perfection of wisdom with the eye of the Buddha.

original: / 'jig rten na ma la bu rnams drin la lan ldon zhing rim gro dang bkur sti byed pa de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ba'i phyir yum dang 'dra bar dgongs te /
analyzed: / 'jig rten na ma la bu rnams drin la lan ldon zhing rim gro dang bkur sti byed pa de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ba'i phyir yum dang 'dra bar dgongs te /
translated: Just as in the world, sons repay the kindness of their mothers and serve and honor them, in the same way, the Blessed Buddhas of the ten directions consider this perfection of wisdom to be like a mother, because it arises from it.

original: drin la lan ldon zhing rim gro dang bkur sti mdzad pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: drin la lan ldon zhing rim gro dang bkur sti mdzad pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that they repay the kindness and serve and honor it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: From this has come the perfection of meditative stabilization of the tathāgatas, the saints, the genuinely and fully awake buddhas.

original: de dag thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te /
translated: All of them have relied on this profound perfection of wisdom

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs @95a * //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs @95a * //
translated: and have fully awakened to unsurpassed, genuine and complete enlightenment.

original: rgyas so // mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: rgyas so // mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: They have fully awakened,🔽and they will fully awaken

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: to unsurpassed, genuine and complete enlightenment.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yum dang 'dra bar dgongs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yum dang 'dra bar dgongs te /
translated: The thought of all the tathāgatas is that this perfection of wisdom is like a mother.

original: rim gro dang / bkur sti bya ba'i gtan tshigs su rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ste /
analyzed: rim gro dang / bkur sti bya ba'i gtan tshigs su rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ste /
translated: The reason for the worship and honor is that all the dharmas of purification and all the noble persons have come forth from this perfection of wisdom.

original: thams cad kyi rgyu dang gzhi yin pa'i phyir rim gro dang / bkur sti bya ba'i gnas yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rgyu dang gzhi yin pa'i phyir rim gro dang / bkur sti bya ba'i gnas yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that it is the basis of worship and honor because it is the cause and ground of all.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti, the sons and daughters of good family in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas who write out this profound perfection of wisdom, read it, and so on,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur bar rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bsrung ba mdzad do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur bar rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bsrung ba mdzad do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: will never retrogress from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. They are always and uninterruptedly protected.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa la sogs pa byed pa la yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams spyan ras kyis 'tsho zhing byin gyis rlob pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dri zhing klog pa la sogs pa byed pa la yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams spyan ras kyis 'tsho zhing byin gyis rlob pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: The benefits of copying, reading, etc. this profound perfection of wisdom are also taught as the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, looking after and blessing those who do so.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'di skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'di skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The Blessed One has said, 'The perfection of wisdom is the producer of the Tathagatas, the Saints, the genuinely and fully awake Buddhas.'🔽 and so on.

original: gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bskyed pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bskyed pa yin zhing /
translated: This explains that the perfection of wisdom is the producer of the Tathagatas,

original: 'jig rten ston pa yin pa'i phyir rim gro dang bkur sti bya ba'i gnas yin par bshad pa las glengs nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten ston pa yin pa'i phyir rim gro dang bkur sti bya ba'i gnas yin par bshad pa las glengs nas /
translated: and that it is the teacher of the world, and so is the basis for respect and honor.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bskyed pa yin pa dang / ji ltar 'jig rten ston pa yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams thabs ji lta bur bskyod pa dang / 'jig rten zhes bya ba yang gang yin pa rnams zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bskyed pa yin pa dang / ji ltar 'jig rten ston pa yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams thabs ji lta bur bskyod pa dang / 'jig rten zhes bya ba yang gang yin pa rnams zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: The question is asked in order to open up the opportunity for a detailed explanation of how the perfection of wisdom gives rise to the Tathagatas, how it shows the world, and how the Tathagatas move about by what means, and what the world is called.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bskyed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bskyed do //
translated: Subhuti, this perfection of wisdom gives rise to the ten powers of the Tathagata.

original: rab 'byor de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dis de @95b bzhin gshegs pa bskyed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ji ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dis de @95b bzhin gshegs pa bskyed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ji ltar na /
translated: Subhuti, therefore this deep perfection of wisdom gives rise to the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yin pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yin pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage shows how this perfection of wisdom is the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du /
translated: The ten powers of the Tathagata, and so on, up to the knowledge of all modes,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi chos rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi chos rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: the dharmas of the Tathagata's qualities have issued from this perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Tathagata is generated.🔽Subhuti: What is the world about which the Lord has said that this perfection of wisdom teaches the world?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i 'jig rten gang lags zhes bya ba ni gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa 'jig rten zhes bya ba gang la bya ba zhib tu bstan pa'i skabs
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i 'jig rten gang lags zhes bya ba ni gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa 'jig rten zhes bya ba gang la bya ba zhib tu bstan pa'i skabs
translated: Here Subhuti asks in detail about the world, which was mentioned above in the statement that this perfection of wisdom teaches the world.

original: dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: In order to make a division, he asks.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord:

original: phung po lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten du gsungs so zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rang bzhin la rten cing gnas pa'i phyir phung po lnga la 'jig rten zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten du gsungs so zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rang bzhin la rten cing gnas pa'i phyir phung po lnga la 'jig rten zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that the five aggregates are called the world because they are the basis and support of the nature of destruction.🔽Subhūti asks, “Blessed One, how are the five aggregates taught by the profound perfection of wisdom?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mos phung po lnga ni ji ltar bstan pa lags zhes bya ba ni de ltar phung po lang 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mos phung po lnga ni ji ltar bstan pa lags zhes bya ba ni de ltar phung po lang 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: In this way, the five aggregates have the nature of destruction.

original: dngos po med pa yin na bstan du yang ji ltar rung zhes rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yin na bstan du yang ji ltar rung zhes rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: If they are non-existent, how can they be taught? This is what Subhūti asks.🔽“Blessed One, how does the perfection of wisdom teach the five aggregates?”

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ji lta bur phung po lnga ston pa lags zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga po dngos po med pa de dag ston na yang thabs ji ltar ston pa lags zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ji lta bur phung po lnga ston pa lags zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga po dngos po med pa de dag ston na yang thabs ji ltar ston pa lags zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: If those five aggregates, which are non-existent, are taught, by what method are they taught? This is what he asks.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phung po lnga po 'di dag 'jig par ston pa ma yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phung po lnga po 'di dag 'jig par ston pa ma yin /
translated: The perfection of wisdom does not teach the destruction of these five aggregates,

original: rab tu 'jig par ston pa ma yin te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab tu 'jig par ston pa ma yin te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: nor does it teach their utter destruction.

original: rab 'byor de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten ston par gsungs te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten ston par gsungs te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Up to: “Subhūti, thus the Tathāgata has said that the perfection of wisdom teaches the world.”

original: don dam par phung po lnga po 'di dag stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang /
analyzed: don dam par phung po lnga po 'di dag stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang /
translated: Ultimately, these five aggregates are emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-application, non-arising, non-entity,

original: rang bzhin me dpas 'jig pa dang rab 'jig pa mi srid pa'i phyir phung po lnga po 'di dag 'jig par ston pa ma yin /
analyzed: rang bzhin me dpas 'jig pa dang rab 'jig pa mi srid pa'i phyir phung po lnga po 'di dag 'jig par ston pa ma yin /
translated: and essencelessness. Therefore, it is impossible for them to be destroyed or utterly destroyed. Thus, the perfection of wisdom does not teach the destruction of these five aggregates,

original: rab tu 'jig par ston pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rab tu 'jig par ston pa ma yin te /
translated: nor does it teach their utter destruction.

original: skye @96a * //
analyzed: skye @96a * //
translated: Arising,

original: ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar mi ston pa nyid phung po lnga'i 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar mi ston pa nyid phung po lnga'i 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: and the five aggregates are not taught as arising, or ceasing, or as afflicted, or purified, or increasing, or decreasing, or as taken up, or put down, or as past, or future, or present.

original: rab 'byor sems can tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa'i sems dang spyod pa mkhyen pa de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid la brten cing rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems can tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa'i sems dang spyod pa mkhyen pa de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid la brten cing rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Subhūti, those who know the minds and conduct of countless, immeasurable, and limitless sentient beings know them based on the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la ni sems can med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la ni sems can med do //
translated: Subhūti, in this profound perfection of wisdom there are no sentient beings,
