translated: The Tathāgata has taught the knowledge of things as they really are, namely, that one who speaks in that way does so because of apprehending a self in the five aggregates.

original: bdag dang 'jig rten rtag kyang rtog la mi rtag kyang mi rtag go zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten rtag kyang rtog la mi rtag kyang mi rtag go zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: “The world is permanent and impermanent, and it is also not so that it is both permanent and impermanent,” and “that alone is true, the rest is false,” is based on form.

original: de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is based on feeling.

original: de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is based on perception.

original: de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is based on volitional formations.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya bas ni mu stegs can rtag pa dang / chad pa gnyis ka yod par sgro 'dogs pa'i sems kyi spyod pa bkram pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya bas ni mu stegs can rtag pa dang / chad pa gnyis ka yod par sgro 'dogs pa'i sems kyi spyod pa bkram pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
translated: It is based on consciousness.” This shows the knowledge of the proliferation of the activity of the mind that is the superimposition of both permanence and annihilation of the tīrthikas.

original: mu stegs can rtag pa dang chad pa gnyis ka yod par sgro 'dogs pa yang phung po lnga la brten te smra ba tsam du zad kyi phung po lnga las lhag pa bdag ces bya ba rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa gnyis ka'i rang bzhin can gang yang med par thugs su chud pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to zhes bstan pa'o //🔽bdag dang @100a * //
analyzed: mu stegs can rtag pa dang chad pa gnyis ka yod par sgro 'dogs pa yang phung po lnga la brten te smra ba tsam du zad kyi phung po lnga las lhag pa bdag ces bya ba rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa gnyis ka'i rang bzhin can gang yang med par thugs su chud pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to zhes bstan pa'o // bdag dang @100a * //
translated: The tīrthikas’ superimposition of both permanence and annihilation is merely talk based on the five aggregates. He has realized that there is no self, which is something other than the five aggregates, that has the nature of both permanence and impermanence. This is also taught to be the perfect, just, and true Dharma.🔽The self and the world are neither permanent nor impermanent.🔽This is the only truth, and the rest is meaningless.

original: 'jig rten ni rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //🔽de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med do zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o // de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on form.🔽This is based on feeling.

original: de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on perception.

original: de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on volitional factors.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya bas ni mu stegs can rtag pa dang chad pa gnyis ka med par skur ba 'debs pa'i sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya bas ni mu stegs can rtag pa dang chad pa gnyis ka med par skur ba 'debs pa'i sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase it abides in consciousness indicates the knowledge of the mental activity of the tīrthikas who deny both permanence and annihilation.

original: rtag chad gnyis ka med ces smra ba yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra ba tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: rtag chad gnyis ka med ces smra ba yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra ba tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Those who say neither permanence nor annihilation merely speak in that way while holding the five aggregates to be a self.

original: rtag chad gnyis ka med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag ces bya ba ni gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rtag chad gnyis ka med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag ces bya ba ni gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that there is no so-called self that has the nature of neither permanence nor annihilation.

original: bdag dang 'jig rten ni mtha' dang ldan pa zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten ni mtha' dang ldan pa zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase the self and the world have an end is the only truth, and the rest is meaningless. This is based on form.

original: de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //🔽de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o // de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on feeling.🔽This is based on discrimination.

original: de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on compositional factors.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can 'khor ba la mtha' yod par lta ba'i sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can 'khor ba la mtha' yod par lta ba'i sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
translated: That is based on consciousness. This shows the knowledge of the activity of the mind of the tīrthikas who view cyclic existence as having an end.

original: de skad smra ba yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra ba tsam du zad kyi yang dag par na mtha' dang ldan pa'i bdag gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de skad smra ba yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra ba tsam du zad kyi yang dag par na mtha' dang ldan pa'i bdag gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: That is said by those who, taking the five aggregates as a self, merely speak. But in reality, there is no self at all that has an end. This teaches that.

original: bdag dang 'jig rten ni mtha' dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten ni mtha' dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: The self and the world have an end. Just that is true, the others are meaningless. That is based on form.

original: de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: That is based on feeling.

original: de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o //
translated: That is based on perception.

original: de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
translated: That is based on volitional factors.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can kha cig 'khor ba mtha' med par lta ba'i sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can kha cig 'khor ba mtha' med par lta ba'i sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
translated: That is based on consciousness. This shows the knowledge of the activity of the mind of some tīrthikas who view cyclic existence as having no end.

original: de skad du smra ba yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra bar zad kyi yang dag par na phung po lnga las lhag pa gud na bdag ces bya ba gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de skad du smra ba yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra bar zad kyi yang dag par na phung po lnga las lhag pa gud na bdag ces bya ba gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught in order to show that when one speaks in this way, one speaks while holding the five aggregates to be the self, but in reality there is no self at all that is separate from the five aggregates.

original: bdag dang 'jig rten ni mtha' dang ldan pa yang yin la /
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten ni mtha' dang ldan pa yang yin la /
translated: The self and the world are both finite and infinite,🔽and that alone is true, the rest is meaningless.

original: mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang yin zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang yin zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on form.

original: de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on feeling.

original: de ni 'du shes @100b la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du shes @100b la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on perception.

original: de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on volitional factors.🔽This is based on consciousness.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can kha cig 'khor ba mtha' yod pa dang mtha' med pa gnyis kar sgro 'dogs shing smra ba'i sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can kha cig 'khor ba mtha' yod pa dang mtha' med pa gnyis kar sgro 'dogs shing smra ba'i sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the knowledge of the conduct of the mind of some tīrthikas who superimpose and speak of both the finitude and infinitude of saṃsāra.

original: de skad du smra ba yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung na smra btsam du zad kyi yang dag par na bdag ces bya ba gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de skad du smra ba yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung na smra btsam du zad kyi yang dag par na bdag ces bya ba gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And this statement is made in order to teach that if the five aggregates are taken to be the self, then it is just a statement, but in reality there is no such thing as a self at all.

original: bdag dang 'jig rten ni mtha' dang ldan pa yang ma yin mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten ni mtha' dang ldan pa yang ma yin mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: The statement “The self and the world are neither finite nor infinite” is true, but the other is meaningless, is based on form.

original: de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is based on feeling.

original: de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is based on perception.

original: de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is based on volitional factors.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba de ni mu stegs can kha cig 'khor ba mtha' yod pa dang / mtha' med pa gnyis ka ma yin par skur ba 'debs shing smra ba'i sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba de ni mu stegs can kha cig 'khor ba mtha' yod pa dang / mtha' med pa gnyis ka ma yin par skur ba 'debs shing smra ba'i sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
translated: It is based on consciousness. This teaches the knowledge of the minds of those tīrthikas who deny both finitude and infinitude of the self and the world, and who speak in this way.

original: de skad du smra ba yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra ba tsam du zad kyi yang dag par na bdag ces bya ba gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de skad du smra ba yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra ba tsam du zad kyi yang dag par na bdag ces bya ba gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And this statement is just a statement that takes the five aggregates to be the self. In reality, there is no such thing as a self.

original: lus de srog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lus de srog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: “That body is alive” is a statement that is true, while the opposite is meaningless. This is a statement based on form.

original: de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is a statement based on feeling.🔽This is a statement based on perception.🔽This is a statement based on volitional factors.

original: de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o //🔽de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o // de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is a statement based on consciousness.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can kha cig srog ces bya ba'i bdag lus dang tha mi dad par smra ba'i sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can kha cig srog ces bya ba'i bdag lus dang tha mi dad par smra ba'i sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This is a teaching on the activities of the mind of some tīrthikas who say that the self, which they call the life force, is not different from the body.

original: de skad du smra ba yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra ba tsam du zad kyi yang dag par na bdag ces bya ba gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de skad du smra ba yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra ba tsam du zad kyi yang dag par na bdag ces bya ba gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And this statement is just a statement that takes the five aggregates to be the self. In reality, there is no such thing as a self.

original: srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
analyzed: srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan zhes bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
translated: “Life is one thing, the body is another” is true,🔽but the other is meaningless.

original: gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on form.

original: de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on feeling.🔽This is based on perception.🔽This is based on volitional factors.

original: de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o //🔽de ni 'du byed la gnas dpa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o // de ni 'du byed la gnas dpa'o //
translated: This is based on consciousness.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can kha cig srog ces bya ba'i bdag dang lus gnyis tha dad par smra ba'i sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can kha cig srog ces bya ba'i bdag dang lus gnyis tha dad par smra ba'i sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching of the knowledge of the mental activity of some tīrthikas who say that life and the self are different from the body.

original: de skad du smra ba yang @101a * //
analyzed: de skad du smra ba yang @101a * //
translated: The statement

original: phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra ba tsam du zad kyi yang dag par na srog ces bya ba'i bdag gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra ba tsam du zad kyi yang dag par na srog ces bya ba'i bdag gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: is merely a statement made by grasping the five aggregates as a self. In reality, there is no self at all called life.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod ces bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod ces bya ba de nyid bden gyi /
translated: “The Tathāgata exists after death” is true,🔽but the other is meaningless.

original: gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on form.

original: de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: That is to say, they are attached to the notion of form,🔽attached to the notion of feeling,

original: de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o //
translated: attached to the notion of perception,

original: de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
translated: attached to the notion of mental formations,🔽and attached to the notion of consciousness.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can chad par lta ba kha cig de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can chad par lta ba kha cig de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe /
translated: Some tīrthikas who hold the view of annihilation say that when the Tathāgata passes into nirvāṇa,🔽his karma and afflictions are exhausted and he is not reborn in saṃsāra.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa zad de slar 'khor bar mi skye'o zhes bya ba de ni brdzun gyi /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa zad de slar 'khor bar mi skye'o zhes bya ba de ni brdzun gyi /
translated: They say that this is true,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni so so'i skye bo dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni so so'i skye bo dang 'dra bar /
translated: but that the Tathāgata, like ordinary beings,

original: tshe 'das nas kyang 'khor bar slar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshe 'das nas kyang 'khor bar slar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: is reborn in saṃsāra after death.🔽They say that he does not attain nirvāṇa without remainder.

original: phung po'i lhag ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gyur ro zhes smra ba'i sems kyi spyod pa 'phro ba mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gyur ro zhes smra ba'i sems kyi spyod pa 'phro ba mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the Buddha’s knowledge of the thoughts of those who say this.

original: de skad du smra ba yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas /
analyzed: de skad du smra ba yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas /
translated: They say this because they cling to the five aggregates as a self

original: rtag pa'i mtha' la chags pas smra bar zad kyi /
analyzed: rtag pa'i mtha' la chags pas smra bar zad kyi /
translated: and are attached to the extreme of permanence.

original: yang dag par na de lta bu'i rtag pa'i bdag med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par na de lta bu'i rtag pa'i bdag med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: In reality, there is no such permanent self.🔽Thus, “The Tathāgata does not exist after death” is the first extreme.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas med ces bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can chad par lta ba kha cig de bzhin gshegs pa tshe 'das nas /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas med ces bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can chad par lta ba kha cig de bzhin gshegs pa tshe 'das nas /
translated: Some tīrthikas, holding the view of annihilation, say that after the Tathāgata’s death,

original: phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par zad de med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i sems kyi spyod pa 'du ba mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par zad de med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i sems kyi spyod pa 'du ba mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
translated: he is extinguished without remainder and does not exist. This teaches the knowledge of the assembly of minds.

original: de skad zer ba de yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra ba tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: de skad zer ba de yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra ba tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Those who say this are merely speaking because they hold the five aggregates to be a self.

original: yang dag par na de lta bu'i bdag chad pa'i rang bzhin can gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par na de lta bu'i bdag chad pa'i rang bzhin can gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: In reality, there is no such self that has the nature of annihilation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod kyang yod la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod kyang yod la /
translated: The Tathāgata exists after death and also does not exist after death.

original: med kyang med ces bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can yod pa dang med pa gnyis ka yod par sgro 'dogs pa rnams kyi spyod pa bkram pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: med kyang med ces bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can yod pa dang med pa gnyis ka yod par sgro 'dogs pa rnams kyi spyod pa bkram pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
translated: “Even though it does not exist, it is said not to exist” refers to the fact that the Tathagata, after passing away, is not nonexistent, because his subtle intrinsic nature does not exist.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa tshe 'das kyang bdag gi rang bzhin phra mo med pa ma yin pa'i phyir yod kyang yod la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa tshe 'das kyang bdag gi rang bzhin phra mo med pa ma yin pa'i phyir yod kyang yod la /
translated: Even though he exists, he is said to exist,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa tshe 'das nas phung po rags par snang ba zhig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa tshe 'das nas phung po rags par snang ba zhig ste /
translated: because after the Tathagata passes away, the coarse aggregates do not appear.🔽Even though he does not exist, he is said not to exist, because after the Tathagata passes away, the coarse aggregates do not appear.

original: med pa'i phyir med kyang med ces zer ba de yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra ba tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir med kyang med ces zer ba de yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra ba tsam du zad kyi /
translated: However, this is merely a claim made by those who hold the aggregates to be the self.

original: yang dag par na yod med @101b gnyis ka'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag ni gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par na yod med @101b gnyis ka'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag ni gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: In reality, there is no self whatsoever that has the nature of both existence and nonexistence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod par 'gyur ba yang ma yin med par 'gyur ba yang ma yin zer ba de nyid bden gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod par 'gyur ba yang ma yin med par 'gyur ba yang ma yin zer ba de nyid bden gyi /
translated: “The Tathagata does not exist after death, nor does he not exist after death” is true.

original: gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o //🔽de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o // de ni tshor ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on form.🔽This is based on feeling.

original: de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du shes la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on perception.

original: de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du byed la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is based on volitional factors.🔽This is based on consciousness.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can kha cig yod pa dang med pa gnyis ka med par skur ba 'debs pa'i sems kyi spyod pa bcum pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can kha cig yod pa dang med pa gnyis ka med par skur ba 'debs pa'i sems kyi spyod pa bcum pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the knowledge of the ten types of conduct of the mind that deprecate both existence and nonexistence.

original: mu stegs can kha cig lta ba las bdag ces bya ba phra zhing zab pas /
analyzed: mu stegs can kha cig lta ba las bdag ces bya ba phra zhing zab pas /
translated: Some tīrthikas say that the self is subtle and profound,🔽so it is not suitable to describe it as either an existent or a nonexistent entity.

original: yod pa dang med pa gnyis ka'i dngos por brjod du mi rung ngo zhes zer ba de yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra ba tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa gnyis ka'i dngos por brjod du mi rung ngo zhes zer ba de yang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas smra ba tsam du zad kyi /
translated: That is just talk based on grasping the five aggregates as the self.

original: yang dag par na yod med gnyis ka'i mtha' dang bral ba'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par na yod med gnyis ka'i mtha' dang bral ba'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: In reality, there is no self at all that is free from the extremes of both existence and nonexistence.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
translated: Subhūti, in this way, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly accomplished Buddha,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te /
translated: having relied on this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol rnams kyi sems 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can rtag pa dang /
analyzed: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol rnams kyi sems 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can rtag pa dang /

analyzed: chad pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba 'debs par lta ba'i sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /

analyzed: 'phro ba ni rtag par lta ba'o // 'du ba ni chad par lta ba'o // bkram pa ni sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Scattering is the view of permanence.🔽Gathering is the view of annihilation.🔽Spreading is superimposition.

original: bcum pa ni skur ba 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: bcum pa ni skur ba 'debs pa ste /
translated: Contracting is denial.

original: de dag thams cad kyang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang phung po lnga la bdag tu bzung nas /
translated: All of these are due to apprehending the five aggregates as a self.

original: rtag chad du lta zhing sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba 'debs par zad kyi /
analyzed: rtag chad du lta zhing sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba 'debs par zad kyi /
translated: It is just a matter of reification and deprecation, of views of permanence and annihilation.

original: yang dag par na de lta bu'i bdag gang yang med par thugs su chud pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par na de lta bu'i bdag gang yang med par thugs su chud pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: But in reality, the realization that there is no such self at all is called “the knowledge of things just as they are.”

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te gzugs mkhyen to zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /🔽chos thams @102a * //

translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the Tathāgata, by relying on this profound perfection of wisdom, knows form, and so on.

original: cad de bzhin nyid ston pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: cad de bzhin nyid ston pa'i sgo nas /
translated: This shows that all phenomena are suchness.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This profound perfection of wisdom is what gives rise to the Tathāgata and teaches the world.

original: gzugs ji ltar mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: gzugs ji ltar mkhyen ce na /

translated: How does he know consciousness?🔽He knows suchness and the unerring nature of suchness as unchanging, nonconceptual, signless, inactive, free from elaborations, and unobservable.

original: dmigs su med pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rnam grangs te /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rnam grangs te /
translated: The term suchness and the terms unmistaken suchness, unchanging suchness, nonconceptual suchness, signless suchness, wishless suchness, unmoving suchness, unfabricated suchness, non-apprehensible suchness, and non-arisen suchness are synonyms for the dharmadhātu.

original: don dam par phung po lnga dngos po med pas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mkhyen to zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽rab 'byor de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te /
analyzed: don dam par phung po lnga dngos po med pas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mkhyen to zhes bya ba'i don to // rab 'byor de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te /
translated: The meaning is that the five aggregates are ultimately known to be empty by nature, as they are non-existent entities.🔽Subhūti, in the same way, the Tathāgata, based on this profound perfection of wisdom, knows the mental activity, gathering, spreading, and contraction of the minds of other sentient beings and other persons just as they are, and so forth.

original: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems kyi 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa rnams kyang de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems kyi 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa rnams kyang de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata, based on this profound perfection of wisdom, knows the mental activity, gathering, spreading, and contraction of the minds of other sentient beings and other persons just as they are, and so forth.

original: dmigs su med pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni ji ltar phung po lnga don dam par dngos po med de de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du mkhyen pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni ji ltar phung po lnga don dam par dngos po med de de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du mkhyen pa de bzhin du /
translated: The passage from “He knows the way things really are, which is beyond reference points” up to “He knows the way things really are, which is beyond reference points” teaches that just as the five aggregates are ultimately unreal and are known to be the nature of suchness,

original: sems can rnams kyi sems kyi spyod pa 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa rnams kyang don dam par dngos po med pas de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du mkhyen to zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems kyi spyod pa 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa rnams kyang don dam par dngos po med pas de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du mkhyen to zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: in the same way, the activities of the minds of sentient beings—their proliferation, their convergence, their expansion, and their contraction—are ultimately unreal and are known to be the nature of suchness.🔽Thus, the suchness of proliferation, convergence, expansion, and contraction🔽is the suchness of the aggregates.🔽The suchness of the aggregates is the suchness of the constituents.🔽The suchness of the constituents is the suchness of the sense spheres.

original: de ltar na 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de ltar na 'phro ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The suchness of the sense spheres is the suchness of the perfections.🔽The suchness of the perfections is the suchness of the levels.🔽The suchness of the levels is the suchness of the correct exertions.🔽The suchness of the correct exertions is the suchness of the bases of miraculous powers.🔽The suchness of the bases of miraculous powers is the suchness of the faculties.

original: phung po'i de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: phung po'i de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The suchness of the faculties is the suchness of the powers.🔽The suchness of the powers is the suchness of the branches of enlightenment.🔽The suchness of the branches of enlightenment is the suchness of the branches of the path.🔽The suchness of the branches of the path is the suchness of the emptiness of emptiness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa nyid do //🔽tha mi dad pa'i de bzhin nyid @102b do ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa nyid do // tha mi dad pa'i de bzhin nyid @102b do ;
translated: The suchness of the emptiness of emptiness is the suchness of the emptiness of ultimate reality.🔽The suchness of the emptiness of ultimate reality is the suchness of the emptiness of the conditioned.🔽The suchness of the emptiness of the conditioned is the suchness of the emptiness of the unconditioned.🔽The suchness of the emptiness of the unconditioned is the suchness of the emptiness of what is beyond extremes.🔽The suchness of what is beyond extremes is the suchness of the emptiness of all things.🔽The suchness of the emptiness of all things is the suchness of the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics.🔽The suchness of the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics is the suchness of the emptiness of nonobservation.🔽The suchness of the emptiness of nonobservation is the suchness of the emptiness of nonthings.🔽The suchness of the emptiness of nonthings is the suchness of the great emptiness.

original: / tha mi dad pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: / tha mi dad pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni mi zad pa ste /
translated: The suchness of the great emptiness is the

original: mi zad pa'i phyir gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dang / zag pa med pa'i chos dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad dang /
analyzed: mi zad pa'i phyir gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dang / zag pa med pa'i chos dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad dang /
translated: Because it is inexhaustible, it is nondual and indivisible.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad de bzhin nyid du ro gcig ste tha mi dad pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad de bzhin nyid du ro gcig ste tha mi dad pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to this point, it has been shown that all dharmas with outflows, dharmas without outflows, worldly dharmas, supramundane dharmas, and all noble persons are nondual because they are of one taste in suchness and are not different.

original: rab 'byor de ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: Subhūti, this is the suchness of all dharmas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te /
translated: The Tathāgata, relying on this perfection of wisdom,🔽fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'o zhes bya bas ni gong du bstan pa'i rim pas /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'o zhes bya bas ni gong du bstan pa'i rim pas /
translated: By this sequence of teachings above,

original: chos thams cad de bzhin nyid du ro gcig par de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pa yang /
analyzed: chos thams cad de bzhin nyid du ro gcig par de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pa yang /
translated: it is shown that the Tathāgata's realization that all dharmas are of one taste in suchness

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten nas thugs su chud de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten nas thugs su chud de /
translated: is a realization based on this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir /
translated: because he has fully and completely awakened to the world,

original: 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: he is the teacher of the world.

original: rab 'byor de lta bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de lta bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: Subhuti, therefore, this deep perfection of wisdom has generated the Tathagata,

original: 'jig rten ston pa'o zhes bya bas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa'i don gong du smos pa mjug bsdus nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten ston pa'o zhes bya bas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa'i don gong du smos pa mjug bsdus nas bstan pa'o //
translated: and is the teacher of the world.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid thugs su chud do //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid thugs su chud do //
translated: Thus, Subhuti, the Tathagata, Arhat, Fully Enlightened Buddha has understood the suchness of all dharmas,

original: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid thugs su chud do ;
analyzed: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid thugs su chud do ;
translated: has understood the unmistaken suchness, and the unaltered suchness.

analyzed: / de bzhin nyid des na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o zhes bya bas ni /
translated: And by that suchness, he is called a tathagata, an arhat, a fully enlightened being.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa'i don bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the meaning of the generation of the Tathagata by this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid bshad pa de dag rtogs pa las /

translated: From the realization of the suchness, the unmistaken suchness, and the unaltered suchness of all dharmas, which are taught in this perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob cing /
translated: the unsurpassed, perfect, full enlightenment is attained.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this profound perfection of wisdom is the generation of the Tathagata.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhuti:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /

analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma lags pa de bzhin nyid 'di ni zab pa ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Subhūti, the suchness of all phenomena, the unmistaken suchness, the unaltered suchness, this is profound, as explained above.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas chos de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /

analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid bshad pa'i don rab 'byor gyis rtogs nas /
translated: With this, Subhūti, having understood the meaning explained as the suchness of all phenomena,

translated: demonstrated the profundity of the perfection of wisdom, which teaches the suchness of all phenomena, and the rarity of individuals who have faith and confidence in such a profound meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this: suchness is inexhaustible, as explained above.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de bzhin nyid kyi don zab pa de nyid chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa'i sgo nas mi zad par bstan te de'i phyir zab bo zhes
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de bzhin nyid kyi don zab pa de nyid chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa'i sgo nas mi zad par bstan te de'i phyir zab bo zhes
translated: Therefore, it is explained as “profound.”

analyzed: bshad pa'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u sum cu gsum pa'o /
translated: This completes the thirty-third chapter of the extensive commentary on the perfection of wisdom in a hundred thousand lines.

original: // / de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu gang ji snyed pa de dag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: // / de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu gang ji snyed pa de dag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Then, as many sons of gods as there are in the desire and form realms of this world system of a billion worlds, beginning with “those sons of gods,”

original: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid du ston pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed bskyed pa yin pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin par bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid du ston pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed bskyed pa yin pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin par bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain how this profound perfection of wisdom is the source of the tathagatas and how it teaches the characteristics of all phenomena to be without characteristics, and in order to explain how it teaches the world,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid zhugs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid zhugs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: the gods of the great trichiliocosm asked the Bhagavan to teach the characteristics of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo bshad na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo bshad na /
translated: Bhagavan, when you explain the profound perfection of wisdom,🔽Bhagavan, what are the characteristics of the profound perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni gong du chos thams cad @103b de bzhin nyid gcig ste tha mi dad par bshad pa'i don ni bdag cag gis 'jal na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni gong du chos thams cad @103b de bzhin nyid gcig ste tha mi dad par bshad pa'i don ni bdag cag gis 'jal na /
translated: The meaning of the above explanation that the suchness of all phenomena is one and undifferentiated is something that we have contemplated.

original: de lta bu'i don zab mo ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu lags zhes zhus pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i don zab mo ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu lags zhes zhus pa ste /
translated: The question is: What is the defining characteristic of this profound perfection of wisdom that teaches such a profound meaning?

original: de skad du zhu ba yang gong du rab 'byor gyis chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab par bstan pa dang / 'khor gyi nang nas kha cig de lta bu'i zab pa de dngos po zhig yod dam snyam du rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de skad du zhu ba yang gong du rab 'byor gyis chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab par bstan pa dang / 'khor gyi nang nas kha cig de lta bu'i zab pa de dngos po zhig yod dam snyam du rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: This question is asked in order to dispel the thought of some in the assembly who, when Subhūti previously taught the profound perfection of wisdom that reveals the thatness of all phenomena, wondered whether such profundity was something existent.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Blessed One replied:🔽Divine sons, this profound perfection of wisdom has the characteristic of emptiness, up to...

original: lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Divine sons, this profound perfection of wisdom has the characteristic of space.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dngos po med pas mtshan nyid gang yang med do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dngos po med pas mtshan nyid gang yang med do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: It is taught that the perfection of wisdom is without any characteristics whatsoever, because it is not a thing.

original: stong pa nyid dang ; mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang ; mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang /
translated: Emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-application, non-production, non-cessation, non-affliction, non-purification,

original: dngos po med pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang // mi gnas pa dang / nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i rnam grangs te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang // mi gnas pa dang / nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i rnam grangs te /
translated: non-entity, naturelessness, the entityness of non-entity, non-abiding, and the characteristic of space are synonyms for non-existence.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin yin pas 'di ni mtshan nyid gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin yin pas 'di ni mtshan nyid gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since this profound perfection of wisdom has such a nature, it is taught that it is without any characteristics whatsoever.

original: lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni mtshan nyid de lta bu yin yang /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni mtshan nyid de lta bu yin yang /
translated: O sons of gods, although this profound perfection of wisdom has such characteristics,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi brdar bka' stsal te /🔽don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi brdar bka' stsal te / don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med de /
translated: The Tathagata teaches the conventional expressions of the world.🔽It is not the ultimate.

original: mtshan nyid med pa yin na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa yin na /
translated: Thus, if the perfection of wisdom is not a thing and does not have a characteristic,🔽what is there to explain?

original: bshad du yang ci zhig yod snyam du sems shing rtog pa la yi ge dang tshig tu brjod cing bshad pas /
analyzed: bshad du yang ci zhig yod snyam du sems shing rtog pa la yi ge dang tshig tu brjod cing bshad pas /
translated: Thinking and imagining that, he explains and teaches in words and letters.🔽For the sake of sentient beings to be trained, he merely explains and teaches in terms of the conventional expressions and mere conventions of the world.

original: 'dul ba'i sems can rnams kyi don du kun rdzob tu 'jig rten gyi brda dang tha snyad tsam du brjod cing bshad pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par ni brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas bshad du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i sems can rnams kyi don du kun rdzob tu 'jig rten gyi brda dang tha snyad tsam du brjod cing bshad pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par ni brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas bshad du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: He teaches that ultimately it is inexpressible and therefore cannot be explained.

original: lha'i bu dag @104a * //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag @104a * //
translated: Gods!

original: mtshan nyid de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis gzhan du bya bar mi nus so zhes bya bas ni don dam pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de mi 'gyur
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis gzhan du bya bar mi nus so zhes bya bas ni don dam pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de mi 'gyur
translated: The phrase “the world with its gods, humans, and demigods cannot alter this defining characteristic” indicates that the defining characteristic of the perfection of wisdom that is the profound emptiness of ultimate reality is unchanging.

original: ba yongs su grub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ba yongs su grub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa'i phyir /
translated: It is because it is fully present in the unmistakenly fully present reality.

original: dngos po yod pa'am gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin can du sus kyang bya mi nus so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa'am gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin can du sus kyang bya mi nus so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that no one can make it into something that exists or has the nature of an apprehended object or an apprehending subject.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten yang mtshan nyid der zad de zhes bya bas ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yod pa'i mtshan nyid du bya mi nus pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten yang mtshan nyid der zad de zhes bya bas ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yod pa'i mtshan nyid du bya mi nus pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas
translated: The phrase “the world with its gods, humans, and demigods is also just that defining characteristic” indicates the reason why the defining characteristic of emptiness cannot be made into the defining characteristic of something that exists.

original: pa'i 'jig rten yang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pas stong pas stong pa gzhan du bsgyur mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa'i 'jig rten yang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pas stong pas stong pa gzhan du bsgyur mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The world of beings is also characterized by emptiness, so emptiness cannot be transformed into another emptiness.

original: lha'i bu dag mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid gzhan du mi byed do zhes bya bas ni don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid gzhan du mi byed do zhes bya bas ni don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ste /
translated: The gods, a characteristic does not make another characteristic.

original: gzhan du bya ba dang / gzhan du byed pa gnyis ka yang don dam par de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir gzhan du mi byed do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du bya ba dang / gzhan du byed pa gnyis ka yang don dam par de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir gzhan du mi byed do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that both the transformation and the transformer are ultimately of one taste in emptiness, the characteristic of suchness.🔽A characteristic does not make a characteristic known.

original: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid shes par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid shes par mi byed do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid shes par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid shes par mi byed do zhes bstan pa ste /

original: dper na nam mkhas nam mkha' mi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkhas nam mkha' mi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, space does not know space.

original: mtshan nyid mtshan nyid med pa shes par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mtshan nyid med pa shes par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid shes par mi byed pa ste /
translated: The emptiness nature of reality is not known by the imagined nature, because it is the reality nature.

analyzed: dper na nam mkhas ri bong gi rva mi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, space is not known by the horn of a rabbit.

original: mtshan nyid med pa ni mtshan nyid med pa shes par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa dang / de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pas de bzhin nyid mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa ni mtshan nyid med pa shes par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa dang / de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pas de bzhin nyid mi shes pa ste /
translated: The absence of a nature is not known by the absence of a nature, because reality is not known by the imagined nature, because it is the reality nature.

original: dper na ri bong gi rvas nam mkha' mi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rvas nam mkha' mi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, space is not known by the horn of a rabbit.

analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa ni mtshan nyid med pa shes par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pas kun brtags pa mi shes pa ste /
translated: The absence of a nature is not known by the absence of a nature, because the imagined is not known by the imagined.

original: dper na ri bong gi rvas ri bong gi rva mi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rvas ri bong gi rva mi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the horn of a rabbit is not known by the horn of a rabbit.

analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid pa dang / mtshan nyid yod pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa de @104b gnyis ka la yang gang gis shes par bya ba dang / gang shes par bya ba dang / gang shes par byed pa de lta bu mi srid do zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid yod pa dang mtshan nyid med pa gnyis ka yang don dam par dngos po med pas shes pa gang gis shes par bya ba dang /
translated: As such, it is impossible for there to be a characteristic, a basis of characteristics, the existence of characteristics, and the nonexistence of characteristics, and also that which is to be known, that which is known, and that which causes knowledge.”🔽This teaches that since both the existence of characteristics and the nonexistence of characteristics are ultimately unreal, there is no knowledge whatsoever that is to be known,

analyzed: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Then the sons of gods who live in the desire realm and the form realm said to the Bhagavān, “Excellent, excellent!” and so forth.

original: gong du chos thams cad don dam par mtshan nyid med pa'i rang bzhin du bstan pa dang / kun rdzob tu 'jig rten gyi brdar chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid so sor phye ste bstan pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes lha'i tu rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa ste /
analyzed: gong du chos thams cad don dam par mtshan nyid med pa'i rang bzhin du bstan pa dang / kun rdzob tu 'jig rten gyi brdar chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid so sor phye ste bstan pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes lha'i tu rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa ste /
translated: This praises the Bhagavān, saying, “It is amazing that you have taught that ultimately all phenomena are by nature devoid of characteristics and that conventionally, in terms of worldly conventions, you have distinguished the characteristics of all phenomena.”

original: bcom ldan 'das mtshan nyid de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mtshan nyid de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
translated: Bhagavān, you have fully awakened to those characteristics.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa chos thams cad la thogs pa ma mchis par 'jug cing zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa'i stong pa'i mtshan nyid de dag thugs su chud pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kun rdzob tu chos thams cad la thags
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa chos thams cad la thogs pa ma mchis par 'jug cing zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa'i stong pa'i mtshan nyid de dag thugs su chud pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kun rdzob tu chos thams cad la thags
translated: The phrase “the tathāgata’s wisdom vision penetrates all dharmas without obstruction” means that, by comprehending the characteristics of emptiness that were mentioned above, the tathāgata’s wisdom sees all dharmas on the conventional level without obstruction.

original: thogs med par gzigs par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thogs med par gzigs par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase “penetrates all dharmas without obstruction.”

original: mtshan nyid de dag la zhugs pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan nyid thams cad kyi chags pa las 'das pa 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te zhes bya ba
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dag la zhugs pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan nyid thams cad kyi chags pa las 'das pa 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te zhes bya ba
translated: The phrase “having entered into those characteristics, the tathāgata, arhat, perfectly enlightened buddha has realized this perfection of wisdom that transcends all characteristics” means that

original: ni don dam par chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du thugs su chud pa de la brten nas /
analyzed: ni don dam par chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du thugs su chud pa de la brten nas /
translated: , on the basis of his comprehension of the fact that all dharmas are characterized by emptiness on the ultimate level,

original: kun rdzob tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan nyid thams cad la ma chags pa 'di thugs su chud pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan nyid thams cad la ma chags pa 'di thugs su chud pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching: “It is wonderful that you have realized the perfection of wisdom, which is the non-attachment to all characteristics on the conventional level.”

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bstan nas /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bstan nas /
translated: And after fully awakening to perfect buddhahood, you have taught the perfection of wisdom.

original: mtshan nyid rnams rab tu bstan pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid zab mo mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams rab tu bstan pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid zab mo mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The teaching of the characteristics is the Thus-Gone One’s full awakening to the profound characteristics.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo mtshan nyid thams cad kyi chags pa las 'das pa thugs su chud nas kyang /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo mtshan nyid thams cad kyi chags pa las 'das pa thugs su chud nas kyang /
translated: Thus, having realized the profound perfection of wisdom, which transcends attachment to all characteristics,

original: de'i don stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid sems can rnams la rab tu bstan pa ni mtshan nyid zab mo thugs su chud pas @105b bstan pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i don stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid sems can rnams la rab tu bstan pa ni mtshan nyid zab mo thugs su chud pas @105b bstan pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: you have taught its meaning, the characteristic of emptiness, to sentient beings. This teaching of the profound characteristics through realization is wonderful.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul du 'gyur te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul du 'gyur te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Blessed One, in that way, the profound perfection of wisdom is the domain of the Tathagatas, the Foe Destroyers, the Completely Perfect Buddhas.

original: mtshan nyid thams cad rab tu dbye ba mdzad de zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid thams cad rab tu dbye ba mdzad de zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: ...having made a complete differentiation of all the characteristics.🔽...

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo de bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs su chud de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo de bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs su chud de /
translated: The Blessed One has understood the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: spyod yul du gyur cing de la spyad pas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang kun rdzob tu chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid so sor phye ste bstan pa ni /
analyzed: spyod yul du gyur cing de la spyad pas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang kun rdzob tu chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid so sor phye ste bstan pa ni /
translated: Having practiced in that domain, having become a Completely Perfect Buddha in unsurpassed enlightenment, he has also taught the differentiation of the characteristics of all phenomena conventionally.

original: thabs dang shes rab mchog dang ldan te ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab mchog dang ldan te ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ...having the supreme method and wisdom. The meaning is that it is amazing.🔽...the characteristic of form...

original: 'di ltar gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Thus, the characteristic of form and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba mdzad pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos gang dang gang gi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba mdzad pa'i chos rnams kyi ming tsam bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba mdzad pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos gang dang gang gi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba mdzad pa'i chos rnams kyi ming tsam bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage up to “the characteristic of omniscience is amazing” teaches the mere names of the phenomena whose characteristics are to be distinguished.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa ma spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa ma spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said to the sons of gods who live in the desire realm and the form realm:

original: lha'i bu dag gzugs ni gzhig tu rung ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag gzugs ni gzhig tu rung ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: “Sons of gods, form has the characteristic of being destroyed.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The Tathāgata fully and perfectly realized that to be without characteristic.”

original: kun rdzob tu chos rnams so so'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa bstan nas /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu chos rnams so so'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the individual characteristics of phenomena conventionally,

original: don dam par de dag mtshan nyid med par thugs su chud pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par de dag mtshan nyid med par thugs su chud pa bstan pa ste /
translated: he taught that ultimately they are realized to be without characteristic.

original: de la gzugs ni gzhig tu rung ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la gzugs ni gzhig tu rung ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Form has the characteristic of being breakable.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa la gzugs gzhan gyis gzugs gzhig tu rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa la gzugs gzhan gyis gzugs gzhig tu rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which has resistance can be broken by another form.🔽The Tathāgata has fully awakened to the absence of characteristic in that.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gzhig tu rung ba yin yang don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med par de bzhin gshegs pas🔽thugs su chud do do zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i don 'di tshor ba la @106a * //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gzhig tu rung ba yin yang don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med par de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud do do zhes bya ba'i don to // mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i don 'di tshor ba la @106a * //
translated: This means that although the characteristic of form is to be broken in the conventional sense, the Tathāgata has realized that ultimately it is without characteristic because it is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: sogs pa 'og ma thams cad la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa 'og ma thams cad la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of “fully awakening to the absence of characteristic” should be applied in the same way to all the remaining topics, such as feeling.

original: tshor ba ni myong ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa rnam pa gsum myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba ni myong ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa rnam pa gsum myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Feeling has the characteristic of experience. It has the characteristic of the experience of the three kinds of feelings: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant.

original: 'du shes ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan ma la sogs par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan ma la sogs par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Perception has the characteristic of grasping. It has the characteristic of grasping names and signs.

original: 'du byed ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'i las rnams dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'i las rnams dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Disposition has the characteristic of disposition. It has the characteristic of the disposition of virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral actions.

original: rnam par shes pa ni so so'i bye brag shes pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni yul drug so so'i bye brag 'gyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni so so'i bye brag shes pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni yul drug so so'i bye brag 'gyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness has the characteristic of individual cognition. It has the characteristic of the individual cognition of the six objects.

original: phung po rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni na ba dang rga ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni na ba dang rga ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The aggregates have the characteristic of suffering. They have the characteristic of the suffering of illness, aging, and so forth.

original: khams rnams ni sdug pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni yul drug dang / dbang po drug dang / rnam par shes pa drug 'dus pa las /
analyzed: khams rnams ni sdug pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni yul drug dang / dbang po drug dang / rnam par shes pa drug 'dus pa las /
translated: the six objects, the six sense faculties, and the six consciousnesses

original: reg pa dang tshor ba 'byung ba 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa dang tshor ba 'byung ba 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are the cause of samsara, since contact and feeling arise from their union.🔽The sense bases have the characteristic of being the doors of arising,

original: skye mched rnams ni 'byung ba'i sgo'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni skye mched bcu gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa drug 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched rnams ni 'byung ba'i sgo'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni skye mched bcu gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa drug 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the six consciousnesses arise in dependence on the twelve sense bases.🔽Dependent origination has the characteristic of being a combination,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'du 'phrod kyi mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'dus shing tshogs pa las 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'du 'phrod kyi mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'dus shing tshogs pa las 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect is produced from the combination and aggregation of causes and conditions.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni yongs su gtong pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni yongs su gtong pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The perfection of generosity has the characteristic of complete giving,

original: chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pa rnams chos dang zang zing 'dod pa rnams la yongs su gtong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pa rnams chos dang zang zing 'dod pa rnams la yongs su gtong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one completely gives away the generosity of Dharma and material things to those who desire Dharma and material things.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gdung ba med pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa spangs te /🔽tshul khrims dang ldan na bdag nyid kyang tshe 'di dang phyi ma gnyis ka la /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gdung ba med pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa spangs te / tshul khrims dang ldan na bdag nyid kyang tshe 'di dang phyi ma gnyis ka la /
translated: The perfection of morality has the defining characteristic of being without torment, because one who has morality, having abandoned killing and so on,🔽has no torment or mental unease in this life or the next,

original: lus dang sems gdung zhing mi bde ba med pa dang / sems can pha rol la yang gnod pa dang gdung ba med pa'i phyir ro //🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'khrugs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus dang sems gdung zhing mi bde ba med pa dang / sems can pha rol la yang gnod pa dang gdung ba med pa'i phyir ro // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'khrugs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and because there is no harm or torment for other sentient beings.

original: bzod pa dang ldan na bdag dang pha rol gnyis ka'i sems 'khrugs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan na bdag dang pha rol gnyis ka'i sems 'khrugs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of patience has the defining characteristic of being without disturbance, because one who has patience has no disturbance in the minds of self and other.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol @106b tu phyin pa ni thub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi go bgos nas /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol @106b tu phyin pa ni thub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi go bgos nas /
translated: The perfection of effort has the defining characteristic of being invincible, because one who has effort, having donned the armor of effort,

original: bdud dang bar du gcod pa rnams kyis zil gyis mi non cing mi thub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud dang bar du gcod pa rnams kyis zil gyis mi non cing mi thub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: cannot be overcome or defeated by demons and obstacles.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yang dag par sdud pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa'i don rtogs shing sdud pa dang / bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas sems can rnams yid ches shing 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yang dag par sdud pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa'i don rtogs shing sdud pa dang / bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas sems can rnams yid ches shing 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of meditative concentration has the characteristic of correct collection, because when the mind is in equipoise, one realizes the correct meaning and collects, and because sentient beings are convinced and collected by the results of meditative concentration, such as supernatural powers.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs na /
translated: The perfection of wisdom has the characteristic of nonattachment, because when one realizes that all phenomena are unreal through wisdom,

original: dngos po gang la yang chags par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gang la yang chags par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: one does not become attached to any thing.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dag ni mi 'khrugs pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag sems mnyam par gzhag cing phra ba'i phyir 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dag ni mi 'khrugs pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag sems mnyam par gzhag cing phra ba'i phyir 'dod pa dang /
translated: These meditative concentrations, immeasurables, and formless states of spiritual attainment are called imperturbable because the mind is in a state of composure and because they are subtle.

original: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas sems mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas sems mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not disturbed by the desire for sense objects, by discursive thought, etc.🔽The thirty-seven spiritual states conducive to enlightenment are characterized by the emergence from cyclic existence.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang /
translated: The four close mindfulnesses, the four thorough abandonings, the four bases of magical powers, the five faculties,

original: stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams ni 'khor ba nas 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams ni 'khor ba nas 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path are called the states conducive to enlightenment because they cause one to emerge from cyclic existence.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid ni dben pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po thams cad dang bral te dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid ni dben pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po thams cad dang bral te dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emptiness gate of liberation has the characteristic of being void, because it is free from and void of all things that are the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs te zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs te zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The signless gate of liberation has the characteristic of being peace, because it is peace, having abandoned all conceptual thoughts of signs.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa ni sdug bsngal sel ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa ni sdug bsngal sel ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The wishless gate of liberation has the characteristic of eliminating suffering, because
