original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med par rtogs na dngos po gang yang btsal zhing yongs su thob par bya ba'i phyir smon cing 'bad mi dgos pas 'dod pa mi rnyed pa'i sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir @107a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med par rtogs na dngos po gang yang btsal zhing yongs su thob par bya ba'i phyir smon cing 'bad mi dgos pas 'dod pa mi rnyed pa'i sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir @107a * //
translated: when one realizes that all phenomena are emptiness and signless, there is no need to strive and make effort, wishing for and seeking to obtain any thing at all. Therefore, there is no suffering of not finding what one wants.

original: ro ; rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams ni 'grel pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: ro ; rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams ni 'grel pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams bsgom pa ni /
translated: The doors of liberation are the characteristic of liberation, because the cultivation of the eight deliverances

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams las grol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams las grol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: liberates from the afflictions such as attachment.

original: stobs rnams ni shin tu rnam par gdon mi za ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams ni /
analyzed: stobs rnams ni shin tu rnam par gdon mi za ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams ni /
translated: The powers are the characteristic of utter nondeficiency, because the ten powers of the tathāgatas, such as the knowledge of what is possible and impossible,

original: ye shes kyis gtan la bab par brtags na /🔽dge ba spyad pas ni mtho ris su gdon mi za bar 'gro //
analyzed: ye shes kyis gtan la bab par brtags na / dge ba spyad pas ni mtho ris su gdon mi za bar 'gro //
translated: are utterly nondeficient in terms of knowledge.🔽By practicing virtue, one definitely goes to high rebirth.

original: sdig pa spyad pas ni ngan 'gror gdon mi za bar 'gro ba gtan la bab par mkhyen pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa spyad pas ni ngan 'gror gdon mi za bar 'gro ba gtan la bab par mkhyen pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By practicing evil, one definitely goes to bad rebirth.

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams ni shin tu brtan pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par byang chub pa dang / zag pa zad pa dang / bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams bstan pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam rnams bstan pa la bdud dang mu stegs can rnams kyis gzhan du bsgyur mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams ni shin tu brtan pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par byang chub pa dang / zag pa zad pa dang / bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams bstan pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam rnams bstan pa la bdud dang mu stegs can rnams kyis gzhan du bsgyur mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fearlessnesses have the characteristic of being extremely stable, because the demons and non-Buddhists are unable to change the Tathāgata’s teaching of manifest enlightenment, the destruction of the contaminants, the factors that are obstacles, and the noble paths.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams ni yongs su mi chod pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams ni yongs su mi chod pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The correct knowledges have the characteristic of being unhindered, because

original: chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rnams ni /
analyzed: chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rnams ni /
translated: the correct knowledges of phenomena, meaning, etymological interpretation, and eloquence

original: bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis zil gyis mi non cing bar ma chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis zil gyis mi non cing bar ma chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are not overwhelmed by demons and opponents and are not interrupted.

original: byams pa chen po ni phan par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phan pa dang bde ba thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pa chen po ni phan par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phan pa dang bde ba thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great love has the characteristic of accomplishing benefit, because it causes all sentient beings to obtain mundane and supramundane benefit and happiness.

original: snying rje chen po ni skyob pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang mi bde ba sna tshogs las skyob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni skyob pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang mi bde ba sna tshogs las skyob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great compassion has the characteristic of protection, because it protects from various sufferings and misfortunes.

original: dga' ba chen po ni rab tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mos shing rab tu dga' ba dang / sems can pha rol po longs spyod dang 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa mthong na /🔽bdag nyid rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba chen po ni rab tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mos shing rab tu dga' ba dang / sems can pha rol po longs spyod dang 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa mthong na /🔽bdag nyid rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Great joy has the characteristic of delight, because it delights in the Buddha’s teachings and is delighted when one sees other sentient beings endowed with wealth and prosperity.

original: btang snyoms chen po ni ma 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / dgra dang zun la sogs pa la sems mnyam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: btang snyoms chen po ni ma 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / dgra dang zun la sogs pa la sems mnyam par 'gyur te /
translated: The mind becomes even-minded toward pleasure and pain, enemies and friends, and so on,

original: phyogs gcig tu ma zhen cing ma 'dres pa'i @107b phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu ma zhen cing ma 'dres pa'i @107b phyir ro //
translated: because it is not attached to one side and is unadulterated.🔽The eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha have the characteristic of being unassailable.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad ni mi 'phrogs pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba la sogs pa'i yon tan mnga' ba rnams /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad ni mi 'phrogs pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba la sogs pa'i yon tan mnga' ba rnams /
translated: The qualities of the Tathāgata, such as being without error, and so on,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa gzhan la med de /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa gzhan la med de /
translated: do not exist in others, such as the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de dag gis bskyod cing 'phrog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis bskyod cing 'phrog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They cannot be shaken or taken away by them.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects has the characteristic of direct perception.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis kar chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du gsal bar thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis kar chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du gsal bar thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has fully comprehended all phenomena in all their aspects, both in terms of the relative and the ultimate.

original: lha'i bu dag de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
translated: “Divine sons, in this way, the Thus-Gone One has fully awakened to all phenomena as being devoid of characteristics.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni chags pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes can zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par bstan pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni chags pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes can zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni / chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par bstan pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Therefore, he is called the one with unobstructed wisdom.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'jig rten ston pa yin pa'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'jig rten ston pa yin pa'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage concludes the explanation of how this profound perfection of wisdom teaches the world by demonstrating that all phenomena are devoid of characteristics.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob tu chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyang de ltar mkhyen la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob tu chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyang de ltar mkhyen la /
translated: The Thus-Gone One knows the characteristics of all phenomena in terms of the relative.

original: don dam par chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par yang thugs su chud de mkhyen pa la thags thogs med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par yang thugs su chud de mkhyen pa la thags thogs med pa'i phyir /
translated: He also comprehends that ultimately all phenomena are devoid of characteristics, for his knowledge is unobstructed.

original: chags pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chags pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes can zhes bya ste /
translated: He is called the one with non-attached wisdom.

original: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten pas mkhyen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten pas mkhyen pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because he knows this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: this profound perfection of wisdom is the teacher of the world.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin pa la de bzhin gshegs pa bsten cing spyod pa dang /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin pa la de bzhin gshegs pa bsten cing spyod pa dang /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti and so on teaches that this profound perfection of wisdom is the producer of the Tathāgata and the teacher of the world, and that the Tathāgata is grateful and appreciative, relying on and practicing this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: mchod cing rim gro mdzad pa byas pa drin du gzo zhing drin lan ldon pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mchod cing rim gro mdzad pa byas pa drin du gzo zhing drin lan ldon pa bstan pa ste /
translated: making offerings and honoring it.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is the producer of the Tathāgata.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten cing goms par byas pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs shing de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten cing goms par byas pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs shing de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom is the mother of the Tathagatas, because the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the Tathagatas, because the perfection of wisdom is the instructress of the Tathagatas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol @108a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol @108a * //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the producer of the great beings,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the illuminator of the great vehicle,

original: tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten 'di ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten cing goms par byas pa'i mthus /
analyzed: tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten 'di ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten cing goms par byas pa'i mthus /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the perfection of giving,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the perfection of morality,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the perfection of patience,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the perfection of vigour,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the perfection of concentration,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the perfection of wisdom,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the thirty-seven wings of enlightenment,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the three doors to deliverance,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the four perfect efforts,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the four bases of psychic power,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the five faculties,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the five powers,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the seven members of enlightenment,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the holy eightfold path,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the three concentrations,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the four infinite states,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can rnams la 'jig rten 'di dag kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul du phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can rnams la 'jig rten 'di dag kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul du phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the four formless attainments,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the four formless attainments,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the five eyes,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the six superknowledges,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the four analytical knowledges,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the four unhinderednesses,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the eighteen special dharmas of a Buddha,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the knowledge of all modes,

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'di lta ste /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the knowledge of the paths,🔽the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix of the knowledge of the awareness of all things

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di la brten cing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di la brten cing rnam par spyod do //
translated: They rely on and practice this perfection of wisdom.🔽They honor and worship those dharmas.

original: chos de dag la rim gror mdzad cing mchod pa mdzad do zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin pas byas pa drin du gzo zhing drin la lan glon pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos de dag la rim gror mdzad cing mchod pa mdzad do zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin pas byas pa drin du gzo zhing drin la lan glon pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because this perfection of wisdom gives birth to the Tathagatas and shows the world the path, in order to repay its kindness and requite its benefits,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te /
translated: the Tathagatas rely on just this perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di nyid kyi tshul spyod cing 'di nyid la mchod pa dang rim gro mdzad do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi tshul spyod cing 'di nyid la mchod pa dang rim gro mdzad do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They practice just this method and honor and worship just this.🔽This shows that the Tathagatas honor and worship just this perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin gshegs pa rim gro mdzad pa dang / bkur sti mdzad pa dang / phu dud mdzad pa dang / mchod pa mdzad pa de ni chos dang ldan pa ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la drin du gzo zhing mchod pa dang bkur sti mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin gshegs pa rim gro mdzad pa dang / bkur sti mdzad pa dang / phu dud mdzad pa dang / mchod pa mdzad pa de ni chos dang ldan pa ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la drin du gzo zhing mchod pa dang bkur sti mdzad pa ni /
translated: The Tathagata's honoring, respecting, revering, and worshipping the perfection of wisdom is in accordance with the Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos dang mi 'gal te skyes bu dam pa'i chos dang ldan zhing rigs pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos dang mi 'gal te skyes bu dam pa'i chos dang ldan zhing rigs pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning: the Tathagata's repayment of the favor and worship of the perfection of wisdom is not contrary to the true Dharma. It is in accordance with the true Dharma, and is reasonable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: rab 'byor sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ba ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ba ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subhuti, the Buddha Bhagavans have come forth from this perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mchod cing rim gro bya bar rigs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mchod cing rim gro bya bar rigs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reason why it is reasonable to worship and honor the perfection of wisdom.

original: dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang /
translated: The tathāgatas of the three times

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad cing goms par byas pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad cing goms par byas pa las /
translated: have practiced and become familiar with this perfection of wisdom.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir mchod pa dang rim gro bya bar rigs so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir mchod pa dang rim gro bya bar rigs so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because of that, it is fitting to make offerings and to honor them, since they have fully awakened to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni byas pa mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni byas pa mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, the tathāgatas, arhats, and perfectly awakened buddhas know what has been done.🔽The tathāgatas, arhats, and perfectly awakened buddhas are aware of what has been done.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa @108b dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni byas pa dgongs pa la bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung la de bzhin gshegs
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa @108b dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni byas pa dgongs pa la bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung la de bzhin gshegs
translated: This shows that in that way the tathāgatas of the three times arise from this perfection of wisdom, and the tathāgatas

original: pa rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la drin du gzo zhing /
analyzed: pa rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la drin du gzo zhing /
translated: are grateful to the perfection of wisdom.

original: mchod pa dang bkur sti mdzad pa ni byas pa mkhyen pa dang / byas pa dgongs pa yin zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa dang bkur sti mdzad pa ni byas pa mkhyen pa dang / byas pa dgongs pa yin zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The worship and reverence shown to them is taught as being the knowledge of what has been done and the consideration of what has been done.

original: rab 'byor gang la la zhig yang dag par smra bas byas pa shes shing byas pa drin no zhes smra na /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang la la zhig yang dag par smra bas byas pa shes shing byas pa drin no zhes smra na /
translated: Subhūti, if someone were to say correctly that there are those who know what has been done and are grateful for what has been done,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byas pa mkhyen cing byas pa dgongs pa'o zhes yang dag par smra bas yang dag par smra'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byas pa mkhyen cing byas pa dgongs pa'o zhes yang dag par smra bas yang dag par smra'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: it is correct to say that the Tathāgatas know what has been done and consider what has been done.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las byas pa drin du gzo zhing byas pa mi bsnyel pa 'jig rten na gzhan su yang med pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las byas pa drin du gzo zhing byas pa mi bsnyel pa 'jig rten na gzhan su yang med pas /
translated: There is no one else in the world who is grateful to the Tathāgatas for what has been done and who does not forget what has been done.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la byas pa mkhyen cing byas pa dgongs pa'o zhes gang su zhig smra ba yod na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la byas pa mkhyen cing byas pa dgongs pa'o zhes gang su zhig smra ba yod na /
translated: Therefore, if someone were to say that the Tathāgatas know what has been done and consider what has been done,

original: de ni yang dag par smra ba ste /
analyzed: de ni yang dag par smra ba ste /
translated: that would be correct speech.

original: bden par smra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bden par smra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It would be true speech.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa byas pa mkhyen cing byas pa dgongs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa byas pa mkhyen cing byas pa dgongs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, how is it that the Tathāgatas know what has been done and consider what has been done?

original: rab 'byor de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas theg pa gang gis byon pa dang / lam gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa'i theg pa de nyid dang lam de nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa rim gro mdzad pa dang /🔽bkur sti mdzad pa dang / phu dud mdzad pa dang / mchod pa mdzad pa dang / yongs su bsrung ba mdzad pa'i phyir te zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas theg pa gang gis byon pa dang / lam gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa'i theg pa de nyid dang lam de nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa rim gro mdzad pa dang / bkur sti mdzad pa dang / phu dud mdzad pa dang / mchod pa mdzad pa dang / yongs su bsrung ba mdzad pa'i phyir te zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One honors,🔽venerates, respects, makes offerings to, and protects that very vehicle and that very path by which he came and by which he fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byas pa drin du gzo zhing drin du dgongs pa'i gtan tshigs zhib tu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byas pa drin du gzo zhing drin du dgongs pa'i gtan tshigs zhib tu bstan pa ste /
translated: This is stated in detail to show the reason why the Tathāgata is grateful and appreciative.

original: thabs gang gis byon pa dang / lam gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: thabs gang gis byon pa dang / lam gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten nas /
translated: The question by what means did they come? and by what path did they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood? refers to the fact that the Thus-Gone Ones attained buddhahood and fully awakened to unsurpassed enlightenment in dependence on this very perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang brnyes pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de nyid la theg pa dang lam zhes bya ste /🔽de la mchod cing rim gro la @109a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang brnyes pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de nyid la theg pa dang lam zhes bya ste / de la mchod cing rim gro la @109a * //
translated: That perfection of wisdom is called the vehicle and the path by which they attained buddhahood and fully awakened to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: sogs pa mdzad pa'i phyir byas pa mkhyen pa dang byas pa dgongs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa mdzad pa'i phyir byas pa mkhyen pa dang byas pa dgongs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because they made offerings, served, and so forth to that [perfection of wisdom], it is said that [the Buddha] knows what has been done and appreciates what has been done.

original: rab 'byor de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byas pa mkhyen pa dang byas pa dgongs par blta'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par gyur pa'i rgyu de la mchod cing rim gro la sogs pa mdzad pa de nyid la byas
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byas pa mkhyen pa dang byas pa dgongs par blta'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par gyur pa'i rgyu de la mchod cing rim gro la sogs pa mdzad pa de nyid la byas
translated: This, Subhūti, is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of deeds and the consideration of deeds.

original: pa drin du gzo zhing drin la lon ldon pa yin par blta'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa drin du gzo zhing drin la lon ldon pa yin par blta'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that the Tathāgata is grateful and appreciative of the cause by which he attained unsurpassed enlightenment, and that he makes offerings and honors that very cause.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa la brten te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa la brten te /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the Tathāgata, based on the signlessness of all phenomena,🔽has fully awakened to all phenomena as uncreated, because there is no creator.

original: byed pa po med pa'i phyir chos thams cad ma byas par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad mtshan ma med cing mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i byed pa po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i phyir chos thams cad ma byas par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad mtshan ma med cing mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i byed pa po med pa'i phyir /
translated: This means that ultimately all phenomena are signless, and because there is no creator imputed by tīrthikas,

original: chos thams cad sus kyang ma byas par thugs su chud pa de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten pas thugs su chud do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad sus kyang ma byas par thugs su chud pa de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten pas thugs su chud do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the passage is that he has realized that no one has made any dharma, and that he has realized this in dependence on this perfection of wisdom.

original: lus med pa'i phyir ma byas par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas bstan pa 'di las grags pa'i rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis ma byas par thugs su chud do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lus med pa'i phyir ma byas par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas bstan pa 'di las grags pa'i rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis ma byas par thugs su chud do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: “He has fully awakened to the non-making of all dharmas” means that he has realized that the causes and conditions that are renowned in this teaching have not made any dharmas, because ultimately all dharmas are unreal.

original: rab 'byor de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te /
translated: Subhūti, in that way the Tathāgata, in dependence on the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos thams cad bya ba med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad bya ba med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de ni /
translated: has fully awakened to the non-making of all dharmas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byas pa mkhyen pa dang byas pa dgongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byas pa mkhyen pa dang byas pa dgongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That, Subhūti, is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of deeds and recollection of deeds.”

original: de ltar chos thams cad byed pa po med pa dang / bya ba med par thugs su chud pa de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te thugs su chud la /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad byed pa po med pa dang / bya ba med par thugs su chud pa de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te thugs su chud la /
translated: Thus, the understanding that all phenomena are without an agent and without action is based on this perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar thugs su chud pa nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nan tan gyis mchod pa byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar thugs su chud pa nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nan tan gyis mchod pa byas pa yin te /
translated: And the very understanding of that is the worship of the perfection of wisdom through practice.

original: drin du gzo zhing drin la lan ldon pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: drin du gzo zhing drin la lan ldon pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is the repayment of the favor, the requital of the favor.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, based on the perfection of wisdom,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes byas pa med pa chos thams cad la 'jug pa med pa'i brdas 'jug ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes byas pa med pa chos thams cad la 'jug pa med pa'i brdas 'jug ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One’s wisdom, which is not made, enters the non-engagement of all phenomena through the symbol of non-engagement.

original: de ltar byed pa po med pa'i phyir chos thams cad @109b sus kyang ma byas par mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang sus kyang ma byas te /
analyzed: de ltar byed pa po med pa'i phyir chos thams cad @109b sus kyang ma byas par mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang sus kyang ma byas te /
translated: Thus, because there is no agent, that wisdom which knows that all phenomena are not made by anyone is also not made by anyone.

original: chos thams cad byed pa po med par mkhyen pa 'jug pa yang don dam par ni 'jug pa med kyi /
analyzed: chos thams cad byed pa po med par mkhyen pa 'jug pa yang don dam par ni 'jug pa med kyi /
translated: The knowledge that all dharmas are without an agent is the engagement.

original: kun rdzob kyi brda tsam du 'jug go zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi brda tsam du 'jug go zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is taught that ultimately there is no engagement, but that engagement is merely the conventional symbol of the relative.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: By this method, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is the producer of the Tathagatas, and the demonstrator of this world.

original: 'jig rten 'di ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul du thugs su chud de /🔽de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad bstan pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul du thugs su chud de / de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad bstan pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus the Tathagata has understood all dharmas in the manner of the relative and the ultimate.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa dang 'jig rten 'di ston pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa dang 'jig rten 'di ston pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And the Tathagata, having become a Tathagata, demonstrates all worldly dharmas in dependence on this perfection of wisdom. Therefore it is taught that this perfection of wisdom is the producer of the Tathagatas, and the demonstrator of this world.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhuti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar chos thams cad la shes pa po ma mchis shing mthong ba po ma mchis na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar chos thams cad la shes pa po ma mchis shing mthong ba po ma mchis na /
translated: All dharmas are indeed without a knower and without a seer.

original: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten 'di ston pa lags zhes bya ba ni gong du chos thams cad la byed pa po med par bshad pa'i don rab 'byor gyis rtogs nas /
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten 'di ston pa lags zhes bya ba ni gong du chos thams cad la byed pa po med par bshad pa'i don rab 'byor gyis rtogs nas /
translated: Subhuti: If, O Lord, all dharmas are without a knower and without a seer, how then can the perfection of wisdom produce the Tathagata and demonstrate this world with its gods, men, and Asuras?

original: de ltar byed pa po med na shes pa po dang mthong ba po yang med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston par mdzad pa'i mi rigs so zhes gal bzung ste gsol pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa po med na shes pa po dang mthong ba po yang med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston par mdzad pa'i mi rigs so zhes gal bzung ste gsol pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: Here Subhuti has understood the meaning of the above explanation that all dharmas are without an agent, and he says: If there is no agent, then there is also no knower and no seer. It is not possible that the perfection of wisdom should produce the Tathagata and demonstrate this world.

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

original: chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All dharmas are indeed without a knower and without a seer.🔽And why? Because the perfection of wisdom is not produced, nor is the world with its gods, men, and Asuras produced.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa'i don de nyid bden no zhes bka' stsal pa ste /🔽don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po med pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa'i don de nyid bden no zhes bka' stsal pa ste / don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po med pas /
translated: The Lord said, Excellent, Subhuti, excellent that you have thus understood the meaning of what I have said.

original: shes pa po dang mthong ba po med pa ni bden na /🔽don dam lta bu shes na 'jig rten na gzhan su yang med de /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te chos thams cad la shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med par rtogs pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa po dang mthong ba po med pa ni bden na / don dam lta bu shes na 'jig rten na gzhan su yang med de / de bzhin gshegs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te chos thams cad la shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med par rtogs pas de'i phyir /
translated: Subhuti, it is just as you have said: In the ultimate sense, all dharmas are empty, signless, wishless, without production, without stopping, without defilement, without purification, not existent, not nonexistent, not coming, not going, not permanent, not interrupted, not the same, not different, and not between any of these.🔽Subhuti, it is just as you have said: In the ultimate sense, all dharmas are empty, signless, wishless, without production, without stopping, without defilement, without purification, not existent, not nonexistent, not coming, not going, not permanent, not interrupted, not the same, not different, and not between any of these.🔽Subhuti, it is just as you have said: In the ultimate sense, all dharmas are empty, signless, wishless, without production, without stopping, without defilement, without purification, not existent, not nonexistent, not coming, not going, not permanent, not interrupted, not the same, not different, and not between any of these.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten 'di'i phyin @110a * //🔽ci ma log par ston pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten 'di'i phyin @110a * // ci ma log par ston pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Subhuti, it is just as you have said: In the ultimate sense, all dharmas are empty, signless, wishless, without production, without stopping, without defilement, without purification, not existent, not nonexistent, not coming, not going, not permanent, not interrupted, not the same, not different, and not between any of these.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni stong pa gsog gsob dbang med pa snying po med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni stong pa gsog gsob dbang med pa snying po med pa ste /
translated: Subhuti, it is just as you have said: In the ultimate sense, all dharmas are empty, signless, wishless, without production, without stopping, without defilement, without purification, not existent, not nonexistent, not coming, not going, not permanent, not interrupted, not the same, not different, and not between any of these.🔽Subhuti, it is just as you have said: In the ultimate sense, all dharmas are empty, signless, wishless, without production, without stopping, without defilement, without purification, not existent, not nonexistent, not coming, not going, not permanent, not interrupted, not the same, not different, and not between any of these.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes pa po med pa dang / mthong ba po med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes pa po med pa dang / mthong ba po med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the reasonings of “without a knower” and “without a seer.”

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: In the ultimate sense, all phenomena are empty of inherent nature.

original: dngos po med pas shes par bya ba dang / mthong bar bya ba yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med pas shes par bya ba dang / mthong bar bya ba yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since they are not things, there is also no knowing and no seeing.

original: shes pa po dang mthong ba po med do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa po dang mthong ba po med do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: It is taught that there is no knower and no seer.

original: gsog dang gsob dang dbang med pa dang snying po med pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor gzhan yang chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa ste /
analyzed: gsog dang gsob dang dbang med pa dang snying po med pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i rnam grangs su rig par bya'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa ste /
translated: “Deceptive, hollow, powerless, and insubstantial” should be known as synonyms for “not a thing.”🔽Subhūti, moreover, all phenomena are without a knower and without a seer.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na chos thams cad shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na chos thams cad shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, how are all phenomena without a knower and without a seer?

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mi gnas shing khongs su chud pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mi gnas shing khongs su chud pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are not located and are not included.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na chos thams cad shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa ste zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na chos thams cad shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa ste zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Subhūti, by this one of many explanations, all phenomena are without a knower and without a seer.

original: shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'i gtan tshigs rnam pa gzhan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'i gtan tshigs rnam pa gzhan bstan pa ste /
translated: This explains another reason why there is no knower and no seer.

original: don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas ci la yang mi gnas shing khams gsum gang gi nang du gtogs pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas ci la yang mi gnas shing khams gsum gang gi nang du gtogs pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Ultimately, since all phenomena are unreal, they are not located anywhere and are not included in any of the three realms.

original: shes pa po dang mthong ba po med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa po dang mthong ba po med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that there is no knower and no seer.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad mi gnas shing gang du yang ma gtogs pa'i phyir shes pa po med pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad mi gnas shing gang du yang ma gtogs pa'i phyir shes pa po med pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, the perfection of wisdom gives birth to the tathāgatas and shows the world.

original: mthong ba po med par de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud de /
analyzed: mthong ba po med par de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud de /
translated: The Tathāgata has realized that there is no seer,

original: de bzhin gshegs par gyur nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs par gyur nas /
translated: and having become a Tathāgata,

original: 'jig rten bstan pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten pa las gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten bstan pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten pa las gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: he has also taught the world in dependence on this perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: Therefore, this perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //🔽de yang gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir stong pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o // de yang gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir stong pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: is the one that gives birth to the Tathāgatas and teaches the world.🔽Moreover, it is taught that this is the teaching of the suchness of the world,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'jig rten na yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du ston @110b pa bshad pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'jig rten na yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du ston @110b pa bshad pa ste /
translated: as it is, in the world, by means of “emptiness because of the non-existence of the seeing of form,” and so on.

original: gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The non-existence of the seeing of form is the teaching🔽of this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyad cing bsgoms nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyad cing bsgoms nas /
translated: Having practiced and meditated on this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing dngos por mthong ba med par gyur pa nyid /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing dngos por mthong ba med par gyur pa nyid /
translated: He does not apprehend imagined form as a sign, and he does not see it as a thing.

original: gzugs kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: Form is also taught as it really is.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be understood up to feeling, etc., up to the knowledge of all modes.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom has given birth to the Tathagata.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas /
translated: In dependence on the perfection of wisdom,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
translated: the Tathagata does not apprehend the signs of all dharmas,

original: chos rnams kyi yang dag pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud nas /🔽de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi yang dag pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud nas / de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: and having understood the reality of dharmas just as it is,🔽he has become a Tathagata.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this perfection of wisdom is the one that has given birth to the Tathagata.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na gzugs mthong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston pa lags zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na gzugs mthong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston pa lags zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti asks, “Blessed One, how is it that you teach that form is not seen?”

original: ji ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mthong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston pa lags zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mthong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston pa lags zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: and so on up to “how is it that you teach that the knowledge of all aspects is not seen?”

original: chos thams cad mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'i don gong du bshad pa de nyid zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'i don gong du bshad pa de nyid zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: This is Subhūti’s question in order to elaborate in detail the meaning of the teaching that was explained above, namely, that all phenomena are not seen.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor nam gzugs la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor nam gzugs la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, when consciousness that takes form as its object does not occur,

original: gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: form is not seen, and therefore it is taught.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
translated: and so on up to “when consciousness that takes the knowledge of all aspects as its object does not occur,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Because of the nonseeing of omniscience, it is the teacher.🔽

original: chos rnams mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'i don rab 'byor gyis zhib tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'i don rab 'byor gyis zhib tu bshad pa ste /
translated: “Because of not seeing the knowledge of all aspects, it is the teacher” explains the meaning of the teacher in terms of not seeing phenomena.

original: de la nam gzugs la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: de la nam gzugs la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
translated: When consciousness does not arise in relation to form,

original: gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “because of not seeing form, it is the teacher”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod cing bsgoms pa'i mthus phyin ci log tu mthong zhing @111a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod cing bsgoms pa'i mthus phyin ci log tu mthong zhing @111a * //
translated: means that through the power of practicing and cultivating this perfection of wisdom, mistaken seeing and knowing are abandoned.

original: shes pa spangs te kun brtags pa'i gzugs la phyin ci log tu dmigs shing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: shes pa spangs te kun brtags pa'i gzugs la phyin ci log tu dmigs shing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the consciousness that observes imputed form and apprehends it as having signs and as mistaken does not arise,

original: yang dag pa'i don mthong zhing rtogs pas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don mthong zhing rtogs pas /
translated: at that time, because of seeing and realizing the correct meaning,

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid phyin ci ma log par ston nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid phyin ci ma log par ston nus pa'i phyir /
translated: it is able to teach the suchness of form without error.

original: gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because form is not seen, it is called the teacher.

original: dper na rab rib can gyis skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa mthong nas /
analyzed: dper na rab rib can gyis skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa mthong nas /
translated: For example, someone with eye disease sees such things as floating hairs,

original: de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba de /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba de /
translated: and consciousness that observes that arises.

original: phyis rab rib byang nas 'khrul pa rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba bzhin du zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyis rab rib byang nas 'khrul pa rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba bzhin du zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Later, when the eye disease is cured, the mistaken consciousness does not arise.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, this should be applied to all aspects up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, this profound perfection of wisdom gives birth to the tathāgatas and shows the world.

original: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten nas /
analyzed: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten nas /
translated: In that way, as explained above, the tathāgatas, in dependence on this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa'i phyir /
translated: unerringly comprehend all phenomena.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This profound perfection of wisdom is what gives birth to the Tathagata and shows the world.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, in what way does the perfection of wisdom give birth to the Tathagata and show the world?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mdor ston pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mdor ston pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin par bshad pa ste /
translated: This is explained as showing the world by giving birth to the Tathagata because in this perfection of wisdom all dharmas are summarized as emptiness.

original: rab 'byor 'di la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten du ston pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten du ston pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Subhuti, here the perfection of wisdom is said to show the world.

original: 'jig rten du ci ston pa zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'jig rten du ci ston pa zhes brjod ce na /
translated: What does it show in the world?

original: gzugs stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It is said to show the world that form is empty, and so on up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong ngo zhes bya bar 'jig rten du brjod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: up to “the knowledge of all aspects is empty” is proclaimed in the world.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad don dam par stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du brjod cing ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad don dam par stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du brjod cing ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: This explains that all phenomena, from form up to the knowledge of all aspects, are proclaimed and taught to be empty by nature ultimately.

original: rab 'byor @111b de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor @111b de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subhūti, in this way the perfection of wisdom gives birth to the Tathāgata and shows the world.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las chos thams cad stong pa nyid du brjod cing bstan pa'i don bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs su chud pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las chos thams cad stong pa nyid du brjod cing bstan pa'i don bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs su chud pa las /
translated: The Blessed One has realized the meaning of the statement and teaching that all phenomena are empty in this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he has become the Tathāgata,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom gives birth to the Tathāgata and shows the world.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar ston /
translated: teaches the Tathāgata that the world is empty.

original: 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar brjod /
analyzed: 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar brjod /
translated: It is called the world is empty.

original: 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar shes par byed de /
analyzed: 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar shes par byed de /
translated: It is known as the world is empty.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom gives birth to the Tathāgata and teaches the world.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin par 'chad cing bstan pa las de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin par 'chad cing bstan pa las de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all worldly phenomena are explained and taught in this perfection of wisdom to have the nature of emptiness, and because of becoming a Tathāgata,🔽this perfection of wisdom gives birth to the Tathāgata and teaches the world.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar ston te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar ston te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom teaches the Tathagata that the world is empty.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las chos thams cad don dam par stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du zhib tu 'chad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las chos thams cad don dam par stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du zhib tu 'chad pa'i phyir /
translated: This passage shows that the perfection of wisdom teaches in detail that all phenomena are ultimately empty by nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: It shows that the perfection of wisdom gives birth to the Tathagata and teaches the world.

original: 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar ji ltar ston ce na /
analyzed: 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar ji ltar ston ce na /
translated: How does it teach that the world is empty?

analyzed: 'jig rten na gzugs stong zhes bya bar ston to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It teaches that form in the world is empty, and so on up to

analyzed: 'jig rten na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong zhes bya bar ston to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: it teaches that the knowledge of all aspects in the world is empty.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du zhib tu bstan te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du zhib tu bstan te /
translated: This passage teaches in detail that phenomena from form up to the knowledge of all aspects are ultimately empty by nature.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs su chud par byas pa las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs su chud par byas pa las /
translated: The Bhagavat has understood it,

original: de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin no @112a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin no @112a * //
translated: and because of that he has become a Tathagata. Therefore, this perfection of wisdom gives birth to the Tathagata and shows the world.

original: zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: teaches the Tathagata that the world is inconceivable,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: up to it teaches that the knowledge of all modes is inconceivable.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med de /
translated: In this deep perfection of wisdom all dharmas are taught to be inconceivable, ultimately unreal,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i spyod yul du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab par ston pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i spyod yul du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab par ston pa'i sgo nas /
translated: because they are not the domain of thought and thought-concomitants.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin par bshad pa ste /
translated: The world is explained as the generator of the Tathagata and the demonstrator of the world.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la 'jig rten zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la 'jig rten zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The world is called the supramundane dharmas, beginning with the perfection of wisdom, and ending with omniscience.

original: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin du gtogs pa'i chos thams cad las dgongs te 'jig rten zhes bshad do //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin du gtogs pa'i chos thams cad las dgongs te 'jig rten zhes bshad do //
translated: The word “world” is explained as referring to all the dharmas included in the imagined nature.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten dben zhes bya bar ston te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten dben zhes bya bar ston te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, this deep perfection of wisdom demonstrates to the Tathagata the world as void.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'jig rten dben zhes bya bar ston to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'jig rten dben zhes bya bar ston to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: It demonstrates the world as void up to the knowledge of all modes.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las chos thams cad don dam par gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las dben zhing stong par bshad pa las /🔽de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las chos thams cad don dam par gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las dben zhing stong par bshad pa las / de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: In this profound perfection of wisdom, all phenomena are explained as empty, ultimately isolated from apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa skyed cing 'jig rten ston pa yin par bshad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this perfection of wisdom is explained as giving rise to the Tathagata and as revealing the world.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten mtha' las 'das pa stong pa zhes bya bar ston te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten mtha' las 'das pa stong pa zhes bya bar ston te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, this perfection of wisdom reveals to the Tathagata the world as empty of the extreme of permanence, and so on up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'jig rten mtha' las 'das pa stong pa'o zhes bya bar ston to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'jig rten mtha' las 'das pa stong pa'o zhes bya bar ston to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: revealing the world as empty of the extreme of permanence in the knowledge of all modes.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi don mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phyir nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: is present as the meaning that is equal to the unequaled of the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don chen po dang / don bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / don dpag tu med pa dang / don gzhal du med pa dang / don mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa mdzad pa yin no zhes gong du mdor smos pa'i don de nyid bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis so sor phye ste zhib tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don chen po dang / don bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / don dpag tu med pa dang / don gzhal du med pa dang / don mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa mdzad pa yin no zhes gong du mdor smos pa'i don de nyid bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis so sor phye ste zhib tu bshad pa ste /
translated: This passage from “This perfection of wisdom is the great meaning, the inconceivable meaning, the immeasurable meaning, the incomparable meaning, and the meaning that is equal to the unequaled” up to “the Bhagavān himself has explained the meaning of the above brief statement by distinguishing it in detail.”

original: so so'i don ni sngar bshad par zad do //
analyzed: so so'i don ni sngar bshad par zad do //
translated: The meaning of each of these has already been explained.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang bsam gyis mi khyab /🔽dpag tu ma mchis /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang bsam gyis mi khyab / dpag tu ma mchis /
translated: Subhūti asks, “Blessed One, is buddhahood, thusness, self-arising, and omniscience inconceivable,🔽incalculable,

original: gzhal du ma mchis shing /
analyzed: gzhal du ma mchis shing /
translated: immeasurable,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa lags sam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa lags sam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and equal to the unequaled?”

original: chos thams cad kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yin par zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yin par zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: This is Subhūti’s question in order to introduce the detailed explanation that all phenomena are inconceivable, incalculable, immeasurable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so,

original: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: it is just as you have said.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang bsam gyis mi @114b khyab /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang bsam gyis mi @114b khyab /
translated: Subhūti, omniscience is also inconceivable,

original: dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa ste /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa ste /
translated: incalculable, and immeasurable.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: up to “equal to the unequalled” is explained.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba dang / rang byung ba zhes bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig bsam gyis mi khyab dpag tu med ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba dang / rang byung ba zhes bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig bsam gyis mi khyab dpag tu med ;
translated: It is not only the so-called Buddha, the so-called Tathāgata, the so-called Self-Existent One, and the so-called Omniscient One that are inconceivable, immeasurable,

original: gzhal du med /
analyzed: gzhal du med /
translated: incalculable,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam par ma zad kyi /
translated: and equal to the unequalled.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas bsam pa dang / dpag pa dang / gzhal ba dang / mnyam pa'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas bsam pa dang / dpag pa dang / gzhal ba dang / mnyam pa'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: All phenomena, from form up to omniscience, are ultimately unreal, and therefore are not objects of thought, imagination, calculation, or comparison.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyang bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyang bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are inconceivable,

original: dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: immeasurable,🔽and equal to the unequalled.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i don mdor bsdus te bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i don mdor bsdus te bstan pa ste /
translated: This is a summary of the meaning explained above.

original: mdor na 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyang don dam par dngos po med pas /
analyzed: mdor na 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyang don dam par dngos po med pas /
translated: In brief, all phenomena, mundane and supramundane, compounded and uncompounded, tainted and untainted, are ultimately unreal.

original: bsam pa dang / dpag pa dang / mnyam du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dang / dpag pa dang / mnyam du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They are not to be thought of or imagined, and they are not equal.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la ni sems mi dmigs so ;
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la ni sems mi dmigs so ;
translated: Subhūti, in the true nature of all phenomena, mind is not observed.

original: / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Mental factors are also not observed.

original: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po med de /
analyzed: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po med de /
translated: In the manner explained above, all phenomena, such as form, are unreal.

original: bsam pa dang dpag pa la sogs pa'i sems kyi spyod yul du mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: bsam pa dang dpag pa la sogs pa'i sems kyi spyod yul du mi 'gyur na /
translated: They are not objects of the mind that thinks and imagines.

original: chos de dag thams cad kyi chos nyid stong pa nyid gang yin pa de bsam zhing dpag pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad kyi chos nyid stong pa nyid gang yin pa de bsam zhing dpag pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur te /
translated: The emptiness that is the true nature of all these phenomena is not an object of thought or imagination.

original: sems dang sems las byung bas dmigs su rung ba zhig yin snyam du kha cig rnam par rtog pa 'byung yang srid de /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung bas dmigs su rung ba zhig yin snyam du kha cig rnam par rtog pa 'byung yang srid de /
translated: Some may think, It is an object that can be observed by the mind and mental factors, and thus have such conceptual thoughts.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi chos nyid ces bya ba yang kun rdzob tu tshig tsam du brjod du zad kyi /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi chos nyid ces bya ba yang kun rdzob tu tshig tsam du brjod du zad kyi /
translated: In order to dispel such thoughts, it is said, The dharmatā of all phenomena is also merely expressed in words on the conventional level.

original: don dam par sems dang sems las byung bas dmigs pa'i yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par sems dang sems las byung bas dmigs pa'i yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Ultimately, it is not an object that can be observed by the mind and mental factors.

original: rab 'byor gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: Subhūti, form is inconceivable,

original: dpag tu med /
analyzed: dpag tu med /
translated: incalculable,

original: gzhal du med pa ste /🔽mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa @115a * //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa ste / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa @115a * //
translated: and immeasurable.

original: yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It is also not observed to be equal to the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: Up to, Subhūti, omniscience is inconceivable,

original: dpag tu med /
analyzed: dpag tu med /
translated: incalculable,
