original: gzhal du med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhal du med pa ste /
translated: and immeasurable.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: It is also not observed to be equal to the unequaled.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad bsam pa dang dpag pa dang gzhal du med pa de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad bsam pa dang dpag pa dang gzhal du med pa de /
translated: All phenomena such as form are inconceivable, immeasurable, and incomparable.🔽They are equal to the unequaled.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o zhes bshad pa la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'ga' zhig yod snyam du rnam par rtog pa 'byung yang srid de /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o zhes bshad pa la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'ga' zhig yod snyam du rnam par rtog pa 'byung yang srid de /
translated: It is possible that the thought occurs that there is some entity called equal to the unequaled.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba yang kun rdzob tu bstan pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par ni de yang mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa'o //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab dpag tu ma mchis gzhal du ma mchis shing /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba yang kun rdzob tu bstan pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par ni de yang mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa'o // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab dpag tu ma mchis gzhal du ma mchis shing /
translated: In order to eliminate such a conception, it is taught that even what is called equal to the unequaled is merely a conventional expression, but ultimately that also is not observed.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa mi dmigs pa lags zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa mi dmigs pa lags zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He asks, Blessed One, why is form inconceivable, immeasurable, incomparable, and not observed as equal to the unequaled?

original: de ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsam gyis mi khyab dpag tu ma mchis gzhal du ma mchis shing mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa mi dmigs pa lags zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsam gyis mi khyab dpag tu ma mchis gzhal du ma mchis shing mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa mi dmigs pa lags zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Why is the knowledge of all aspects inconceivable, immeasurable, incomparable, and equal to the unequalled?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa mi dmigs pa'i don de nyid zhib tu bshad cing 'khor rnams kyis brtan par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa mi dmigs pa'i don de nyid zhib tu bshad cing 'khor rnams kyis brtan par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: This is Subhūti's question in order to explain in detail the meaning of the inconceivability, immeasurability, incomparability, and non-apprehension of equality with the unequalled of all phenomena such as form, and in order to make the retinue firmly understand.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor gzugs la yang bsam pa dang / dpag pa dang / tshad dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs la yang bsam pa dang / dpag pa dang / tshad dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti, in form, thought, measure, extent, equality, and non-equality are not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang bsam pa dang dpag pa dang tshad dang mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang bsam pa dang dpag pa dang tshad dang mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Up to “Subhūti, in the knowledge of all aspects, an intention, an evaluation, a measure, an equal, or an unequal is not apprehended.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la dngos po zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la dngos po zhig yod na ni /
translated: If all phenomena such as form and so on were things,

original: sems kyis bsam zhing dpag pa'am /
analyzed: sems kyis bsam zhing dpag pa'am /
translated: they could be intended and evaluated by the mind,🔽or sought with a measure and equalized.

original: tshad kyis btsal zhing mnyam du yang rung na don dam par dngos po med pas de lta bu mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshad kyis btsal zhing mnyam du yang rung na don dam par dngos po med pas de lta bu mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: But ultimately, since they are not things, such [equalization] is not apprehended.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du @115b gzugs la bsam pa dang dpag pa dang tshad dang mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa mi dmigs pa lags zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du @115b gzugs la bsam pa dang dpag pa dang tshad dang mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa mi dmigs pa lags zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Bhagavān, why is an intention, an evaluation, a measure, an equal, or an unequal not apprehended in form?”

original: ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bsam pa dang dpag pa dang tshad dang mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa mi dmigs pa lags zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bsam pa dang dpag pa dang tshad dang mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa mi dmigs pa lags zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Up to “Why is an intention, an evaluation, a measure, an equal, or an unequal not apprehended in the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la bsam pa dang dpag pa dang tshad dang mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa'i don don de nyid zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la bsam pa dang dpag pa dang tshad dang mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa'i don don de nyid zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: In order to explain in detail the meaning of the inconceivability, the immeasurability, the incomparable-ness, the equality, and the inequality of all phenomena such as form, Subhūti asks the question that introduces the topic.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid bsam gyis mi khyab dpag tu med /🔽gzhal du med la /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid bsam gyis mi khyab dpag tu med / gzhal du med la /
translated: Subhūti, the essence of form is inconceivable, immeasurable,🔽incomparable,

original: mi mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ste /
translated: and unequalled.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la bsam pa dang dpag pa dang tshad dang mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la bsam pa dang dpag pa dang tshad dang mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Therefore, the conception, the imagination, the measurement, the equality, and the inequality of form are not apprehended.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bsam pa dang dpag pa dang tshad dang mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bsam pa dang dpag pa dang tshad dang mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Therefore, the conception, the imagination, the measurement, the equality, and the inequality of omniscience are not apprehended.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: All phenomena such as form are ultimately empty by nature.

original: dngos po med pas bsam pa dang dpag pa dang gzhal du mi rung ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pas bsam pa dang dpag pa dang gzhal du mi rung ste /
translated: Since it is not a thing, it is not suitable to be thought, imagined, or assessed.

original: de'i phyir bsam pa dang dpag pa dang tshad dang mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam pa dang dpag pa dang tshad dang mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, thought, imagination, measure, equality, and inequality are not apprehended.”

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: gzugs gang bsam gyis mi khyab dpag tu med gzhal du med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs gang bsam gyis mi khyab dpag tu med gzhal du med pa ste /
translated: Is the form that is inconceivable, immeasurable, and cannot be appraised

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa de la gzugs dmigs su yod dam zhes bya ba nas /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang bsam gyis /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa de la gzugs dmigs su yod dam zhes bya ba nas / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang bsam gyis /
translated: and is equal to the unequaled apprehended?”🔽“Subhūti, what do you think?

original: mi khyab dpag tu med gzhal tu med pa ste /🔽mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs su yod dam zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: mi khyab dpag tu med gzhal tu med pa ste /🔽mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs su yod dam zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Is the knowledge of all aspects that is inconceivable, immeasurable, and cannot be appraised🔽and is equal to the unequaled apprehended?”

original: gong du chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa bshad pa'i don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gong du chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa bshad pa'i don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clearly demonstrate the meaning of the above explanation of all phenomena as inconceivable, immeasurable, incalculable, and equal to the unequaled,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor la smras pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor la smras pa ste /
translated: the Bhagavān said to Subhūti:

original: 'khor gyi nang na kha cig de ltar chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab /🔽dpag tu med /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang na kha cig de ltar chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab / dpag tu med /
translated: In the assembly, some may think, 'All phenomena are said to be inconceivable,🔽immeasurable,

original: gzhal du med /
analyzed: gzhal du med /
translated: incalculable,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba de la dngos po 'ga' @116a * //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba de la dngos po 'ga' @116a * //
translated: and equal to the unequaled. Do they have any substance?'

original: zhig yod dam snyam du sems dpa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhig yod dam snyam du sems dpa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel such thoughts,

original: gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de la gzugs kyi dngos po dmigs su yod dam zhes smras pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de la gzugs kyi dngos po dmigs su yod dam zhes smras pa ste /
translated: he said, In the inconceivability, immeasurability, incalculability, and equality to the unequaled of form, is the substance of form to be found?

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba de nyid dngos po med pa'i rnam grangs yin pas /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba de nyid dngos po med pa'i rnam grangs yin pas /
translated: The words inconceivable, immeasurable, infinite, and equal to the unequaled are synonyms for non-entity.

original: de la gzugs kyi dngos po dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi dngos po dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the entity of form is not apprehended is that.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to feeling, etc., up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, it is not.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa gang yin pa de la gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po gang yang dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa gang yin pa de la gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po gang yang dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the entity of form, etc., up to the knowledge of all aspects, is not apprehended is that in the inconceivable, immeasurable, infinite, and equal to the unequaled dharmas, from form up to the knowledge of all aspects, no entity of form, etc., is apprehended.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, it is not.

original: rab 'byor de bas na rnam grangs 'dis chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab /🔽dpag tu med /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bas na rnam grangs 'dis chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab / dpag tu med /
translated: Subhūti, therefore, by this method all dharmas are inconceivable,🔽incalculable,

original: gzhal du med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhal du med pa ste /
translated: and immeasurable,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽gong du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad re re nas so sor phye ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba ni / gong du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad re re nas so sor phye ste /
translated: and equal to the unequaled.🔽Subhūti, the Tathāgata's Tathāgata dharmas are inconceivable because they are free from thought, and so on.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i don bshad pa de nyid mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i don bshad pa de nyid mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: This is a brief teaching on the meaning of inconceivability and so on, which was explained above in detail for each of the dharmas such as form.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos 'di dag ni bsam pa dang bral ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos 'di dag ni bsam pa dang bral ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The Tathāgata's Tathāgata dharmas are inconceivable because they are free from thought, and so on.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i don gong du bshad pa zhib tu 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i don gong du bshad pa zhib tu 'grel pa ste /
translated: This is an extensive commentary on the meaning of inconceivability, incalculability, immeasurability, and equality to the unequaled, which was explained above.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos dag ni zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos dag ni zhes bya ba /
translated: The Tathāgata's Tathāgata dharmas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshig lan gnyis smos pa gong ma ni de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud cing bshad pa'i chos rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshig lan gnyis smos pa gong ma ni de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud cing bshad pa'i chos rnams la bya'o //
translated: The phrase “thus have I heard” is stated twice, the first time referring to the teachings realized and explained by the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs @116b pa'i chos 'di dag ni zhes bya ba'i tshig 'og ma ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis yon tan brnyes pa'i chos sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba /🔽gong du smos pa rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @116b pa'i chos 'di dag ni zhes bya ba'i tshig 'og ma ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis yon tan brnyes pa'i chos sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba / gong du smos pa rnams la bya ste /
translated: The second time it refers to the teachings of the Tathāgata himself, that is, to the qualities of buddhahood, such as the attainment of the qualities of the Tathāgata, such as the state of being a tathāgata, self-arisen one, and the state of being an all-knowing one.🔽The phrase “these teachings of the Tathāgata” refers to the above-mentioned teachings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag bsam pa dang bral ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag bsam pa dang bral ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are inconceivable because they are free of thought.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag la sems pa'i bsam pa nyid kyang dngos po med de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag la sems pa'i bsam pa nyid kyang dngos po med de /
translated: The thought of those buddha qualities is also a nonentity.

original: de ltar bsam pa dang bral ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsam pa dang bral ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, because they are free of thought, they are taught to be inconceivable.

original: dpag pa dang bral ba'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o /
analyzed: dpag pa dang bral ba'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o /
translated: They are immeasurable because they are beyond measure.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos de dag la dpog pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid kyang dngos po med pa'i phyir dpag tu med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos de dag la dpog pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid kyang dngos po med pa'i phyir dpag tu med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that those phenomena are immeasurable because the conceptualization of their measure does not exist.🔽They are beyond calculation because they are beyond calculation.

original: tshad dang bral ba'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tshad mas 'jal zhing gtan la 'bebs pa nyid kyang dngos po med pa'i phyir gzhal du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshad dang bral ba'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tshad mas 'jal zhing gtan la 'bebs pa nyid kyang dngos po med pa'i phyir gzhal du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that they are beyond calculation because the calculation and determination by means of direct perception, inference, etc., do not exist.

original: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are equal to the unequaled because they are beyond equality and inequality.

original: don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas /🔽mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad las 'das pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas / mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad las 'das pa'i phyir /
translated: This means that ultimately all phenomena are not things,🔽and therefore they are beyond the conventions of equality and inequality.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, they are called “equal to the unequaled.”

original: skabs 'dir yang mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la bya ste /
analyzed: skabs 'dir yang mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la bya ste /
translated: Here also, “equal to the unequaled” refers to the Tathāgata himself, who is the nature of emptiness.

original: de dang mnyam pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang mnyam pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Equal to him” means “equal to the nature of emptiness.”

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na /
translated: Subhūti, for these reasons

original: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: all phenomena are inconceivable,

original: dpag tu med /🔽gzhal du med pa ste /
analyzed: dpag tu med / gzhal du med pa ste /
translated: immeasurable,🔽and incomparable.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Equal to the unequaled”🔽means that the phenomena of the Tathāgata—

original: de ltar sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba /
translated: buddhahood, the Tathāgata, self-arising, and omniscience—🔽are inconceivable, immeasurable, incomparable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyang bsam gyis mi khyab /🔽dpag tu med /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyang bsam gyis mi khyab / dpag tu med /
translated: In the same way, all phenomena, such as form, are inconceivable,🔽immeasurable,

original: gzhal du med /
analyzed: gzhal du med /
translated: incomparable,🔽and equal to the unequaled.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and equal to the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor @117a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor @117a * //
translated: Subhūti,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos 'di dag ni /🔽bsam pa las yongs su 'das pas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos 'di dag ni / bsam pa las yongs su 'das pas na /
translated: these dharmas of a tathāgata, a tathāgata’s dharmas,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: are inconceivable because they transcend thought.

original: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa las yongs su 'das pas na /
analyzed: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa las yongs su 'das pas na /
translated: They are equal to the unequaled because they transcend the equal and the unequal.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i don gong du bshad pa de nyid tshig gi rnam grangs gzhan gyis bshad pa ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i don gong du bshad pa de nyid tshig gi rnam grangs gzhan gyis bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the meaning of inconceivable and so on, which was explained above, with other synonyms.

original: bsam pa dang bral ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig dang don de nyid bsam pa las yongs su 'das pas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan na /
analyzed: bsam pa dang bral ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig dang don de nyid bsam pa las yongs su 'das pas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan na /
translated: The words and meaning “inconceivable because free from thought” are taught with the words “inconceivable because they transcend thought.”

original: chos nyan pa'i 'khor kha cig la go bar sla ba'i phyir de skad bstan te /
analyzed: chos nyan pa'i 'khor kha cig la go bar sla ba'i phyir de skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught in order to make it easy to understand for some members of the audience who are listening to the dharma.

original: sems pa dang / bsam par bya ba gnyis ka yang don dam par dngos po med pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems pa dang / bsam par bya ba gnyis ka yang don dam par dngos po med pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since both the mind and the object of the mind are ultimately unreal, it is called “inconceivable.”

original: de bzhin du dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, it should be applied to “immeasurable,” “incalculable,” and “equal to the unequalled.”

original: rab 'byor bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba 'di ni bsam du med pa'i tshig bla dgas so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba 'di ni bsam du med pa'i tshig bla dgas so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti, this “inconceivable” is a synonym for “cannot be conceived,” and so on up to

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas mnyam pa med pa'i tshig bla dgas te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas mnyam pa med pa'i tshig bla dgas te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: “equal to the unequalled” is a synonym for “cannot be compared.”

original: de ltar chos thams cad bsam pa la sogs pa las yongs su 'das nas /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad bsam pa la sogs pa las yongs su 'das nas /
translated: Thus, all phenomena, having transcended thought and so on,🔽what is there to express with words such as “inconceivable” and so on?

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i tshig tu brjod du yang ci yod snyam du 'khor gyi nang na kha cig sems dpa'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i tshig tu brjod du yang ci yod snyam du 'khor gyi nang na kha cig sems dpa'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Some in the assembly thought this and had doubts. To dispel their doubts, the Bhagavān said,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa yang kun rdzob tu 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam du tshig bla dgas su btags par zad kyi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa yang kun rdzob tu 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam du tshig bla dgas su btags par zad kyi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The expression inconceivable and so on is merely a conventional expression in the world, in the relative sense, but not in the ultimate sense.

original: rab 'byor bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba ni nam mkha' bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba ni nam mkha' bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti, inconceivable means because space is inconceivable, and so on up to...

original: nam mkha' mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: because space is equal to the unequaled.

original: dngos po med pa las tshig bla dgas su btags pa'i dpe bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa las tshig bla dgas su btags pa'i dpe bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the example of a designation from a non-entity.

original: dper na nam mkha' la bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i tshig tu brjod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i tshig tu brjod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: For example, in space, which is a non-entity, the words inconceivable and so on are expressed as inconceivable and so on.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i de @117b bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i de @117b bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: Subhūti, those Tathāgata dharmas of the Tathāgata are inconceivable,...

original: dpag tu med pa /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa /
translated: immeasurable,

original: gzhal du med pa /
analyzed: gzhal du med pa /
translated: They are immeasurable,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: and equal to the unequaled.

original: de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis bsam pa'am dpag par mi nus te /
analyzed: de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis bsam pa'am dpag par mi nus te /
translated: The world with its gods, humans, and asuras is not able to conceive of or measure them.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams ni gzhal du med do //
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams ni gzhal du med do //
translated: Thus, the buddhas are immeasurable.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni gzhal du med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni gzhal du med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The buddhadharmas are immeasurable.

original: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa gong du bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa gong du bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa ste /
translated: This is a summary and teaching of the meaning of the above explanations of all phenomena being inconceivable, immeasurable, unappraisable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas bsam zhing dpag par bya ba'i dngos po yang med /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas bsam zhing dpag par bya ba'i dngos po yang med /
translated: Ultimately, all phenomena are empty by nature, so there is no thing to be conceived of or measured.

original: sems shing dpog par byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems shing dpog par byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: There is also no mind or mental factors that conceive of or measure.

original: sus kyang bsam zhing dpag tu mi rung ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sus kyang bsam zhing dpag tu mi rung ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that no one is able to conceive of or measure them.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams ni gzhal du med do zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul gyis ni /
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams ni gzhal du med do zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul gyis ni /
translated: Thus, the buddhas are immeasurable means that, in the manner explained above,🔽buddhahood, thusness, self-origination and the tathiigatagarbha are🔽inconceivable,

original: sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ces bya ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ces bya ba /
translated: immeasurable and🔽unappraisable.🔽The qualities of the tathiigatagarbha are inconceivable,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: immeasurable and🔽unappraisable.🔽The qualities of the tathiigatagarbha are inconceivable,🔽immeasurable and🔽unappraisable.🔽The qualities of the tathiigatagarbha are inconceivable,

original: dpag tu med /
analyzed: dpag tu med /
translated: immeasurable and🔽unappraisable.🔽The qualities of the tathiigatagarbha are inconceivable,🔽immeasurable and

original: gzhal du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: unappraisable.🔽The qualities of the tathiigatagarbha are inconceivable,🔽immeasurable and🔽unappraisable.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni gzhal du med do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud cing bshad pa'i chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni gzhal du med do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud cing bshad pa'i chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: The qualities of the tathiigatagarbha are inconceivable,

original: dpag tu med /
analyzed: dpag tu med /
translated: immeasurable and🔽unappraisable.🔽The qualities of the tathiigatagarbha are inconceivable,🔽immeasurable and

original: gzhal du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: unappraisable.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i le'u 'di bstan pa'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i le'u 'di bstan pa'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Thus, when the Lord taught this chapter on the inconceivable, immeasurable, incomparable, and equal to the unequalled Tathagatas, at that time, etc.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos zab mo bshad pa'i don yod pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos zab mo bshad pa'i don yod pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the meaning of the existence of the inconceivable, profound Dharma teaching.

original: dge slong lnga brgya nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: dge slong lnga brgya nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: The minds of five hundred monks were liberated from the defilements without further appropriation.

original: dge slong brgya phrag nyi shus nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba ni /🔽dge slong dang dge slong ma de snyed cig gis phung po phyi ma len pa med par nyon mongs pa rnams las sems rnam par grol te /
analyzed: dge slong brgya phrag nyi shus nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba ni / dge slong dang dge slong ma de snyed cig gis phung po phyi ma len pa med par nyon mongs pa rnams las sems rnam par grol te /
translated: The minds of two hundred monks were liberated from the defilements without further appropriation.

original: phyir @118a * //
analyzed: phyir @118a * //
translated: This means that the minds of that many monks and nuns were liberated from the defilements without further appropriation of the aggregates.

original: mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They attained the fruits of non-returner and arhatship.

original: dge bsnyen pha stong phrag drug cu dang / dge bsnyen ma stong phrag sum cu ni /
analyzed: dge bsnyen pha stong phrag drug cu dang / dge bsnyen ma stong phrag sum cu ni /
translated: 60,000 male and 30,000 female lay vow holders

original: chos rnams la rdul dang bral zhing dri ma dang bral ba'i chos kyi mig rnam par dag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos rnams la rdul dang bral zhing dri ma dang bral ba'i chos kyi mig rnam par dag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Dharma eye, free of dust and stainless, was purified in them.

original: dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of male and female lay vow holders:

original: khrims brgyad pa dang / khrims lnga pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed nas dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song ba ste /
analyzed: khrims brgyad pa dang / khrims lnga pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed nas dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song ba ste /
translated: those who observe the eight precepts, those who observe the five precepts, and those who have generated the mind of awakening and gone for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: de dag gis 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta ba ngan pa'i rdul dang bral zhing 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bral te /
analyzed: de dag gis 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta ba ngan pa'i rdul dang bral zhing 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bral te /
translated: They are free of the dust of bad views such as the view of the transitory collection and free of the stains of desire realm attachment, anger, and so on.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa dam pa'i chos la lta ba yongs su dag par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa dam pa'i chos la lta ba yongs su dag par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the view of the sublime Dharma, such as the four noble truths, becomes completely pure.

original: byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag nyi shus ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag nyi shus ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Twenty thousand bodhisattvas attained forbearance with respect to the non-arising of dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa la sogs pa de snyed cig gis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa la sogs pa de snyed cig gis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste /
translated: This teaches that that many bodhisattvas abiding on the stage of practice through belief attained forbearance with respect to the non-arising of dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa la gnas par gyur to zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa la gnas par gyur to zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They came to abide on the eighth bodhisattva stage.

original: de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Bhagavat prophesied that they would become buddhas in this fortunate eon.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob cing sa brgyad pa la gnas par gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag da lta'i bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar lung bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob cing sa brgyad pa la gnas par gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag da lta'i bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar lung bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the Bhagavat prophesied that those bodhisattvas who attained forbearance with respect to the non-arising of dharmas and came to abide on the eighth stage would become buddhas in this very fortunate eon.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u sum cu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u sum cu bzhi pa'o /
translated: This concludes chapter thirty-four of the extensive commentary on the perfection of wisdom in ten thousand lines, called The Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab pa ste /
translated: Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don chen po'i slad du nye bar gnas pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don chen po'i slad du nye bar gnas pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom abides for the sake of the great meaning.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di gong du bshad pa'i rim pa ltar don chen po byed cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i don dang ldan pa nyid yang @118b bzlas te brjod nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di gong du bshad pa'i rim pa ltar don chen po byed cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i don dang ldan pa nyid yang @118b bzlas te brjod nas /
translated: This is a repetition of the profound perfection of wisdom's performance of the great meaning, as explained above, and its possession of the inconceivable, immeasurable, incalculable, and equal-to-the-unequalled meaning.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i nang du /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i nang du /
translated: Within this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad 'dus pa dang / rgyal po chen po'i dgongs pa thams cad blon pos byed pa'i dpes /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad 'dus pa dang / rgyal po chen po'i dgongs pa thams cad blon pos byed pa'i dpes /
translated: The five perfections and so forth, all the phenomena of purification, are included in it, and all the intentions of a great king are carried out by his ministers.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi dgos pa thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'ba' zhig byed pa bstan pa'i sgo nas don chen po byed par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi dgos pa thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'ba' zhig byed pa bstan pa'i sgo nas don chen po byed par bstan pa ste /
translated: The teaching that this profound perfection of wisdom alone accomplishes all the purposes of all the buddhadharmas demonstrates that it performs a great purpose.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab pa ste /🔽bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don chen po'i slad du nye bar gnas pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab pa ste / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don chen po'i slad du nye bar gnas pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In this regard, the Bhagavan said, “This perfection of wisdom is profound.🔽Bhagavan, this perfection of wisdom abides for the sake of a great purpose.🔽This perfection of wisdom abides for the sake of an incomparable purpose.🔽This perfection of wisdom abides for the sake of an immeasurable purpose.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: This perfection of wisdom abides for the sake of an unsurpassed purpose.🔽This perfection of wisdom abides for the sake of an equalized purpose.🔽This perfection of wisdom abides for the sake of an unequaled purpose.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis don chen po mdzad pa rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis don chen po mdzad pa rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: The great meaning of this perfection of wisdom is stated by Subhūti:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de bden no zhes bka' stsal pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de bden no zhes bka' stsal pa ste /
translated: The Lord has said, “That is so!”

original: don chen po dang don bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i don ni sngar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: don chen po dang don bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i don ni sngar bshad pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the great meaning, the inconceivable meaning, and so on, has been explained above.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'dus so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'dus so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Subhūti, in this profound perfection of wisdom, the five perfections are included, up to the knowledge of all aspects is included.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don chen po mdzad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don chen po mdzad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the reason why this perfection of wisdom has a great meaning.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyi dgos pa /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyi dgos pa /
translated: The purpose of all the phenomena of purification, such as the six perfections,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'ba' zhig byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'ba' zhig byed pa'i phyir /
translated: is accomplished solely by this perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di don chen po byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di don chen po byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that this profound perfection of wisdom performs a great purpose.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti, it is thus:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is present because it performs an unequalled deed.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don chen po byed pa'i dpe bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don chen po byed pa'i dpe bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage teaches the example of this perfection of wisdom performing a great purpose.

original: dper na rgyal po chen po'i don thams cad blon pos byed pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi bya ba theg pa che chung gsum char gyi dgos pa thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis byed pa'i phyir don chen po byed pa yin
analyzed: dper na rgyal po chen po'i don thams cad blon pos byed pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi bya ba theg pa che chung gsum char gyi dgos pa thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis byed pa'i phyir don chen po byed pa yin
translated: Just as a great king’s ministers perform all his purposes, in the same way, this perfection of wisdom performs all the purposes of the deeds of the buddhas, of the three vehicles of the Great, Middle, and Lesser Vehicles.

original: @119a * // no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: @119a * // no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that it performs a great purpose.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dis gzugs yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par chags pa med pa nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di don chen po byed pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dis gzugs yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par chags pa med pa nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di don chen po byed pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the reason why this deep perfection of wisdom performs great service.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mnyan pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad stong par rtogs na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mnyan pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad stong par rtogs na /
translated: If one listens to, reflects on, and meditates on this deep perfection of wisdom, one will understand that ultimately all dharmas are empty.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la sred pa'i dbang gis yongs su 'dzin par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la sred pa'i dbang gis yongs su 'dzin par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Then one will not appropriate form, etc., through craving for dharmas such as form.

original: lta ba log pa'i phyogs la mngon par chags par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lta ba log pa'i phyogs la mngon par chags par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And one will not cling to the side of false views.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di don chen po byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di don chen po byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: Therefore this deep perfection of wisdom performs great service.

original: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is with form, so it is with the knowledge of path aspects and so on up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzugs yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis pa dang mngon par chags pa ma mchis pa nye bar gnas pa lags zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzugs yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis pa dang mngon par chags pa ma mchis pa nye bar gnas pa lags zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He asks, “Blessed One, how is this perfection of wisdom present as the non-apprehension and non-adherence of form?”

original: ji ltar na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis pa dang / mngon par chags pa ma mchis pas nye bar gnas pa lags zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: ji ltar na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis pa dang / mngon par chags pa ma mchis pas nye bar gnas pa lags zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: And so on up to, “How is it present as the non-apprehension and non-adherence of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: yongs su gzung bar bya ba dang / mngon par chags par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / mngon par chags par byed pa'i byed pa po dang / gang gis yongs su gzung bar bya ba dang / mngon par chags par bya ba'i sems kyang dngos po med par bstan pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar bya ba dang / mngon par chags par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / mngon par chags par byed pa'i byed pa po dang / gang gis yongs su gzung bar bya ba dang / mngon par chags par bya ba'i sems kyang dngos po med par bstan pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: and the things to be fully grasped and to be attached to, and the agent who fully grasps and attaches, and the mind by which one is to fully grasp and attach, are also taught as non-entities, in order to introduce the topic.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /🔽khyod kyi gzugs gang yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems / khyod kyi gzugs gang yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?🔽Do you see any form that is to be fully grasped or🔽attached to?

original: mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu mthong ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu mthong ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: and so on.

original: ji ltar na yongs su bzung ba ma mchis pa dang / mngon par chags pa ma @119b mchis pa lags zhes rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na yongs su bzung ba ma mchis pa dang / mngon par chags pa ma @119b mchis pa lags zhes rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains in detail the meaning of what Subhūti asked: How is it that there is no grasping and no attachment?

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa la gang yongs su bzung bar bya ba'i dngos po dang / 'dzin par byed pa'i byed pa po dang / 'dzin pa'i sems de lta bu'i dngos po yod dam zhes rab 'byor la slar dris pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa la gang yongs su bzung bar bya ba'i dngos po dang / 'dzin par byed pa'i byed pa po dang / 'dzin pa'i sems de lta bu'i dngos po yod dam zhes rab 'byor la slar dris pa ste /
translated: The ultimate, in which all phenomena are empty by nature, is asked by Subhuti: Is there such a thing as an entity that is to be fully grasped, an agent that grasps, and a mind that grasps?

original: de lta bu'i dngos po gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de la gzugs gang yongs su gzung bar bya ba 'am /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dngos po gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to // de la gzugs gang yongs su gzung bar bya ba 'am /
translated: The meaning is that there is no such entity at all.🔽In that regard, Have you seen such a form that is to be fully grasped or to which one might become attached?

original: mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu mthong ngam zhes bya bas ni gzung ba'i dngos po med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu mthong ngam zhes bya bas ni gzung ba'i dngos po med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that there is no entity to be grasped.

original: chos gang yang yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / mngon par chags par byed pa'am zhes bya bas ni 'dzin par byed pa'i byed pa po med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang yang yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / mngon par chags par byed pa'am zhes bya bas ni 'dzin par byed pa'i byed pa po med par bstan pa'o //
translated: By saying Any dharma that fully grasps or to which one might become attached, it shows that there is no agent that grasps.

original: yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar bya ba'am /
translated: That which is to be fully grasped or to which one might become attached,

original: mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu yang mthong ngam zhes bya bas ni 'dzin pa med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu yang mthong ngam zhes bya bas ni 'dzin pa med par bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase Do you see any such thing as that which is to be appropriated? indicates the absence of grasping.

original: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it was explained in the case of form, so it should be applied up to the knowledge of path aspects and unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor legs so legs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor legs so legs so //
translated: Subhūti, excellent, excellent!

original: rab 'byor ngas kyang gzugs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor ngas kyang gzugs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
translated: Subhūti, I also do not see form as real.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas yongs su mi 'dzin /🔽yongs su mi 'dzin pas nye bar mi len to zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yongs su gzung bar bya ba dang / mngon par chags par bya ba med pa'i don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas yongs su mi 'dzin / yongs su mi 'dzin pas nye bar mi len to zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yongs su gzung bar bya ba dang / mngon par chags par bya ba med pa'i don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: Since I do not see it as real, I do not grasp it.🔽Since I do not grasp it, I do not appropriate it.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ste /
translated: In this way, the Blessed One spoke in order to clarify the meaning of the absence of appropriation and attachment.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis kyang yang dag par mi gzigs te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis kyang yang dag par mi gzigs te /
translated: Since all phenomena, such as form, are ultimately empty of intrinsic reality, the Lord himself does not see them as real.

original: de ltar yang dag par mi gzigs pas /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag par mi gzigs pas /
translated: And since he does not see them as real,

original: sred pa'i dbang gis yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sred pa'i dbang gis yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur /
translated: he does not grasp them through the power of craving.

original: de ltar yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / lta ba'i dbang gis nye bar len par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / lta ba'i dbang gis nye bar len par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And since he does not grasp them, he does not appropriate them through the power of views.

original: mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de @120a * //
analyzed: mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de @120a * //
translated: The meaning is that he does not become attached.

original: bzhin gshegs pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is explained with regard to form, so it should be applied up to the knowledge of all aspects and the state of a tathāgata.

original: rab 'byor de lta bas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor de lta bas na /
translated: Subhūti, therefore,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzugs la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzugs la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva should not become attached to form,

original: yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: should not grasp at it, and so on up to

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not grasp at him.

original: yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: By this passage, it is taught that all things are empty by their intrinsic reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang ma gzigs shing yongs su mi 'dzin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang ma gzigs shing yongs su mi 'dzin /
translated: The Tathagata does not see them, does not grasp at them,🔽and does not take them up.

original: nye bar blang du med pas rab 'byor khyod kyis kyang chos thams cad la mngon par chags pa dang / yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o zhes rjes su gdams te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar blang du med pas rab 'byor khyod kyis kyang chos thams cad la mngon par chags pa dang / yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o zhes rjes su gdams te bstan pa'o //
translated: Subhuti, you should not settle down on or grasp at any dharma.

original: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mngon par chags pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i don zab mo lha'i bu dag gis thos nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing blta dka' ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas bstod pa ste /
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mngon par chags pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i don zab mo lha'i bu dag gis thos nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing blta dka' ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas bstod pa ste /
translated: Then, the sons of gods who live in the desire realm and the form realm said to the Lord, “So it is,” and so forth. Having heard the profound meaning of non-attachment and non-grasping, the sons of gods praise this perfection of wisdom in terms of its profundity, difficulty of seeing, and so on.

original: de la zab pa ni mu stegs can dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i blos ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la zab pa ni mu stegs can dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i blos ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, profundity is because it is not realized by the minds of tīrthikas, śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on.

original: de ltar zab pa'i phyir blta dka' ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zab pa'i phyir blta dka' ba'o //
translated: Because of being so profound, it is difficult to see.

original: blta dka' ba'i phyir rtogs par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: blta dka' ba'i phyir rtogs par dka' ba'o //
translated: Because it is difficult to see, it is difficult to realize.

original: rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir mi brtag pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir mi brtag pa'o //
translated: Because it is difficult to realize, it is not to be examined.

original: mi brtag pa'i phyir brtag pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o zhes tshig snga mas phyi ma bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: mi brtag pa'i phyir brtag pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o zhes tshig snga mas phyi ma bshad par bya'o //
translated: Because it is not to be examined, it is not an object of examination. The later words should be explained by the earlier ones.

original: zhi zhing phra ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pas brtag pa'i spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: zhi zhing phra ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pas brtag pa'i spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: “Peaceful and subtle” means that it is not the domain of investigation by śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad zhi zhing gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha dang bral ba'i phyir phra ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad zhi zhing gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha dang bral ba'i phyir phra ba'o //
translated: It is subtle because all conceptual elaborations are pacified and it is free from the aspects of apprehendeds and apprehenders.

original: mkhas pa dang bzang ba dang yid gsal bas 'tshal bar bgyi'o zhes bya bas ni de ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pas shes par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa dang bzang ba dang yid gsal bas 'tshal bar bgyi'o zhes bya bas ni de ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pas shes par mi nus pa ste /
translated: “It is to be known by the wise, the good, and the clear-minded” means that it cannot be known by śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel ba mkhas pa dag gis shes par nus kyi gzhan gyis shes par mi nus so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel ba mkhas pa dag gis shes par nus kyi gzhan gyis shes par mi nus so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that it can be known by bodhisattvas who are wise in the union of method and wisdom, but it cannot be known by others.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can gang @120b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos pa de dag ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bgyi ba bgyis pa'o zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can gang @120b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos pa de dag ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bgyi ba bgyis pa'o zhes bya bas ni /
translated: “Blessed One, those sentient beings who are devoted to this profound perfection of wisdom have served the victors of the past.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la dad cing spyod pa'i sems can dkon pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la dad cing spyod pa'i sems can dkon pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that it is rare for beings to have faith in and practice this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur byed byed pa rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la dad cing spyod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur byed byed pa rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la dad cing spyod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Those who have served the Tathagatas of the past will have faith in and practice this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: gzhan rnams de ltar dad cing spyod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams de ltar dad cing spyod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Others will not have faith in and practice it.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos pa de dag ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o zhes bya bas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos pa de dag ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o zhes bya bas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab
translated: Blessed One, those beings who aspire to this profound perfection of wisdom have been accepted by spiritual friends and have planted the roots of virtue, thus it is taught.

original: mo 'di la dad cing spyod pa'i sems can dkon pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mo 'di la dad cing spyod pa'i sems can dkon pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that it is rare for beings to have faith in and practice this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: tshe 'di dang tshe snga ma gnyis ka la dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten brten pa dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la dad cing spyod par 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: tshe 'di dang tshe snga ma gnyis ka la dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten brten pa dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la dad cing spyod par 'gyur gyis /
translated: Those who have relied on a spiritual friend in this life and in previous lives, and have accumulated the collection of merit, will have faith in and practice this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: de lta ma yin pa gzhan dag ni dad cing spyod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa gzhan dag ni dad cing spyod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o // bcom ldan 'das gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ces bya ba nas /
translated: Those who are not like that will not have faith in and practice it.

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la gdugs gcig tu mos pa de nyid ches legs pa'i mchog tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la dad cing spyod pa bsod nams
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la gdugs gcig tu mos pa de nyid ches legs pa'i mchog tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la dad cing spyod pa bsod nams
translated: Blessed One, if all the sentient beings in the great trichiliocosm world system, however many there are, were to practice the perfection of generosity for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River, and if they were to practice the perfections of discipline, patience, diligence, and concentration in the same way, and if they were to practice the perfection of wisdom for one day, that would be the best, the most excellent.

original: che zhing don che ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: che zhing don che ba bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage teaches that those who have faith in and practice this profound perfection of wisdom have great merit and great benefit.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos rtogs pa'i ye shes ji tsam yod pa dang / nyon mongs pa spangs ba'i yon tan dang / bsod nams ji tsam yod pa de dag thams cad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la dad cing mos pas /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos rtogs pa'i ye shes ji tsam yod pa dang / nyon mongs pa spangs ba'i yon tan dang / bsod nams ji tsam yod pa de dag thams cad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la dad cing mos pas /
translated: The merit and good qualities of the wisdom that realizes the Dharma and the merit and good qualities of the abandonment of defilements of as many śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas as there are sentient beings in the worlds of the great trichiliocosm, all of that is surpassed by the merit and good qualities of one day’s practice of faith and interest in this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: nyin gcig spyad pa'i bsod nams dang phan yon che'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyin gcig spyad pa'i bsod nams dang phan yon che'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that the merit and benefits of one day’s practice of faith and interest in this profound perfection of wisdom is greater than all of that.

original: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni nyan thos shes rab rtul po dang rnon po la bya ste /
analyzed: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni nyan thos shes rab rtul po dang rnon po la bya ste /
translated: “Follower of faith” and “follower of reality” refer to śrāvakas of dull and sharp faculties, respectively.

original: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ni nyan thos shes rab rtul po @121a * //
analyzed: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ni nyan thos shes rab rtul po @121a * //
translated: A follower of faith is a śrāvaka of dull faculties.

original: chos kyi don ma rtogs kyang /
analyzed: chos kyi don ma rtogs kyang /
translated: Even though they do not understand the meaning of the Dharma,

original: gang zag gzhan chos spyod pa mthong na dad pa skyes nas de dag gi rjes su 'brang zhing chos spyod pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag gzhan chos spyod pa mthong na dad pa skyes nas de dag gi rjes su 'brang zhing chos spyod pa la bya'o //
translated: When one sees other people practicing the Dharma, one should have faith in them and follow them, practicing the Dharma.

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni nyan thos shes rab rnon po bdag rang gis chos kyi don rtogs nas chos spyod pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni nyan thos shes rab rnon po bdag rang gis chos kyi don rtogs nas chos spyod pa'o //
translated: One who follows the Dharma is a Shravaka of sharp wisdom who, having realized the meaning of the Dharma by himself, practices the Dharma.

original: brgyad pa la sogs pa'i nyan thos kyi gang zag gzhan rnams ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: brgyad pa la sogs pa'i nyan thos kyi gang zag gzhan rnams ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The other Shravaka individuals, such as those on the eighth stage, have already been explained.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes gang ji tsam pa dang / spong ba gang ji tsam pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod par 'dus so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes gang ji tsam pa dang / spong ba gang ji tsam pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod par 'dus so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: To the extent that there is the wisdom of one who follows faith, and to the extent that there is abandonment, that is included in the acceptance of the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has attained acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes gang ji tsam pa dang / spong ba gang ji tsam pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod par 'dus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nyan thos dang /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes gang ji tsam pa dang / spong ba gang ji tsam pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod par 'dus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nyan thos dang /
translated: The wisdom and abandonment of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are included in the acceptance of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have attained acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena.”

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes dang spong ba'i phan yon pas byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la nyin gcig spyad pa'i phan yon che ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes dang spong ba'i phan yon pas byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la nyin gcig spyad pa'i phan yon che ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage explains the reason why the benefits of practicing the perfection of wisdom for a single day by a bodhisattva are greater than the benefits of the wisdom and abandonment of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: nyan thos dang rangs sangs rgyas rnams kyi so so'i 'bras bu thob ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rangs sangs rgyas rnams kyi so so'i 'bras bu thob ste /
translated: The śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas attain their individual results,

original: ye shes dang ldan zhing nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan mar bcas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ye shes dang ldan zhing nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan mar bcas pa yin gyi /
translated: and they possess wisdom and have abandoned the afflictions, but they do so with reference points and with characteristics.

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni don dam par chos thams cad skye ba med par rtogs nas chos zab mo la bzod par gyur cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni don dam par chos thams cad skye ba med par rtogs nas chos zab mo la bzod par gyur cing /
translated: The bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom, having realized that ultimately all phenomena are unborn, has become patient with the profound Dharma.

original: kun rdzob tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dad pas spyod pa mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing dmigs pa la ma chags pa'i phyir phan yon lhag par che'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dad pas spyod pa mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing dmigs pa la ma chags pa'i phyir phan yon lhag par che'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And because, on the conventional level, he practices with faith in the perfection of wisdom without apprehending signs and without attachment to reference points, the benefits are even greater.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag la bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag la bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the sons of gods who live in the desire realm and the form realm:

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gang yin pa ji tsam pa dang / spong ba gang ji tsam pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod par 'dus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du lha'i bu rnams kyis gsol pa'i tshig dang /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gang yin pa ji tsam pa dang / spong ba gang ji tsam pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod par 'dus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gong du lha'i bu rnams kyis gsol pa'i tshig dang /
translated: The wisdom of the pratyekabuddhas and the abandonment of the pratyekabuddhas are included in the acceptance of the bodhisattva mahāsattva who has attained acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena.”🔽In order to make the gods’ words and meaning above

original: don brtson @121b zhing 'khor rnams kyis brtan par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don brtson @121b zhing 'khor rnams kyis brtan par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: and the assembly’s firm conviction

original: de bden no zhes tshig gong ma nyid bzlas te bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: de bden no zhes tshig gong ma nyid bzlas te bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: true, he repeated the above words and said, “That is true.”

original: lha'i bu dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang su yang rung ste zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba'i mdo sde gzhan la bskal pa dang / bskal ba'i lhag mar spyad pa dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i mdo sde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang mi ldan pa la /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang su yang rung ste zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba'i mdo sde gzhan la bskal pa dang / bskal ba'i lhag mar spyad pa dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i mdo sde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang mi ldan pa la /
